name: Short North - Italianate Cottage
description:
Just steps from High Street and all the action, enjoy the entire house, and private patio! Less than a mile South from OSU Campus and less than a mile North from the Columbus Convention Center.

Our home was featured in Cincinnati Refined's article "6 Unforgettable AirBnB Getaways in Columbus!" (2015) and Columbus Business First "Most-desired Airbnb listings in Central Ohio" (2017). We have hosted over 200 parties! Check out our reviews!

The space
Great Short North Home which includes:

First floor: Two first floor bedrooms with queen beds and full bath, large living space and kitchen

Second floor: 350+ sqft open space with queen bed, private bathroom with huge OPEN shower, and large walk-in closet.

The house has central air, hardwood floors, stainless steel appliances and laundry facility. There is a fenced yard with a large patio! There is also a front porch. Permitted / Paid Parking is available on surrounding str
neighborhood_overview: The Short North Italianate Cottage is located in the Short North/ Italian Village neighborhood. Italian Village offers a plethora of breweries, coffee shops, and restaurants tucked within the neighborhood boarders and the Short North is a mile of Columbus's best art galleries, restaurants, nightlife, pubs, and shops! Less than a mile to OSU!!!
host_about:
Active, young professionals who love to travel and socialize! Audra loves to run, workout, and sip on adult beverages. 
Lacey loves to workout, check out local music & restaurants, and rescue any stray animal she sees.

name: Private queen bedroom 1 - N.Campus
description:
Private, second-floor queen bed with desk, plenty of windows, closet.
Bathroom/shower is shared, downstairs.

Room is upstairs, door on the right.

The space
Minimally furnished bedroom with a desk, walk in closet.

Bathroom will be on the first floor.
Washer and dryer are both located in the bathroom and are available for you to use at anytime.

You'll most likely be sharing the house with a couple others so expect people to be walking in and out going about their business daily and be courteous in the way of dishes, etc. Same goes for the kitchen appliances, fridge, cupboard space, etc.

Guest access
Guests have pretty much full access to everything. Shared bathroom on the first floor, shared kitchen & kitchen utensils, etc.

Other things to note
When your trashcans are full please dump them in the dumpsters outside.
The blue container, out front, is for recycling.
T
neighborhood_overview: We are close to a lot of things!
host_about:
Hello, hello.

About me: pretty easy going, basically.
Hobbies include gardening, woodworking, running, boxing, science, writing, photography, and some others.

That is all.

name: The Bellows' Studio Loft  (3rd floor apartment)
description:
Famous American artist George Bellows home with studio loft apartment, features a completely private oasis for two with private bath, kitchenette, dining and sitting areas. Walk to downtown with easy access to the freeway and public transportation. The homeowners are both artists and guests will enjoy the art that adorns the walls. There are several eateries within a 5 minute walk. And a new brewery!
Additionally, there are no security cameras in the unit.

The space
This historic home features a totally private and secure studio loft apartment, which is accessed through the spacious entry hallway. It has sitting and dining areas, bedroom with a queen size bed, kitchenette and private full bath. A quiet retreat with plenty of light and great views.
The entire property is tobacco-free.

Guest access
The back yard features gardens with several sitting areas and a pond. Guests are welcome to enjoy this quiet oasis from city life.
neighborhood_overview:
A historic neighborhood of beautiful victorian homes on lovely tree lined streets, located just a short walk from the downtown, the Main Library, Art Museum and Topiary Park (great for walking or jogging).
There are plenty of places to eat, drink and have fun only a few steps away ( bakery, coffee house, pizza parlor, tavern, restaurant, brewery and more.)
host_about:
My husband Eric and I are both artists, sharing studio space in our house. We have 2 daughters and 3 grandchildren, all of whom live in Columbus.  I've been a yoga teacher since 1988. I have taught at Yoga on High since it's inception in 2000 and earned my certification from Yoga Alliance of ERYT 500 at Yoga on High. I love sharing this ancient practice with all kinds of people. I have seen it have profound effects on people's lives. It is an honor and a responsibility for which I am very grateful. 
 Eric and I have lived in this historic home for over 35 years, in what we consider the best neighborhood in the city, Olde Towne. We love sharing our home with friends and now airbnb guests. We enjoy walking in the woods, gardening, biking, kayaking, reading and, of course, practicing yoga. 
We also love to travel. We've been told we are easy guests. We like to take care of ourselves and not add unduly to our hosts workload. Car camping is a favorite vacation of ours.
 I'd say our airbnb hosting style is also casual: I try to think of anything a guest might need and supply it, so they can have a relaxed stay with us. We have maps of the neighborhood and menus for the local cafes and the bakery in a notebook in The Loft. We try to help out with rides when we can. We have a table in The Loft that is perfect for working or dining. A guest set up her sewing machine up there.
My favorite quote is from Emmanuel: "Your life is not your master, it is your child." Let us host your next visit to Columbus as you create your perfect visit.

name: Hannah's Haus
description:
Hannah's Haus in German Village is the perfect place to stay in a perfect location. Its just a short walk from downtown Columbus. Our newly design townhouse features 3 cozy bedrooms, and 2 bathrooms with slight touches of historic German Village through out the house. Bright and fresh for any occasion. We are central to everything so don't worry about missing out on anything. We have onsite Laundry for your convenience and off the Street parking. We are just waiting for you!!

The space
3 Bedroom duplex home close to transportation

Guest access
Getting around is great with local ride shares and Shared Parking and off the street parking.
neighborhood_overview: German Village is a historic neighborhood just south of downtown Columbus, Ohio. Katzinger Deli just one block away stop in a get some fresh food and enjoy the fall foliage with their out door seating.
host_about: Mission Stays started in the summer of 2019. Started by Amanda Williams who runs a Design, Staging, Airbnb Service and city drawing company. Amanda runs these companies with her highly experienced team. Mission stays was created to help give people an accommodatable experience people wont forget. With being big advocates of the community Amanda and Mission Stays Staff use local resources to ensure experiences are phenomenal. We want to treat our guest with the same hospitality our families raised us in . Our mission is to make your stay so comfortable you don't want to leave :0)

name: Comfortable rooms in Clintonville 1
description:
A cozy, warm, inviting place to stay in the heart of Columbus.
This page is for the queen-size bed. The large bathroom is SHARED in the house with your own towels provided in your room.

The space
We live in a 1923 two-story craftsman-like house in the heart of Clintonville on a beautiful and neighborhood friendly street. Our three-bedroom home has hardwood floors throughout, a spacious kitchen, a large outdoor living space consisting of a large porch with a permanent roof and a large paver patio with several areas for relaxing. The back yard is fenced in and has a large koi pond. We spend most of our summer out on the back porch; you will enjoy it as well if you are here in late spring to mid fall.

We have two room options for booking, make sure you are booking through the right listing for the room you want:

Comfortable rooms in Clintonville 1
This room is a 10' x 16' bedroom with a queen-sized bed, complete with a pillow top ma
neighborhood_overview:
The house is on a quiet and residential street located in Clintonville just two minutes from I-71, SR315 and the OSU district making us centrally located to most of Columbus. The Clintonville Farmers' Market is just a few minute walk and a great place to go on Saturdays in the summer or fall. You can also run or bike on the Olentangy River Trail near the house, which covers 13 miles along the Olentangy River from downtown Columbus to suburban Worthington.
If you have any other questions about the house, the location, or us feel free to ask!
host_about: We enjoy hosting other people in our home. From neighbors for cocktail hour to hosting out of town family, we thrive on making the experience in our home one they won't forget and desire to come back to time and time again.

name: Better than a hotel! German Village
description:
2 Bedrooms (full/queen) • 2.5 baths • Living (sleeper sofa) • Dininglounge • Large Kitchen • Wifi • Internet TV + AmazonPrime • Washer & Dryer

Located in heart of historic German Village (literally). Steps from shopping, restaurants, & downtown Columbus, Ohio. Gay friendly!

The space
Better than a hotel suite, this is an entire house! Beautifully renovated brick Italianate nearly 150 year-old home. Fully furnished down to the linens, cork screw and martini glasses. The original architectural details blend wonderfully with the modern kitchen and baths. New and original hardwood and cork floors throughout. Exposed brick walls. Furnished with an eclectic Mid-Century feel. Perfect for the traveler who likes to experience the neighborhood, someone relocating to Columbus or in need temporary housing.

Guest access
German Village is a premier neighborhood in Columbus, Ohio, listed on the National Register of Historic Places. Fantastic
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to German Village, one of the most storied urban neighborhoods in the U.S. We are an energetic, eclectic mashup of modern lifestyles enjoying the best shops, restaurants and parks found anywhere, against a backdrop of historic brick streets and houses. Listed on the National Register of Historic Places since 1971. German Village is not just preserved architecture from the 1800s; it is the aggregation of more than 150 years of the stories of area people, families and businesses. Character lives on!

The house is located in the heart of the village among established tree lines, beautiful brick homes, brick streets, ironwork and brick sidewalks. It's like living in a giant park. We are on a lively corner. Next door is our local-made gift shop, The Red Stable, and Schmidt's Sausage Haus, a very popular destination restaurant and tourist attraction. There are several other restaurants, bars, shops and parks in the neighborhood.

Just north of us is downtown Colu
host_about: Hi, I'm Jeff. I live work & play in German Village and downtown Columbus! I graduated from OSU in Hospitality Management and have a small design firm in the neighborhood. My partner Stevo is from Croatia and speaks 5 languages.  Our pup is GiGi! We welcome you to enjoy our home away from home, nestled in the heart of German Village.

name: Charming 1BR Clintonville Apt (1-week min. rental)
description:
Fantastic 1BR apartment located in the South Clintonville/North University District area, minutes from OSU or downtown. It is on the ground floor of a lovely 1926 4-unit brick building on Indianola near Arcadia. It's beautifully furnished and is ideal for a single person or a couple who are visiting Columbus for several months and need a comfortable place to stay.

The space
The apartment has hardwood floors, wood panel doors, double-hung windows with storm windows and screens, and it has the original 1926 bath and kitchen fixtures. The kitchen has a full-sized gas stove, a small built-in microwave, a dark wood countertop, a hidden drop-down breakfast table, and a hidden drop-down ironing board. It is equipped with everything you need (toaster, coffee maker, plates, glasses, cups, pots, pans, silverware, and an assortment of utensils) to cook any sort of meal. The adjoining hall space functions as a continuation of the kitchen and contains a full-sized refriger
neighborhood_overview: This is a wonderful vibrant neighborhood with a mix of rental units and private residences.  There is a ravine park within easy walking distance and an assortment of shops and restaurants on Indianola.  It's a quick drive to High Street and its many shops (including a Giant Eagle supermarket and a CVS Pharmacy), and access to either the I-71 or the 315 freeway is quite close.
host_about: I have lived in Columbus off and on since coming here to attend Ohio State University in the 60's.  I have a degree in Architecture from OSU, but my real interest has always been in renovations. I have a son who lives in San Francisco and I love to visit there several times a year.  My husband and I have 3 grandchildren - one in California and two in Michigan.  I recently retired from OSU after working there for 18 years.

description:
This is a spacious apartment and quite good for long-term stays with just about everything you would ever need, especially kitchen utensils. The proximity to OSU on an historic beautiful, quiet, residential street makes it ideal. Parking on the property is a premium!

The space
What makes this apartment perfect is that it's your home away from home on a Victorian quiet street close to all your connections in the OSU, Wexner Medial Center, Battelle and Downtown areas. The latest technology with hi-fi, cable TV and Netflix make this ideal for an extended stay and have the ability to make your own meals in a newly renovated kitchen with stainless appliances and granite counter tops. Beautiful hardwood floors, parking,and laundry add to your convenience and enjoyment. Nearby bus lines connect to many attractions including the Convention Center or suburban malls (Even directly to Nordstrom's Rack!), Short North Art District, Arena District, Huntington Ball Park, Sc
neighborhood_overview: This Victorian apartment home is located in Harrison West, a residential neighborhood, on a park island within walking distance of OSU.
host_about: I am Linda a dynamic woman born in LA, but living most of my life in Columbus, Ohio.  I am very social and enjoy meeting new people.  I have traveled a great deal and enjoy knowing about new cultures and people.  Air bnb is a perfect opportunity for me to meet you and welcome you to a hospitable place to live here at one of my Villa Ruth apartments, which I named after my Grandma Ruth.

name: Mid-Century Sweet Little Apartment
description:
This apartment is within walking distance to the Ohio State University, the Wexner Medical Center, and James Hospital. Also, the Columbus Convention Center, Arena District, and downtown area are on a direct bus route with a connection half a block away. I really like this apartment because it has an open concept and has a single sofabed in the living room for a guest. Parking and laundry make this an ideal location for an extended stay.

The space
Having your own kitchen, desk, wi-fi, parking, laundry and cable TV--what could be better?! Well, hardwood floors and a fenced-in back yard. The Mid-Century decor and open floor plan make this apartment perfect for a short or long stay. It's just off Neil and 5th, so it's within walking distance of OSU, or take the bus to campus or downtown. The Short North art district is 2 miles away, but you can find either fine-dining, corner cafes, or an 80's club very near.

name: German Village Getaway
description:
Beautiful German Village home available for rent. The German Village is a historic neighborhood located just south of Downtown.

The space
It's beautiful and located close to everything Columbus has to offer!

This completely renovated historic home features 2 bedrooms (queen beds), 2 full baths, living room (with sectional & TV), dining room that's open to the kitchen, wifi, premium cable and apple TV. The backyard features a patio, grill and 2 car garage.

Conveniently located to all the Columbus attractions:
Steps to Schiller Park
2.5 miles to the Convention Center
7.7 miles to Port Columbus International Airport
1.2 miles to I71/I70
6.5 miles to Ohio Stadium
.9 miles to Nationwide Children's Hospital

You won't be disappointed.

Guest access
The whole house and yard.

Other things to note
Everyone loves a wedding and I love hosting bride and grooms to

name: Great apartment with extra rooms
description:
This convenient location is just off of Neil and 5th. It features a fenced-in back yard and is within walking distance of OSU or take the bus to campus or downtown. The Short North art district is 2 miles away, but fine dining, corner cafes, and entertainment are very
near.
In addition to the bedroom, this apartment has a loft area with a twin bed. It also has hardwood floors, a kitchen, desk, wi-fi, parking, laundry in the basement, and cable TV to make your stay accommodations complete.

The space
This cozy 2 story apartment is the larger side of my cottage double. The access to the basement laundry is from inside the apartment.

Guest access
The fenced backyard has a shared patio.

License number
2019-1848
neighborhood_overview: This is a residential neighborhood with many homeowners nearby.  It is one block from the intersection of Neil and 5th Avenues.  The bus half a block away affords access to OSU,  Columbus downtown, and grocery stores, although many people enjoy the walk to all, including Target!
host_about: I am Linda a dynamic woman born in LA, but living most of my life in Columbus, Ohio.  I am very social and enjoy meeting new people.  I have traveled a great deal and enjoy knowing about new cultures and people.  Air bnb is a perfect opportunity for me to meet you and welcome you to a hospitable place to live here at one of my Villa Ruth apartments, which I named after my Grandma Ruth.

name: Eclectic Short North Escape w/FREE Parking
description:
3 bed, 2.5 bath home with 3 free off-street parking spots and a private fenced in backyard! Located in the heart of the Short North, one of Columbus' most vibrant urban neighborhoods. Steps away from High Street, where you will find fantastic restaurants, bars, boutiques, coffee shops, art galleries, and so much more.

The space
Fun decor and comfortable furnishings creates a unique, cozy feel in this two-story home. Ceiling fans, central air/heat, Roku & Sling TV, and free parking & WiFi are just a few conveniences you will enjoy during your stay.

The King bedroom features an upholstered bed with memory foam mattress and reclaimed wood accent wall. This bedroom has a small, simple ensuite bathroom with a small stall shower.

The Queen bedroom has a Serta mattress, vaulted ceiling and a ceiling fan.

The 3rd bedroom has two twin pillow top beds, and a reading nook with large chaise lounge (about the size of a toddler bed). A
neighborhood_overview: The Short North Arts District is one of Columbus’ most popular neighborhoods, and for good reason. High Street is lined with coffee, shopping, restaurants, yoga, groceries, breweries & bars, cafes, and art galleries. Most are small businesses, which gives the neighborhood a really unique vibe.  Our home is a few blocks from High, so it’s very easy to find whatever you need within a few minutes walk, but also escape to a more quiet setting when you want to.
host_about: We’re husband & wife hosts, parents to 2 little girls, and small business owners in Columbus, OH. After living in NYC for several years, we decided to move to Columbus in search of a better quality of life — and we found it! We have been hosting since 2014 and have enjoyed sharing our homes with thousands of travelers from near & far. We find it incredibly rewarding to be a small part of our guests’ experience when they’re visiting our city.

description:
A calm, peaceful home in Westerville, a suburb of Columbus, with a room & private bathroom to rent. Located only 2 minutes from the highway, our home is situated in a prime location with access to a multitude of attractions, shopping, entertainment, and dining options all within 5-15 minutes, including Downtown Columbus, Port Columbus International Airport, Easton Town Center, Short North, & OSU. Complimentary coffee & tea is also available. We gladly welcome all long & short term reservations!

The space
Our home is located in a quiet, relaxing neighborhood with nearby hiking paths, yet remarkably close to several key points of interest in the city. Depending on where you are going, it generally takes about 20 minutes to anywhere in the city!

Guest access
Guests are welcome to enjoy our home, including the guest room, guest bath, main living room, lower level theater room with 120" screen & surround sound system (not yet pictured), dining r
neighborhood_overview:
As part of the Little Turtle Community, our neighborhood offers a secluded sanctuary from the normal bustle of a large metro area, yet with incredible accessibility to immediate shopping, entertainment, and dining within 5-10 minutes of our home. In a wooded development, there are also several fantastic walking paths around the neighborhood and golf course for a relaxing run or walk.

House manual provides multiple links to various destinations nearby and in the Columbus vicinity.
host_about: My husband Tim & I have been together for 10 years & love where we live. We are both very easy to get along with & are happy to help those not familiar with the area. We both love this city, the arts, music & foodie scene which is phenomenal! There are quiet nights at home, but we also spend time regularly with our friends & always look forward to making more!

neighborhood_overview:
I am located in a diverse, URBAN NEIGHBORHOOD built in the mid 1800's. In its day, it was the about the best real estate you could buy and represented the optimism of a growing city. For old house aficionados, I'm surrounded by interesting architecture, some outstanding restorations, and lots of potential .

Olde Towne East/King Lincoln is one of the city’s largest historic neighborhoods, over 50 architectural styles can be found here.

The diversity of the neighborhood and its many charms include beautiful homes, impressive churches, great restaurants , Central location, nearby Franklin Park Conservatory and The Columbus Art Museum makes this neighborhood extra special , I know I'm a little bias :-)
host_about: Hello! I'm passionate about the arts, travel  and community. I love to entertain. Hosting Art and yoga events in my home is my way of giving back to the community.

name: Comfy I, 3 Bed, 1 Bath, Free Parking -RoweRentals
description:
This 3 Bed, 1 Bath apartment is part of a renovated historic 1910 duplex. Located in Weinland Park, 2 blocks from High St. and the Short North. A short walk to many popular bars and restaurants nearby or a $5-10 Uber ride to downtown.

Distance from:
1.3 mi - Columbus Convention Center
2 mi - OSU stadium
2.3 mi - Schottenstein Center
2.5 mi - Crew Stadium/Expo Center/Fair grounds
3 mi radius - all areas of Downtown

Please check out our other listings under our profile nearby!

The space
Construction- a large building is being constructed on the corner of Summit and 5th Ave. You may hear construction noises during workday hours.

We take our responsibilities as hosts seriously and we want to be excellent neighbors in our community. We actively manage our listings by active exterior cameras and we enforce our rules. If you have any doubt or would like to find out more information, please check our reviews and f
neighborhood_overview:
The Short North Arts District is one of the Midwest’s best kept secrets. There is a huge variety of unique shops, bars and restaurants, and art galleries along High Street and a number of annual events that take place year-round. We have a thorough list of recommendations in the house to local bakeries, cafes, and restaurants.

The Short North is made up of several historic neighborhoods; this home is located in Weinland Park, a cool, urban area on the East side of High St above 5th Ave. Weinland Park still has its edgy, up-and-coming vibe- there is a lot of construction and development still underway, real estate is hot here despite its sometimes worn look. You will see a lot of renovated homes as well as ones not-yet-touched. This is not a cookie-cutter neighborhood; it's an historic, city neighborhood. The neighborhood is home to a mix of young professionals and families and close to an elementary school. This apartment is in walking distance to High Street and N. 4th St
host_about:
A few years after meeting in Japan, we moved to Columbus in 2OO9 and have been loving it ever since! We love traveling (25+ countries between us) and are passionate about renovating historic homes and building new homes. Please check out our IGs at @RoweRentals and @RoweHouseCbus to see our house journey.

We love being hosts- providing a comfortable home to travelers visiting our gem of a city- 'Cbus'! We know quite a lot about Short North entertainment & restaurants- there is so much to do here, feel free to ask!
- Ingrid, Mike, and Frances, Co-Host 

Our life motto- Live like someone left the gate open!

name: 1 Bedroom Lower Level Apartment
description:
Comfortable, private 1 bedroom apartment within a beautiful historic house with tons of character. Everything you need to feel at home when you are away from home. Spacious and quiet designed for a relaxing stay. Close to many popular attractions.

The space
Instead of just one room, for your price you get an entire apartment. The space makes you feel like you are in your own home. The space comes with satellite television and HBO. Distance from:
1.3 mi - Columbus Convention Center
2 mi - OSU stadium
2.3 mi - Schottenstein Center

3 mi radius - all Downtown areas

Please be sure to check out our other nearby listings under our profile!

The space
***Construction- a large building is being constructed on the corner of Summit and 5th Ave. You may hear construction noises during workday hours.***

We take our responsibilities as hosts seriously and we want to be excellent neighbors in our community. We actively manage our listings by active exterior cameras and we enforce our rules. If you have any doubt or would like to find out more information, please check our r
neighborhood_overview:
The Short North Arts District is one of the Midwest’s best kept secrets. There is a huge variety of unique shops, bars and restaurants, and art galleries along High Street and a number of annual events that take place year-round. We have a thorough list of recommendations in the house to local bakeries, cafes, and restaurants.

The Short North is made up of several historic neighborhoods; this home is located in Weinland Park, a cool, urban area on the East side of High St above 5th Ave. Weinland Park still has its edgy, up-and-coming vibe- there is a lot of construction and development still underway, real estate is hot here despite its sometimes worn look. You will see a lot of renovated homes as well as ones not-yet-touched. This is not a cookie-cutter neighborhood; it's an historic, city neighborhood. The neighborhood is home to a mix of young professionals and families and close to an elementary school. This apartment is in walking distance to High Street and N. 4th St
host_about:
A few years after meeting in Japan, we moved to Columbus in 2OO9 and have been loving it ever since! We love traveling (25+ countries between us) and are passionate about renovating historic homes and building new homes. Please check out our IGs at @RoweRentals and @RoweHouseCbus to see our house journey.

We love being hosts- providing a comfortable home to travelers visiting our gem of a city- 'Cbus'! We know quite a lot about Short North entertainment & restaurants- there is so much to do here, feel free to ask!
- Ingrid, Mike, and Frances, Co-Host 

Our life motto- Live like someone left the gate open!

name: 1BR Apt. on Clintonville Ravine
description:
Lovely 2-story, 1BR apartment located in the South Clintonville/North University District area, minutes from OSU or downtown. It overlooks the Glen Echo Ravine, is comfortably furnished, and is ideal for a single or couple who are visiting Columbus

The space
The apartment is located on a busy street (Indianola), but its entrance is behind a 2-car garage and has an entry deck and covered entry porch. The space is on two levels, with an eat-in kitchen on the entry level, and a living room, bedroom, and bath on the upper level. The kitchen space and the living room space both have wonderful views of the ravine greenery with its many birds and other wildlife. The kitchen space has easy access to the entry deck that also overlooks the ravine and has seating so you can relax outdoors.

The eat-in kitchen has a 24” electric stove, a bottom-freezer refrigerator, a microwave, and generous counter and cabinet space. It’s fully supplied with dishes, pans, a
neighborhood_overview: This is a wonderful neighborhood with a mix of rental units and private residences.  There is a ravine park within easy walking distance and an assortment of shops and restaurants on Indianola.  It’s a quick drive to High Street and its many shops (including a Giant Eagle supermarket and a CVS pharmacy), and access to either the I-71 or the 315 freeway is quite close.
host_about: I have lived in Columbus off and on since coming here to attend Ohio State University in the 60's.  I have a degree in Architecture from OSU, but my real interest has always been in renovations. I have a son who lives in San Francisco and I love to visit there several times a year.  My husband and I have 3 grandchildren - one in California and two in Michigan.  I recently retired from OSU after working there for 18 years.

neighborhood_overview: My neighborhood was at one place the homes of James Thurber and the Robber Barons of old.  It is gorgeous with a variety of old homes--Queen Anne, Victorian--and tree lined streets. It is experiencing a renaissance and offers a tavern (very good food!), a diner where you can  enjoy a good breakfast, a pizza shop that's a cut above chain pizza's, a Vegan restaurant These locations are a 5 minute walk from the house.
host_about: I am a friendly person who enjoys getting to know others.  I love to read, work in the yard, sing, sing, sing and snuggle with my dog--when he let's me. I love tea, love Italy and enjoyed Ireland and enjoy movies shown at art cinemas. I don't watch much television but when I do it's usually PBS. I don't smoke.  I really enjoy travelling and have been on package tours and well as trips where I hunt out hostels.  I appreciate having different people around!

name: Classic Second-Floor Olde Town East-Full Apartment
description:
A comfortable, convenient, stylish pad in Columbus.

A large, nicely renovated one bedroom apartment two blocks from Franklin Park. In the fashionable, up-and-coming Olde Towne East neighborhood.

Features comfort and style. Edwardian character, eclectic art on the walls, and a funky mix of antique and modern furniture.

The space
Second floor apartment in a century-old house in Olde Town East.

Full kitchen. Separate bedroom.

One bedroom, plus a fold out couch, sleeps a total of four.

Guest access
This unit is an entire separate apartment, with its own separate entrance. Access is by electronic combination lock.

Other things to note
TV has AppleTV with complimentary Netflix.

Plenty of on-street parking.

License number
2019-2372
neighborhood_overview:
Olde Towne East is one of the most up-and-coming neighborhoods in Columbus, popular with artists, hipsters, gays, young families, and other people drawn to its mix of cultural diversity, classy old housing stock, relatively low rents, and a laid-back slow pace of life.

It's definitely an urban environment, and it's not the suburbs! There are gritty edges to Olde Towne East. However it is absolutely a safe, quiet place where nothing much ever happens. Some of the houses on the block have been given full renovations; some are waiting their turn. Latta Avenue is a diverse street; the neighbors are a mix of black, white, straight, gay, young and old.

Franklin Park is two blocks away; Broad Street is half a block, and will take you to High Street, the Convention Center, and everything else. Not much dining or entertainment within walking distance yet, but the Short North is a short Uber ride away.
host_about:
Jay and Michael are newly married, traveling through life and the world together.  Nice, respectable boys both of them.  

Interests include old things, good food and fine wine, dogs, Lana, art museums, history, video games, antique shops, fashion, second hand bookshops.  Priorities:  eating delicious things not eaten before, seeing beautiful places not seen before, meeting extraordinary people not met before.

description:
Enjoy a beautiful private room in this large house on historic Bryden Road. Comfortable queen bed with plenty of storage in the room along with a fireplace and a tv with DVD player. Netflix, Amazon Prime, Disney+. I live in the house along with my dog Juneau. She’s a young husky mix pup that loves everyone!

The space
Nicely updated home in a quiet location close to downtown Columbus.

The bedroom: Large private room with a comfortable queen bed with luxurious bedding, plenty of storage, TV and DVD player, Netflix, Amazon Prime, Disney+, fireplace and ceiling fan. Shared bathroom. I have another room available to book if you have a group or should this room be unavailable for your dates - check out the Gray Room!

The house: All brick 2500 sq ft craftsman built in 1914 and had a major face-lift on its 100th birthday. Gleaming hardwood floors throughout, living room, dining room, den and updated open kitchen with granite counters and sta
neighborhood_overview: Olde Towne East is a charming residential neighborhood with history around every corner.  In the late 1800's and early 1900's some of Columbus' wealthiest and most influential citizens built beautiful homes on Bryden Road.  Technically we are located in the Franklin Park Neighborhood but everyone around Columbus usually refers to the entire area as Olde Towne.
host_about:
I’ve been an Airbnb host since 2014 and since I love to travel I have also been a guest with other hosts in the US and internationally. People always ask if it’s weird to have strangers come and stay in my home with me and the answer has always been “not once!” I really love having the opportunity to share my home and city of Columbus Ohio with travelers from all over the world. So far I have welcomed people from 6 out of 7 continents coming from more than 75 different countries.

When I bought my home in 2008 it had broken plumbing, boarded up windows, and had been the ugly house on the block for a long time. It’s taken a lot of time and patience but a house that was forgotten and uninhabitable became a warm and charming place I like to call home. 

I’m proud of the work I’ve done to bring a historic building back to life and update it in a way that kept much of the original character. Be careful asking questions about the process because I may not stop telling stories for a while.

In the fall of 2019 I adopted a husky/boxer puppy.  Her name is Juneau and she is super friendly and loves welcoming guests to our home.

Vaccinated for COVID - May 2021.

name: Historic Townhome by Schiller Park: Walk to All!
description:
Quaint 3 bedroom, 2.5 bathroom end-unit townhome with private backyard and easy parking. Located across the street from Schiller Park, and minutes to some of the best coffee shops, restaurants, and cafes that Columbus has to offer.

The space
This townhome has all of the charm and architectural character you'd expect from a German Village home including rustic, original pine floors, beautiful unpainted woodwork and moldings, newly renovated bathrooms, tall ceilings, and comfy yet elegant decor to make you feel right at home. In fact, it was featured on the 2017 German Village Haus Und Garten Tour!

There is about 1200 cozy sq. ft of living space inside the unit, which includes a living room, dining room, kitchen, 3 bedrooms and 2.5 bathrooms. Each room is small, but was designed and decorated by the owners with comfort in mind. You'll find rustic, original details, high-end furnishings from Crate & Barrel + Restoration Hardware, antique/vintage finds
neighborhood_overview:
German Village is a vibrant place to stay, shop, and play. Walking the brick sidewalks, you'll discover a neighborhood full of urban gardens, beautiful historic homes built over 100 years ago, and carefully dispersed small businesses. As said on the German Village visitor's website, “What we have can't be replicated. We live this way — and protect it with great passion — because we understand that what we have is a neighborhood like no other." We couldn't agree more.

Schiller Park is the main park in the neighborhood and is located less than one block from the property, making it easy to go for a walk/run, have a picnic, bring the kids to the playground, and enjoy free performances of Shakespeare in the Park in the summertime. The park also has basketball courts and tennis courts.

This Townhome is a short walk to coffee shops, restaurants, bars, grocery stores, and the famous Jeni's Ice Cream. It is also less than 5 miles of the most popular attractions in
host_about: We’re husband & wife hosts, parents to 2 little girls, and small business owners in Columbus, OH. After living in NYC for several years, we decided to move to Columbus in search of a better quality of life — and we found it! We have been hosting since 2014 and have enjoyed sharing our homes with thousands of travelers from near & far. We find it incredibly rewarding to be a small part of our guests’ experience when they’re visiting our city.

name: Urban I, 3 Bed, 1 Bath, Free Parking -RoweRentals
description:
This 1200 sq ft, 3 Bed, 1 Bath duplex is part of a renovated historic 1900s duplex. Located in Weinland Park, 2 blocks from High St. and the Short North, it is a short walk to many popular bars and restaurants nearby.

Conveniently located:
1.3 mi - Columbus Convention Center
2 mi - OSU stadium
2.3 mi - Schottenstein Center
2.5 mi - Crew Stadium/Expo Center/Fair grounds
3 mi radius - all areas of interest in Downtown

Please be sure to check out our other listings under our profile nearby!

The space
Things to Note: The apartment is over 100 years old. It has been renovated but certain parts of the home have been restored, including the wood floors. If you are searching for a commercial, hotel-like experience, this listing may not be suitable to your preferences.

No parties or events allowed.

Construction- there is currently a large building being constructed on the corner of Summit and 5th Ave
neighborhood_overview:
The Short North Arts District is one of the Midwest’s best kept secrets. There is a huge variety of unique shops, bars and restaurants, and art galleries along High Street and a number of annual events that take place year-round. We have a thorough list of recommendations in the house to local bakeries, cafes, and restaurants.

The Short North is made up of several historic neighborhoods; this home is located in Weinland Park, a cool, urban area on the East side of High St above 5th Ave. Weinland Park still has its edgy, up-and-coming vibe- there is a lot of construction and development still underway, real estate is hot here despite its sometimes worn look. You will see a lot of renovated homes as well as ones not-yet-touched. The neighborhood is home to a mix of young professionals and families. This apartment is in walking distance to High Street and N. 4th Street coffee shops, restaurants, and bars!

IS THE NEIGHBORHOOD SAFE?
We live nearby and feel the
host_about:
A few years after meeting in Japan, we moved to Columbus in 2OO9 and have been loving it ever since! We love traveling (25+ countries between us) and are passionate about renovating historic homes and building new homes. Please check out our IGs at @RoweRentals and @RoweHouseCbus to see our house journey.

We love being hosts- providing a comfortable home to travelers visiting our gem of a city- 'Cbus'! We know quite a lot about Short North entertainment & restaurants- there is so much to do here, feel free to ask!
- Ingrid, Mike, and Frances, Co-Host 

Our life motto- Live like someone left the gate open!

name: Quaint 1920's Townhouse
description:
Comfortable living space in historic Merion Village, with 800 sqft it's the perfect get away for two.

Within walking distance to several bars and Schiller Park. A 10-12 minute drive to Downtown, Brewery District, Arena District, Short North, and The Ohio State University.
- 19 minute drive to the main airport
- 13 minute drive to the Convention Center

Located just around the corner from the bus stop. There is a Kroger and a CVS available for groceries.

The space
This is an older home dating back to the 1920s. Ceilings are tall, rooms are quaint, stairs are steep. Please respect the dated property, and enjoy it's character.

There is no garbage disposal in the kitchen sink, please dispose of food, grease, coffee grounds in trash.

New HVAC has been installed, temperature should be acceptable as set. There is a fan/heater in the upstairs landing for possible use while in the bedroom, as temperatures
neighborhood_overview:
This neighborhood is constantly growing and changing. Some houses are still awaiting to be improved. The neighborhood is best when traveling north towards downtown, and staying closer to High Street compared to Parsons Ave. It's close to the brewery district and downtown, but far enough away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Close to two Kroger grocery stores, I suggest the Sycamore Rd location, Giant Eagle, CVS, and many restaurants and bars.

Take a quick Uber drive to downtown for a safe and easy night out.

Located about 4 miles south of the Greater Columbus Convention Center in downtown.

Please be safe and remove all personal belongings from the car to prevent theft while staying in any city. Always be aware of your surroundings. Be sure to lock and close all doors and windows.
host_about:
I'm hosting on Airbnb because I no longer live in half of my duplex property, and I enjoy sharing it's charming space with visitors looking to be just outside of downtown Columbus.  I enjoy all kinds of art, music, dance and food.  Wine, shoes, and dessert are my weaknesses.  I love traveling of all kinds, short road trips or long vacations. I hope my guests enjoy the passion and warmth I've put into my century old property. Thanks for your inquiry!

Throughout my busy days, I enjoy taking a moment to breathe in the world, and no matter how stressful or challenging life can become, I always find time to admire how huge and beautiful life is around me, and my challenges don't seem as extreme anymore.

name: 1BR 1-person Clintonville Apt, (5-day min rental)
description:
This is a pleasant 2-level apartment that is perfect for a single tenant. It's located in the South Clintonville/North University District area. The minimum stay is 5 nights at $60/night. Longer stays (28 days or more) are $38/night. It's an ideal place to stay if you are traveling alone, and a great option if your planned visit to Columbus is a bit longer than the typical "vacation".

The space
This is an attractive and comfortable apartment for a single person who is in Columbus for an extended but relatively short period of time, or is in the process of moving to Columbus and needs short-term housing while searching for a long-term rental. There's no long-term lease to sign, no roommates, your own private bath, kitchen and laundry, and utilities are set up and included in the rental fee.

The apartment has a bedroom, bath, and a small closet on the entry level; and the living room, dining room, kitchen and laundry space are on the basement level
neighborhood_overview: This South Clintonville/Glen Echo neighborhood is very solid.  It's quite popular with young professionals, families, and seniors.  It's mostly residential, but has a number of restaurants and shops within easy reach, and is conveniently located near freeway access points.  It's about 8 minutes drive southwest to OSU, 12 minutes drive south to downtown or the Convention Center, and 5 minutes drive south to the State Fairgrounds.
host_about: I have lived in Columbus off and on since coming here to attend Ohio State University in the 60's.  I have a degree in Architecture from OSU, but my real interest has always been in renovations. I have a son who lives in San Francisco and I love to visit there several times a year.  My husband and I have 3 grandchildren - one in California and two in Michigan.  I recently retired from OSU after working there for 18 years.

name: Historic German Village Apartment
description:
This apartment is located on one of the most desirable streets in historic German Village and is within walking distance of many attractions. It is well decorated and completely renovated to ensure a comfortable home away from home.

The space
This house was built prior to 1900 and was divided into a four-unit in the sixties or seventies. The other three units house my awesome permanent full-time tenants. Everyone is quiet and very sweet. This unit is full of charm and character and really feels like home.

Guest access
There is a basement access for the laundry room. It's an odd hatch in the floor of the kitchen that opens to a staircase, but that's all part of the charm of an old house.

There is also a shared outdoor area that is well landscaped with a couple of lounge chairs and a good amount of grass for this area and being so close to the city. It's likely that you will have this area all to yourselves, as the other three ten
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is one of the best examples of German architecture outside of Germany. The German Village Commission has strict standards that all residents must adhere to, making this a true attraction for visitors. We have many restaurants, bars, cafes and historical tours (I am happy to help with recommendations and planning your visit. Just ask!) within walking distance that make this an extremely desirable neighborhood.
host_about: I am a real estate agent in Columbus, Ohio and have found my true passion in helping clients invest and find their forever homes. I enjoy traveling to my home away from home in Costa Rica with my wonderful husband, practicing yoga, and loving on my fur children. I have a bachelor of science from THE Ohio State University, and I love the Buckeyes!

description:

Convenient for city visits, I'm 10 min from Easton, OSU, MAPFRE Stadium, the Airport, Fairgrounds and the Columbus Convention Center. Located in the residential and historic 'King-Lincoln' district. neighborhood_overview: We're about a 15 minute drive to downtown, an $18 uber ride to downtown. I'm about a mile from 2 major highways, restaurants and shopping. Everything you need is super close! Fairly quiet neighborhood.
host_about:
Hello! I'm a friendly, outgoing professional and very social. I have an energetic Australian shepherd & stubborn dachshund that are my best buddies (9&10 yrs old). We like to go hiking and take photos of nature and our adventures. We like to hang out on the deck during warmer months and the basement when it's cold outside. 

I have been an airbnb host for about 4 years and truly enjoy meeting new people and hosting!

I prefer to let my guests decide how much or how little of interaction we have.

This is a historical home, featured on the Victorian Village Tour of Homes in 1976, and renovated again in 2017. Victorian Village is a highly desirable neighborhood, centrally located and walkable to so many restaurants and shops!

Minimum 30-night rental. Cats and small/medium dogs are ok for an additional deposit and $200 cleaning fee.

The space
This is a beautiful and comfortable historic property that was our primary home for the last 5 years. The home features original dark woodwork, a "gingerbread" front porch, a large stained glass window, and a delightful rendition of Michelangelo's "Creation of Adam," done by previous owners on plywood on the garage wall facing the back yard. This home has character!

We partially renovated the home in 2017, removing walls on the first floor and
neighborhood_overview: We love the history and architecture of our Victorian Village neighborhood and home!

name: Sweet Little Room in Devonshire
description:
Close to I-71 and I-270, our home is good for solo adventurers and business travelers.
Located in a safe and quiet residential neighborhood on the Northside of Columbus, it is at the center of major points of attraction: 7 mi. from Polaris Mall or Ohio State Fairgrounds, 8 mi. from Easton Mall or OSU, 10 mi. from Greyhound station, 14 mi. from the Airport, and just 3 mi. from Kroger.
If you must eat healthy, no problem! Our local health food store and diner, Raisin Rack, is just 2 miles away.

The space
Located on the 2nd floor, this room is bright and inviting.
Enjoy the use of your own Coffee machine ~ Choice of teas ~ your own refrigerator, space heater or Air Conditioner. A microwave may be shared with two other guests.
The front porch is a peaceful little place to sit - or work - on sunny or drizzling days.

Other things to note
With our little neighborhood park and Sharon Woods close by, our neighborhood is good fo
neighborhood_overview:
Our home is located in a peaceful neighborhood, at the end of a peaceful court.
Close to I-71 and I-270 North, our home is at the center of major points of attraction:

• 6 miles from Polaris Place,
• 8 miles from Easton Mall,
• 8 miles easy commute to OSU,
• 2 miles from our local health food store and diner: Raisin Rack

Most Popular Landmarks
• Magic Mountain Fun Center - Polaris: 6 miles
• Columbus Museum of Art: 10.7 miles
• Ohio Theater: 11.2 miles
• Capitol Square: 11.2 miles
• Ballet Met: 10.7 miles
• Italian Village: 10 miles
• Franklin Park Conservatory: 12.2 miles
• Botanical Gardens: 12.2 miles
• COSI: 13 miles

Other points of attraction:
• Ohio Expo Center: 9.2 miles (Ohio State Fair – Exhibitions throughout the year)
• City Center: 11 miles
• Greater Columbus Convention Center: 11 miles
• Columbus Near East Side Historic District: 11.7 miles
• Germa
host_about:
Hello and welcome to Columbus, Ohio! 

My husband is from Japan, an amateur radio lover, chigiri-e artist, sushi chef, and excellent cook. I grew up in a tiny village of the French Alps, enjoy nature, a good movie, and a walk in the park together with my hubby. While taking care of our family, children, and grandchildren, we keep expanding our friendship circle.  

And I am so grateful to our Airbnb community who is bringing such a diverse group of travelers to our doorstep including those who are coming for business, conferences, exhibitions, visiting relatives, nurses and students needing a comfortable bed after a long day of work or training, and even people who are here to relocate. 

We’re friendly and try to provide our guests with what we appreciate when we are away from home – a relaxing, peaceful, and loving place for a refreshing night rest.

description:
This colorful, 1600 sqft apartment w/ 2 parking spots is a quiet escape in the city and a short Uber to the Short North.

Please read listing & rules thoroughly before making a reservation.

Proximity:
Ohio Expo Center/Fairground- 0.8 mi
OSU- 1.3 mi
Short North- 1.5 mi
Maphre Crew Stadium- 1.5 mi
Schottenstein Center- 1.9 mi
Convention Center- 2.8 mi
Downtown- w/in 3.8 mi radius

The space
Have a large group? Check out the sister listing on Airbnb & our other apartments.
No parties or events allowed.

ADDITIONAL GUESTS & FEES
Please note there is an additional guest fee per person/night for the 3rd guest and up. When entering the correct guest count into the reservation or inquiry this will be automatically calculated. We offer an apartment at cost effective prices for small and large groups. The quote breakdown shows the additional guest fees when entering the number of guests and dat
neighborhood_overview:
The duplex is located near Iuka Ravine on N. 4th St. We have lived here in the past and would again! There is a mix of musicians, professors, students, and working professionals live in the area. There are bus stops nearby and a nice park, the ravine, down the hill (about a one minute walking distance) from the house.

The apartment is within walking distance (15 mins or so) to Ohio State University.

IS THE NEIGHBORHOOD SAFE?
We live nearby and feel the neighborhood is relatively safe, but it can be a bit intimidating if you are not use to city living. Please note this is the city- we do have petty crime in the Short North and University area, and always advise to practice not leaving valuables in your car (we have not had any issues at our apartments, I state this because we are in the city) and walk with a buddy at night on well-lit, busy roads such as High Street, Summit, and 5th Ave.
host_about:
A few years after meeting in Japan, we moved to Columbus in 2OO9 and have been loving it ever since! We love traveling (25+ countries between us) and are passionate about renovating historic homes and building new homes. Please check out our IGs at @RoweRentals and @RoweHouseCbus to see our house journey.

We love being hosts- providing a comfortable home to travelers visiting our gem of a city- 'Cbus'! We know quite a lot about Short North entertainment & restaurants- there is so much to do here, feel free to ask!
- Ingrid, Mike, and Frances, Co-Host 

Our life motto- Live like someone left the gate open!

name: Beautiful spacious suite with gym.
description:
Our beautiful spacious basement suite is complete with gym equipment and a private sitting area. We are located on a quiet brick street in Historic Italian Village which is close to the the Short North, Downtown Columbus, and free public transportation.

The space
We are located on a quaint brick street that's far enough from the excitement of the Short North to be quiet but close enough to be able to walk to the areas bars, restaurants, and shops. The room is spacious and well appointed. We want your stay to be as comfortable and worry free as possible.

Guest access
Guests have access to the main floor (kitchen, living room, dining room, dinette, and powder room) as well as the gym, bedroom, sitting area, and attached bathroom on the lower level.

Other things to note
We are looking forward to meeting new people and making their stay in Columbus as enjoyable as possible.

This area is home to many bars, restaurants, shops, art galleries, and parks.  This is a fun, exciting neighborhood that is conveniently located close to OSU, Downtown, and the Arena District.

The Short North Arts District is one of the Midwest’s best kept secrets. There is a huge variety of unique shops, bars and restaurants, and art galleries along High Street and a number of annual events that take place year-round. We have a thorough list of recommendations in the house to local bakeries, cafes, and restaurants.
The Short North is made up of several historic neighborhoods; this home is located in Italian Village on Summit St., between First Ave and Warren St. Just two blocks away from High Street!

name: Sweet Suite in Historic Woodland Park, downtown
description:
3rd floor suite includes updated kitchen, a beautiful spacious bathroom and large living space. Comfortable Queen-size bed, lots of light and great views of the park and gardens are my favorite highlights of this space. New HE washer and dryer in your private laundry room. Fun history happened here, Jazz greats jammed in this space, and many books that belonged to the judge who built the house and later left to work in the White House are in the library downstairs.

The space
This is a 3rd floor suite with newly remodeled kitchen, spacious bathroom and laundry room. We can offer free on-street parking, a YMCA only a one block walk away, and a two block walk to Franklin Park Conservatory. You have the option of a private entry through the side gate and up the butler's staircase if you don't wish to enter through the house. There is generous space for a Queen size blow up mattress which I can provide with notice including bedding and pillows. (It is a very nice o
neighborhood_overview: Woodland Park is the first "suburb" in Columbus, rich in history and architecture.
host_about: We are both arborists and Annette is also a garden consultant.  Its history and our friendly neighborhood is what we love most about our home. If you love dogs, you’ll always find a warm welcome here!

name: Housepitality ~ The Traveler's Bungalow!
description:
Welcome to the Travelers Bungalow. Our cozy 2 bedroom house is close to nightlife, public transport, MAPFRE stadium, parks, OSU, downtown, and the Short North. You’ll love our place because of the kitchen, the coziness, the front and fenced back yard, the front porch, and the hardwood floors. Our place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, families (with kids), and groups. The house has a total of 2 queen beds, and an air mattress upstairs.

The space
This is a cozy smaller house being just under 700 sq. ft. The house is fully equipped everything to make yourself feel at home. There is a TV in every room, front porch and back patio, a stocked kitchen, and a basement with an extra bed, washer and dryer. Our fenced back yard invites your pets to come along with you for your trip! The un-finished basement also has an extra queen bed. There are no egress windows, but it is clean and painted. The versatile living room can be arranged with a table i
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood North Linden is full of cute post-war bungalow homes,  and is currently in a revitalization phase. There are lots of properties being renovated, and a few that still remain boarded and empty. Our area is full of families with children, and close to schools, parks, and churches. This area has experienced some crime in the past, but has improved in recent years. We have been in this area for over 4 years, and have never experienced any crime or safety issues. Most of our guests love the location and proximity to downtown. If you or your group are not comfortable with this, then you may consider booking a different house. Just message us, and we are happy to help you find the right house for your stay!
host_about: I continue to be excited about Airbnb and home-sharing every day! I enjoy hosting guests, I LOVE to travel, and I really love meeting new people. I am a real estate broker that owns my own business, and I feel that my calling in life is to making spaces for people to enjoy. 5 things I can't live without are live music, friends, exploring new places, bacon, my drum set!

description:
Woodland Park Home

Relaxing private room within a historic spacious home in Woodland Park. Just minutes away from Downtown, the Airport, and beautiful Franklin Park and Conservatory. The private room has a furnished queen sized bed, large closet, dresser, night stand, TV with cable and DVD player entertainment area, Kitchen includes stainless steel appliances and a gas range. Laundry is available in basement. Large fenced back yard including patio, gas fire pit, stainless steel gas grill.

The space
The Space

Fully remodeled historical home set in the middle of Woodland Park just East of Downtown.
You will have full access to the home excluding other private bedrooms, bath, and or office and garage. The home was built in 1915 and fully remodeled in 2014. All areas of the home are complete including the third floor which is where the entertainment area including a comfortable couch, chair, TV (streaming) and Blue Ray player, mini fridg
neighborhood_overview: Woodland Park was built in the early 1900's being home to many doctors, lawyers, and artist.  The neighborhood is filled with so much character and charm with several different designs of architecture being seen over several City blocks.  Over the years some of that charm has been lost, but it's on a rebound and Woodland Park is once again an exciting neighborhood.
host_about: Young professional that is excited to travel to new areas and meet new people. I enjoy traveling for vacations and as well as hosting and meeting new people. I'm pretty quite as a person and easy to get along with. I only speak English so a English speaking host is a must.

name: Columbus Comfort. Close to all top attractions!!
description:
You will love our house for location and its character. Dwntwn nightlife, Convention centre, Grandview, Short North, & OSU campus are less than 8 mi away! Casino only 2 mi. It is 1mi to Camp Chase bike trail and 2 mi to the nearest highway. The front porch is screened in, to enjoy morning sunshine & still have privacy. The main floor has bedrooms so no stairs to climb.
Absolutely NOT a place for late night gathering (outside) and partying as the house is in a quaint and very quiet family setting

The space
This beautiful house was built in the 1930s- on the outside, this house appears to be a tiny house but don't let the looks fool you- Classically arched entryways lead you throughout this spacious home featuring gorgeous original hardwood floors.
The front porch is screened in- for you to enjoy early morning sunshine while you have your coffee & still have privacy. Decent size living room comfortably seats 8-9. This house is divided into 3 levels -
neighborhood_overview: Westgate is a beautiful neighbourhood surrounded by charm,  character and lots of trees. No cookie cutter homes here, all the homes have their own personality.  People here are very friendly and down to earth. There are also paths to walk and parks nearby. The Westgate park Camp Chase bike trail is only 1 mile away!
host_about:
Hello! I am Rue. I love early morning sunshine, travel experiences, aged wine, fresh coffee, nature and its beautiful endless skies.

After working with various corporates for more than a decade I decided to start my own business. Since we moved for business, I was able to use my home on AIRBNB.

While decorating this house we kept comfort and design in forefront of our mind. I open our home to Airbnb guests from all cultures, backgrounds, and nationalities. I look forward to building wonderful new friendships with people around the globe. Thank you for considering our place to stay, hope to talk to you soon. :)

Roomy enough for a small family, private enough for couples & business travelers & dog-friendly (fully refundable deposit req'd for dogs, no cats). Unofficial off-leash dog park nearby. Low Ceiling! (height is 6'4"). Modest Kitchenette has small fridge, microwave, skillet & coffee pot.
Curtained sleeping area has queen bed.

The space
We’re glad you’re interested in our studio! Please note that we've included your occupancy taxes in the quoted price. This unique space with a locking sliding "barn-style" door offers a large living area, a curtained-off sleeping area, and a small kitchenette. The bathroom and laundry are both outside the locked apartment door (but on the same level). Both may be used by the family from time-to-time. When we have friends over (typically a Friday or Satu
neighborhood_overview:
Very quiet and safe neighborhood located between Ohio State's Campus and Worthington.
Whetstone Park (& Library) is 4 blocks away and our dogs LOVE the Adena Brook area (it's like a ravine in the middle of the Park) to run around and visit many other 4 legged friends. This is Clintonville's *unofficial* off-leash dog park!
Just a block or two north of the Park is The Rusty Bucket Restaurant and North Star Restaurant. Two favorites of ours from a healthy eating and customer service standpoint.

name: Guest Suite @ OSU & Short North Arts District
description:
The Guest Suite is an excellent space for a short stay, located just between the Short North Arts District and The Ohio State University! The space is fully private (bedroom + living room + full bathroom), with a dedicated outdoor entrance, but does not include a full kitchen (mini-fridge and microwave only). Walk to popular High St. dining and nightlife in under 10 minutes, to OSU Medical Center in under 15 minutes, and to the Columbus Convention Center in 25. Ask about parking if needed.

The space
The Airbnb space is in the first floor of a multi-unit building, in what was originally a living room and dining room, with beautiful original hardwood floors, two chandeliers, and stained glass windows. There are other people living in the building, but the suite has a private exterior entrance and all doors can be locked from inside the suite. This listing includes private use of the front porch area and porch swing. We do not allow parties and request that nois
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is in the perfect location between Ohio State and the Short North. Our street and the nearby ones have some beautiful grand Victorian homes. This neighborhood draws a healthy blend of graduate students, young professionals, and families. Many of the grand Victorian homes have been split up into multiple units, like this one!
host_about:
Hi, we're Kate and Nat!  We live here in the "Short North" neighborhood of Columbus, near the properties that we manage.

We are both graduates of The Ohio State University - Go Bucks!  Kate is a physical therapist and Nat has a background in IT & management consulting.  We love being Airbnb hosts and hearing about all the exciting reasons that people travel to Columbus!

Take in the beauty of the Columbus Commons Holiday lighting while sipping wine in your pj's. Enjoy the onsite dining of Hadley's Kitchen and Bar. We welcome all, but our micro unit is best for singles, couples and business travelers!

The space

Our
neighborhood_overview: Sometimes referred to as the 4th and Main district or the Gallery District, our neighborhood is home to bars, restaurants, salons, galleries and green spaces.  Dine at Hadley's for the best burger in the city or check out Mikey's Late Night Slice for the best New York style pizza Columbus has to offer!  Pamper yourself across the street at Square One, an Aveda Salon before you head out to an upscale dinner at Side Bar.  Whatever you need, its right here!

Your own private space that includes a bedroom and bathroom, living room and a kitchenette, in a nice, super clean home.

The space
You'll have your own private, separate space in my home, with a separate entrance. It is very safe and quiet here. We are all friendly and easy going! It is a part of my home and I, my daughter and 6 year old granddaughter live up above the area. We do have a small Aussie doodle named Piper. I do have a new hot tub that you are welcome to use. I am looking for a responsible, quiet adult or a couple who needs a nice place to stay and feel at home. It is very convenient to Columbus, the airport, and shopping. It’s great for business travelers, medical professionals who are traveling, or a quick stay to visit friends or family. I allow longer stays if it’s a good fit. Thank you for visiting my listing:)

neighborhood_overview: Very quiet and safe!
host_about:
I am a Registered Nurse. I have worked as a traveling nurse, so I have been to many places all over the United States and have traveled all over California, Florida, and many places in between. Born and raised in Texas and Alabama, lived in Ohio for 21 years. I try to use AirBnb whenever I travel, and that's why I decided to be a host.  I even used AirBnb when my son and I traveled through Europe! We had wonderful experiences!! I believe that there are more good hearted, interesting people in the world than bad, and I want to meet them!!
I love to hike and explore the outdoors, travel to new places, and try different foods. I love my job as a nurse and taking care of people facing unfortunate events makes me appreciate my life and health. I don't want to take that for granted.
Thanks for visiting my listing. I look forward to meeting you, whoever you are. Take care of yourself:)

name: The Gallery (Short North/OSU/Downtown)
description:
This 2nd-story private apt. is at the back of my circa 1880 home. This cheerful cozy aerie provides the comforts of home (kitchen, wifi, & cable TV). Its prime location in the Short North is in easy reach of OSU and DT on foot or by bus. I expect guests to read my entire listing before booking & printed manual upon arrival, so that expectations are clear, most especially about the vintage bath & housekeeping. This is my home--not a hotel. I welcome all who know how to be good house guests.

The space
The "Gallery" is a very small (300 sq. ft.), private 1-BR apartment attached to the back of my Victorian home on the second floor. The space consists of a partially furnished kitchen, bedroom with queen-sized bed, and bathroom sporting a vintage English-style bath (deep clawfoot tub fitted with a handheld shower head). It's extremely important for guests to realize that the bath setup does not allow for taking a shower standing up. The apartment gets wonderful light a
neighborhood_overview: Whatever your reason for traveling to Columbus, you couldn't choose a better neighborhood to stay in if you want to get acquainted quickly with this happening city. This apartment is located at the beginning of the lively strip called The Short North Arts District. From here, you can walk or bike or take a COTA bus to the OSU campus or downtown ($2 per leg). There's also a FREE bus--the CBus--that will take you up and down High Street from the Short North to the edge of German Village. But there's plenty to see and do immediately nearby in walking distance.
host_about: I was born in Kentucky but bred and educated mostly in Ohio. After 30+ years living in the Washington, DC, area, this single 62-year-old youngster is back in Columbus, OH, renovating an ancient house (not something I saw happening, LOL) and getting very interested in homesteading. I was drawn back primarily for family reasons, but also because of the enormous riches this amazing big little city has to offer. I couldn't live without art, music, books, or travel (after family, of course). My life motto, if I have one, is "Barn's burnt down. Now I can see the moon."

description:
Third floor one bedroom suite with king size bed, living room, and private bath located in the heart of the Short North overlooking Goodale Park. Full and exclusive use of the third floor suite with living room, kitchen, and private bathroom.

The historic Victorian style home is conveniently located a short walk from High Street with all of its shopping, restaurants, and nightlife, as well as a short walk to the Greater Columbus Convention Center, North Market, and the Arena District.

The space
The fully renovated historic Victorian home was built in 1890 and overlooks beautiful Goodale Park, a 34 acre urban oasis steps away from the Short North.

The suite is a 3rd floor, one bedroom walk-up with a king size bed and private bathroom with shower (approximately 1,500 sf). The fully-equipped kitchen has stainless steel appliances including a dishwasher, granite counter tops, ice maker, pots/pans, dishes, and utensils as well as a Keurig
neighborhood_overview: The Short North Arts District is the most vibrant spot in the City of Columbus and is home to over 300 exciting businesses, the majority of which are locally owned or headquartered. It has received numerous national accolades, is considered a model for urban revitalization, and is known as the art and soul of Columbus. Goodale Park is a 33 acre urban oasis steps away from the carriage house. You will find walking paths, a pond, fountain, tennis courts, picnic tables, etc.  The North Market with is also short walk away.

description:

Conveniently located:
1.3 mi - Columbus Convention Center
2 mi - OSU stadium
2.3 mi - Schottenstein Center
2.5 mi - Crew Stadium/Expo Center/Fair grounds
3 mi radius - all areas of interest in Downtown

Please be sure to check out our other listings nearby for larger groups!

The space
Things to Note: The apartment is over 100 years old. It has been renovated but certain parts of the home have been restored, including the wood floors. If you are searching for a commercial, hotel-like experience, this listing may not be suitable to your preferences.

Construction- there is currently a large building being constructed on the corner of Summit and 5th Ave
neighborhood_overview:
The Short North Arts District is one of the Midwest’s best kept secrets. There is a huge variety of unique shops, bars and restaurants, and art galleries along High Street and a number of annual events that take place year-round. We have a thorough list of recommendations in the house to local bakeries, cafes, and restaurants.

The Short North is made up of several historic neighborhoods; this home is located in Weinland Park, a cool, urban area on the East side of High St above 5th Ave. Weinland Park still has its edgy, up-and-coming vibe- there is a lot of construction and development still underway, real estate is hot here despite its sometimes worn look. You will see a lot of renovated homes as well as ones not-yet-touched. This is not a cookie-cutter neighborhood; it's an historic, city neighborhood. The neighborhood is home to a mix of young professionals and families and close to an elementary school. This apartment is in walking distance to High Street and N. 4th St
host_about:
A few years after meeting in Japan, we moved to Columbus in 2OO9 and have been loving it ever since! We love traveling (25+ countries between us) and are passionate about renovating historic homes and building new homes. Please check out our IGs at @RoweRentals and @RoweHouseCbus to see our house journey.

We love being hosts- providing a comfortable home to travelers visiting our gem of a city- 'Cbus'! We know quite a lot about Short North entertainment & restaurants- there is so much to do here, feel free to ask!
- Ingrid, Mike, and Frances, Co-Host 

Our life motto- Live like someone left the gate open!

neighborhood_overview:
ABOUT GERMAN VILLAGE

You are in one of the best parts of Columbus, Ohio—beautiful and historic German Village. There is so much to see and do and most of the area is pedestrian friendly.

We have our favorite eateries including Barcelona, Sycamore Café, Brown Bag Deli, Pistachio Vera, Taco Tuesday at The Kitchen, Lindey’s, Katzinger’s, G. Michaels, Antiques on High (Brewery), The Alpine, Schmidt's, The Thurman Cafe, Fox in the Snow, Winan's….. Check out German Village Society for details.

For fitness options, there is a Snap Fitness facility on Third Ave and Schiller Rec Center in the Park (both are fee-based).

The space

Minutes from restaurants, entertainment and the business sectors of both communities. Simply take 315 South for a quick ride to downtown Columbus. Situated in a cul
neighborhood_overview: What I love about my neighborhood is that it has quiet mature neighbors. The property is on a cul-de-sac and has very little traffic. An interesting note: if you are a bird observer, you'll enjoy a variety of birds such as Blue Jays and Cardinals living in the neighborhood. Make sure to check out my Guidebook for activities, entertainment and restaurants - it's a reference of all my favorite places in Columbus. I'm a member of a Pizzeria meetup - My favorite mom & pop pizzerias are listed.
host_about:
Howdy! I’m Jake. I’m originally from New York, and while I miss my friends and family back home (not to mention the beach!), I absolutely love my mid-west home here in Columbus, Ohio!
By day I’m a real estate investor and by night I’m a social butterfly with my friends. I'm also an Airbnb cohost where I mentor aspiring local hosts. I earned my Superhost status because I have high standards for value, cleanliness, and communication.
I enjoy travelling and creating new experiences. My favorite country is Guatemala. The people, the food and the historical sites are breathtaking. My favorite city is Chicago. Through these travels and coupled with my 14 years landlording, I’ve been fortunate to learn what makes a great host: a great home, with a friendly host, in an awesome neighborhood, and the ability to do the things you love! I try to ensure that each and every guest I host walks away with all of that and hopefully more.
My life motto is, well, really my grandmother’s advice, “Jakey, live with NO REGRETS” (I can hear her thick NYer accent now). Sometimes I guess we just need a little reminder of that… And so, I invite you to travel more and see the big, beautiful world we live in.

name: Short North Studio Apt. w/Off-street Parking
description:
A 500 sq.ft. studio apartment with 10 foot ceilings and hardwood floors steps from High Street in the Short North. This is a great apartment for access to events at Ohio State, Express Live, Nationwide Arena, the Convention Center, or Goodale Park. When you come home, enjoy relaxing on the front porch. Inside work at a desk by the window, or sprawl on the couch or queen bed and watch TV.

The space
Large studio features main room with queen bed, sofa (that converts to double bed), and desk area. A decorative fireplace, 10 foot ceilings, and hardwood floors give this space a great feel. Enjoy high speed internet, and a smart TV that you can watch from the bed or the sofa.

Newly upgraded kitchen includes a full sized refrigerator, gas range, microwave, small dishwasher, coffee maker, and wall-mounted two-seat table.

Parking is available in a parking lot behind the building. Just let us know how many cars your group will have.

Gues
neighborhood_overview:
Enjoy Northstar Cafe just around the corner for breakfast, brunch, lunch, or dinner. If you're into tacos, Condado is a fun spot. Mouton is a lovely choice for craft cocktails, and if caffeine is your need One Line Coffee shop is a great choice.

The Short North has it all - from great events in Goodale Park and at the Convention Center, to restaurants, bars, coffee shops, galleries, and local shops. This apartment puts you in the heart of the neighborhood.

Distance To:

Convention Center (0.7mi)

OSU (Thompson Library 1.4mi) (Wexner Medical Center 1.3mi) (Ohio Stadium “Horseshoe” 1.7mi)

Express Live (1.1mi)

Nationwide Arena (1.2mi)

Mapfre Stadium (2.4mi)

Schottenstein Center (2.5mi)

Huntington Park (1.3mi)

Scioto Mile (1.8mi)

Columbus Commons (1.7mi)
host_about:
I dig psychology, gardening, cycling, being a gym rat, and cooking. I have volunteered at a kids camp every summer since 1999 that teaches critical thinking and a love for nature. 

I have lived in Columbus most of my life and I love it here and I love sharing it with other people.  I'm a licensed Ohio real estate sales person.

My career in the non-profit sector has let me travel all over the country. I love the Bay Area, NYC, Washington state, and the Rockies.
