name: City Vibe (Short North/Victorian Village)
description:
Hello and Welcome. Located just two blocks from High Street and less than a mile from OSU and Downtown, the apartment is walking distance to the Convention Center, the North Market, restaurants, nightlife, shopping and more! Also conveniently located near the FREE C-Bus Circulator for easy access around the city.

Large 1bd/1ba luxury suite, w/ private bathroom. The apartment contains refurbished windows, custom-built cabinetry, large kitchen with quartz counter-top and high-end appliances.

The space
The small, boutique apartment building is historic and the recent remodel has kept its rich history intact.

Enjoy a beautiful rooftop experience unlike any other in the city, complete with a fireplace, dining tables and awesome views of a popular park. It’s the perfect place to sip your morning coffee or have a workout session with the sunrise—and in the evening, share a meal under the covered pavilion or an evening cocktail under the stars.
neighborhood_overview: My apartment is less than two blocks from High Street (Short North), which is the hip and trendy part of the city.  Short North is full of great restaurants, bars, clubs, coffee shops, and retail stores.
host_about: I work in the technology space for a large global retail organization.  I was born in upstate NY and raised on the border of PA.  I have lived all over the country, including MD, DC, VA, LA, CA and OH.  I plan to retire back in Palm Springs, CA, where my heart is and which can't come soon enough!

name: Goodale Park Carriage House - heart of Short North
description:
Welcome to the Goodale Park Carriage House located on beautiful Goodale Park, a 34 acre urban oasis steps away from the Short North Arts District. The apartment is a comfortable 2nd floor, one bedroom walk-up with cathedral ceilings and large windows for natural light. The carriage house is conveniently located a short walk from High Street with all of its shopping, restaurants, and nightlife, as well as a short walk to the Greater Columbus Convention Center, North Market, and Arena District.

The space
The carriage house is a 2nd floor, one bedroom walk-up with a queen size bed and sleeper sofa (see floor plan in the pictures). The fully-equipped kitchen has stainless steel appliances including a dishwasher, granite counter tops, ice maker, pots/pans, dishes, and utensils as well as a Keurig coffee machine and washer/dryer. There is a 43" television with Roku and complimentary Netflix, Amazon Prime Video, Disney +, and Hulu Live. An iPhone charger, Qi wireless
neighborhood_overview:
The Short North Arts District is the most vibrant spot in the City of Columbus and is home to over 300 exciting businesses, the majority of which are locally owned or headquartered. It has received numerous national accolades, is considered a model for urban revitalization, and is known as the art and soul of Columbus.

Goodale Park is a 33 acre urban oasis steps away from the carriage house. You will find walking paths, a pond, fountain, tennis courts, picnic tables, etc.

name: Clintonville Spacious Basement w/ Private Entrance
description:
My home is located in the heart of Clintonville on a beautiful tree-lined street. It is just north of OSU campus (2.4 miles to Ohio Stadium) and takes only a couple minutes to drive to I-71, SR315, Riverside Hospital, Mapfre Stadium, and about 10 min to the Schottenstein Center. It is within a short walk to the Farmer's Market, Starbucks, Whetstone Library, Park of Roses, Olentangy Trail, as well as many shops and restaurants. It is a GREAT location in a safe Columbus neighborhood!

The space
This listing is for the spacious basement with a private entrance. It includes one queen-sized bed, a dresser to store your clothing, and a full private bathroom. Recent upgrades include a SmartTV compatible with your subscription to Netflix, Hulu, Prime Video, etc. New renovations include a kitchenette, a sitting room behind the barn door, new drywall, painting, new carpeting (please take your shoes off at entrance!), new loveseat, and new ottoman.

Guest access
neighborhood_overview:
The house is on a beautiful, tree-lined street located in the heart of Clintonville. It is just a couple of minutes from I-71, SR315, Riverside Hospital, Schottenstein Center, Mapfre Stadium, and OSU campus. Starbucks is just a block away, as is the Clintonville Farmers' Market, which is open on Saturday mornings in the summer and fall. Whetstone Park, home to the library, the Park of Roses, fields, woods, tennis, and a playground is within walking distance. The 13-mile Olentangy River Trail goes through the park and connects downtown Columbus to Worthington.

I would be glad to answer any further questions you may have about the neighborhood, house or its location.
host_about: I am a teacher, and I am excited about being an Airbnb host! My home is my pride and joy and I love sharing it with others. In my free time, I like to go on walks with my dog, read, bike, and travel. I also enjoy spending time with my friends and family.

name: Short North/Central Italian Village Home
description:
Contemporary newer home located in the heart of the Italian Village! Less than 5 minute walk to all of the many restaurants, breweries, and shops located in the Short North and Italian Village. Less than 10 minute drive to OSU campus. Spacious, quiet, and modern home. Beautifully landscaped backyard with fire pit, water feature and grill. Electronic keypad entry to the home for your convenience. Metered parking is available on the street surrounding the house.

The space
The main level of the home is situated above the street, so there are some stairs to enter the home. Once in the home, the main level has an open space with kitchen, living room, and half bath. Upstairs you will find two of the three bedrooms. The master bedroom has a king sized sleigh bed fitted with organic cotton sheets and a luxurious bathroom with walk-in shower and marble vanity. name: Peaceful Room in Devonshire
description:
Close to I-71 and I-270, our home is good for solo adventurers and business travelers.
Located in a safe and quiet residential neighborhood on the Northside of Columbus, it is at the center of major points of attraction: 7 mi. from Polaris Mall or Ohio State Fairgrounds, 8 mi. from Easton Mall or OSU, 10 mi. from Greyhound station, 14 mi. from the Airport, and just 3 mi. from Kroger.
If you must eat healthy, no problem! Our local health food store and diner, Raisin Rack, is just 2 miles away.

The space
Located on the 2nd floor, this little room is peaceful, inviting, and comfortable.
Enjoy the use of your own Coffee machine ~ Choice of teas ~ your own refrigerator, space Air Conditioner or heater. A microwave is shared with another guest, if any.
The front porch is a peaceful little place to sit - or work - on sunny or drizzling days.

License number
2019-1315
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is great for walking and our location is close to shopping or restaurants with just a short drive.
host_about:
Hello and welcome to Columbus, Ohio! 

My husband is from Japan, an amateur radio lover, chigiri-e artist, sushi chef, and excellent cook. I grew up in a tiny village of the French Alps, enjoy nature, a good movie, and a walk in the park together with my hubby. While taking care of our family, children, and grandchildren, we keep expanding our friendship circle.  

And I am so grateful to our Airbnb community who is bringing such a diverse group of travelers to our doorstep including those who are coming for business, conferences, exhibitions, visiting relatives, nurses and students needing a comfortable bed after a long day of work or training, and even people who are here to relocate. 

We’re friendly and try to provide our guests with what we appreciate when we are away from home – a relaxing, peaceful, and loving place for a refreshing night rest.

Clintonville has so many wonderful restaurants and attractions an easy walk or ride from the condo. Campus, short north and downtown Columbus are easily accessible and a short bike or uber ride away.

The space

The first floor has a covered, outdoor rear porch with seating area, a large kitchen with island and eat in dining nook. The living area has WIFI & cable TV and plenty of seating (including a queen sleeper sofa)! The dining room has a large table that can accommodate 10-12 guests. Additionally, there is a small bedroom with twin bunkbeds, desk and ful
neighborhood_overview: Old North Columbus is a neighborhood located just north of the Ohio State University in Columbus, Ohio. It was founded in 1847 where, at the time, it was a stand-alone city out of the confines of Columbus until it was incorporated into the City of Columbus in 1871. In its early years the city was a popular stagecoach stop with people traveling from Worthington to Columbus. Today Old North Columbus is popular for its local music and its unique "untouched architecture" which is reminiscent of its old roots.

A few blocks east on Broad, you'll find Wolfe Park and tennis courts. Panera Bread is down the street about a mile. Spend an afternoon or evening on Main Street in Bexley, home of Capital University. Take in a movie at the Drexel Theater, visit Guiseppe's Italian Bistro, Aab India, Cafe Instanbul, Zen Cha Tea Salon, or any number of ice cream and pizza parlors. The Grain and Grape has an excellent choice of wines and beers, and there are several nail salons and banks. Pick up a few groceries at Kroger or Giant Eagle (which also boasts a restaurant at the top called The Table).

host_about: Eric grew up in Mesa, AZ and I, Kelly, grew up in Seattle, WA. We met while in school in Utah and got married in 2015. In the summer of 2017 we moved to Columbus, OH for Eric to attend grad school at OSU. Eric and I have 2 darling little boys and love to play games, spend time in the outdoors, and be with family. Once the idea of becoming Airbnb hosts formed we couldn't wait to start! We love hosting and being a part of the Airbnb community.

name: Enjoy my master guest bedroom
description:
This is a shared listing with me in my home. Close to restaurants, family-friendly activities, and nightlife. You’ll love my place because of the location, comfy living, cul-de-sac neighborhood, wifi, and there's a grill in the fenced backyard. As last minute cancellations are costly - My place is perfect for couples, families, solo adventurers, and business travelers who are committed to their booking dates. I welcome all guests from various backgrounds - I make a great conversationalist.

The space
As the real estate saying goes, location location location. The property is ideally located in between Dublin and Worthington. Minutes from restaurants, entertainment and the business sectors of both communities. Simply take 315 South for a quick ride to downtown Columbus. Situated in a cul-de-sac the property enjoys a quiet, mature neighborhood. The property is a three level split with seven steps upstairs or six steps down to the lower level of the home. When you en
neighborhood_overview: What I love about my neighborhood is that it has quiet mature neighbors. The property is on a cul-de-sac and has very little traffic. An interesting note: if you are a bird observer, you'll enjoy a variety of birds such as Blue Jays and Cardinals living in the neighborhood. Make sure to check out my Guidebook for activities, entertainment and restaurants - it's a reference of all my favorite places in Columbus. I'm a member of a Pizzeria meetup - My favorite mom & pop pizzerias are listed.
host_about:
Howdy! I’m Jake. I’m originally from New York, and while I miss my friends and family back home (not to mention the beach!), I absolutely love my mid-west home here in Columbus, Ohio!
By day I’m a real estate investor and by night I’m a social butterfly with my friends. I'm also an Airbnb cohost where I mentor aspiring local hosts. I earned my Superhost status because I have high standards for value, cleanliness, and communication.
I enjoy travelling and creating new experiences. My favorite country is Guatemala. The people, the food and the historical sites are breathtaking. My favorite city is Chicago. Through these travels and coupled with my 14 years landlording, I’ve been fortunate to learn what makes a great host: a great home, with a friendly host, in an awesome neighborhood, and the ability to do the things you love! I try to ensure that each and every guest I host walks away with all of that and hopefully more.
My life motto is, well, really my grandmother’s advice, “Jakey, live with NO REGRETS” (I can hear her thick NYer accent now). Sometimes I guess we just need a little reminder of that… And so, I invite you to travel more and see the big, beautiful world we live in.

name: Iuka I, 4BR, 1.5B, Parking, 1600 sqft RoweRentals
description:
This comfy, 1600 sqft apartment w/ 2 parking spots is a quiet escape in the city and a short Uber to the Short North. Located on N. 4th St. N of 17th St. near I-71 & 670.

Please read listing & rules thoroughly before making a reservation.

Proximity:
Ohio Expo Center/Fairground- 0.8 mi
OSU- 1.3 mi
Short North- 1.5 mi
Maphre Crew Stadium- 1.5 mi
Schottenstein Center- 1.9 mi
Convention Center- 2.8 mi
Downtown- w/in 3.8 mi radius

The space
Have a large group? Check out the sister listing on Airbnb & our other apartments. No parties or events allowed.

ADDITIONAL GUESTS & FEES
Please note there is an additional guest fee per person/night for the 4th guest and up. When entering the correct guest count into the reservation or inquiry this will be automatically calculated. We offer an apartment at cost effective prices for small and large groups. The quote breakdown shows the additional guest fe
neighborhood_overview:
The duplex is located near Iuka Ravine on N. 4th St. We have lived here in the past and would again! There is a mix of musicians, professors, students, and working professionals live in the area. There are bus stops nearby and a nice park, the ravine, down the hill (about a one minute walking distance) from the house.

The apartment is within walking distance (15 mins or so) to Ohio State University.

IS THE NEIGHBORHOOD SAFE?
We live nearby and feel the neighborhood is relatively safe, but it can be a bit intimidating if you are not use to city living. Please note this is the city- we do have petty crime in the Short North and University area, and always advise to practice not leaving valuables in your car (we have not had any issues at our apartments, I state this because we are in the city) and walk with a buddy at night on well-lit, busy roads such as High Street, Summit, and 5th Ave.
host_about:
A few years after meeting in Japan, we moved to Columbus in 2OO9 and have been loving it ever since! We love traveling (25+ countries between us) and are passionate about renovating historic homes and building new homes. Please check out our IGs at @RoweRentals and @RoweHouseCbus to see our house journey.

We love being hosts- providing a comfortable home to travelers visiting our gem of a city- 'Cbus'! We know quite a lot about Short North entertainment & restaurants- there is so much to do here, feel free to ask!
- Ingrid, Mike, and Frances, Co-Host 

Our life motto- Live like someone left the gate open!

description:
Beautiful, spacious home in a tranquil setting. Great walkable neighborhood close to OSU and downtown Columbus.

The space
You have access to the full house. There is tons of space to stretch out and relax. This house has been immaculately decorated for your maximum comfort in mind. Not to mention the natural light is some of the best you’ll ever experience in any house.

Guest access
You have access to the entire house, yard, screened in porch. Have at it!!

Other things to note
BRIDES/GROOMS, the lighting in this space is PERFECT for photography. This home would be a great base for getting ready, or for your guests to stay.

Families, there's a great backyard with play equipment and sitting area. Inside there are toys, and bunk beds that any child would love.

License number
2019-1674
neighborhood_overview: Wonderful neighborhood, along the bike path, which runs to Ohio State's campus and onward to downtown.  Local grocery stores, restaurants, and bars, all within walking distance of the house.
host_about: I live and breathe for travel, so it only makes sense that when I can't be traveling myself, I would be hosting travelers!!!   I love meeting new people, experiencing new cultures, and just wow'ing my brain with any new experience possible!  I've lived in China and Indonesia, and have been to almost every state here in America!!   I love being an Airbnb host, (and guest) and hopefully someday our paths will cross, in this great journey of life!!!!

name: Short North/Italian Village Townhome
description:
FEATURED IN (614) Magazine AS ONE OF THE TOP 3 Airbnb UNITS IN COLUMBUS!

SEPARATE RENTAL AGREEMENT OUTSIDE OF AIRBNB IS REQUIRED TO BE SIGNED AND GOVERNMENT ISSUED ID NEEDS TO PROVIDED TO US AS WELL

A beautifully renovated town home with a prime location, in one of the hottest neighborhoods in the country!This home is located steps from the heart of the Short North, and walking distance to various restaurants, bars, and neighborhood shops. Convenient to the convention center, and OSU as well.

The space
This home is perfect for entertaining, or for a family to relax together. Downstairs, there is a sofa with a memory foam pull out full sized pull out mattress, love seat, and accent chair. When you walk into the home, there is a table with chairs where guests can relax and chat with each other, or maybe even play a game of cards!

The property has been completely renovated including the kitchen, bathroom, and light fixtures.
neighborhood_overview:
The Short North Arts District is a pioneer in urban revitalization. The Short North Arts District is the most vibrant spot in the City of Columbus and is home to over 300 exciting businesses, the majority of which are locally owned or headquartered. It has received numerous national accolades, is considered a model for urban revitalization, and is known as the art and soul of Columbus.

Directly east of High Street is Italian Village. New energy is transforming this spot into a nightlife hub. Little Rock hosts live music, Seventh Son Brewing uses its creative energy to craft category-busting beers, and Hoof Hearted Brewing combines heavy-hitting brews with a thoroughly mod taproom. In the daylight hours, check out The Market Italian Village for upscale picnic supplies and delicious pizzas, or the sunlight-drenched Fox in the Snow Cafe for an outstanding latte
host_about: I love to cook and travel!

name: Art at 185 German Village
description:
Welcome to Art at 185, our studio apartment in the heart of German Village. This space has been created for guests to enjoy not only a stay in Historic German Village but also a display of local art, currently featuring works from Open Door Art Gallery, located in Grandview. (URL HIDDEN) Once a working art studio has now been turned into a cozy studio apartment walking distance from the fabulous restaurants in German Village, downtown Columbus and Children's Hospital.

The space
Art at 185 is bigger and better than it looks, it is quite spacious and you will not want to “judge the book by the cover .” This space was built in 1890’s and once a buggy/car mechanic garage . Currently the studio showcases original art created by Columbus artists. Founded in 2007, Open Door Art Studio empowers artists with disabilities to work with professional creative mentors in an environment of mutual respect and creative freedom. I also have several of my 92 year old father’s han
neighborhood_overview: We are located in the heart of historic German Village, a quiet neighborhood on the southern edge of downtown Columbus.  This quaint community allows you to walk to multiple restaurants, coffee shops, gift stores and park.
host_about: As a 41 year residents of Columbus Ohio and graduate of The Ohio State University,  we have seen how this amazing city has grown and changed. As empty nesters,  we recently moved back to German Village where my husband and I met and lived when we were first married. We raised our children in Upper Arlington and are now enjoying all The Village and city life has to offer . I love to stay physically active, enjoy the arts, the mountains of Montana, the heat of Austin and of course The Ohio State University.

description:
Updated Victorian house in the historic Victorian Village. Very close to the Short North, Downtown, the Arnold, Convention Center. Many of the best restaurants and bars in Columbus walking distance. Good for groups visiting Columbus for business or pleasure. $16 uber from airport. $7 uber to downtown, Convention Center, etc. Plenty of non-metered (free) street parking on my quiet residential street. Spacious house with a big front porch. Has a laundry area on site, dishwasher, etc. Newly renovated. One bedroom and one bathroom

name: Huge Downtown Apartment with Free Parking
description:
Huge Apartment in Downtown Columbus.

Everything you need: Free Parking Space. 65in smart Apple TV and Netflix. Super fast internet. Brand new furniture. Full kitchen and new appliances. iMac. Vinyl records. Unique paintings. Strong central AC/heating. Washer/Dryer.

Perfect Location: Near The Short North. Southern Theatre, Ohio Theatre and Columbus Commons. German Village and the Brewery District are all next door!

Ideal for a couple or have the entire place to yourself. No parties permitted.

The space
A deeply cleaned, recently remodeled 1,400 sq. foot apartment with 15 foot living room ceilings, brand new furniture, and appliances.

This is the only apartment on the Top Floor (3rd) of a private, High Street building in Downtown Columbus. You're surrounded by bars and restaurants. You have a free parking space in a private parking lot behind the building, security cameras in the hallways of the building and on the outsid
neighborhood_overview: Perfectly located in downtown Columbus above a quiet, Irish restaurant called Dempsy's, near the Riverfront parks, Southern Theatre, Ohio Theatre, COSI science center, and bar/restaurants like The Walrus, 16-bit Arcade, Sidebar, Mikey's Late Night Slice, Winan's, Condado, and The GOAT, right around the corner. There are plenty of speak easy's and cocktail bars in German Village, including some of the finest dining in town like Barcelona, Lindy's, G. Michael's, Pistacio Vera, and Rockmill Tavern.
host_about:
During college, I spent two years on the road as a musician, performing shows with 21 Pilots, and all around the US and Europe. Throughout my travels, I started a few small businesses and non-profits, and made Columbus my home. I’m currently a Management Consultant. I travel internationally for technology projects, speak at conferences, and research culture in city transformation initiatives.

As an AirBnB host, I enjoy creating the kind of environment that I would want to have for myself as a traveler — a place that’s modern, comfortable, equipped with new and working amenities, and in the heart of downtown, near bars, restaurants, theaters, and conferences, yet still restful and peaceful.

name: The High Street Hideaway
description:
Best location in Columbus!! This modernistic condo resides in the heart of the Short North, located on the 3rd floor in the historic Yukon building. Within one block you'll find the Convention Center, Goodale Park, and the best dining and nightlife Columbus has to offer.

The space
Enjoy your own space in this private, top floor corner unit. Featuring a full kitchen, sectional sofa, hypoallergenic memory foam queen mattress, in unit air conditioning, washer & dryer, Alexa voice remote with HBO-go, Amazon Prime, and Netflix logins, secure Wi-Fi, and hassle-free keyless entry. Perfect for the single business traveler, convention center event goer, or anyone looking to enjoy a night out on the town.

The Joseph parking garage is located one block away on Russel St, for $30/day. If you do not want to pay for parking, free parking is just a five-ten minute walk away on residential streets. Meter parking is also available directly outside and on surrounding

name: Great Amenities @ Shumacher Place & German Village
description:
Cozy bungalow style house with modern finishes and private yard with a great porch to sit and relax during the day or at night. Feel at home in the Historical Schumacher & German Village area within walking distance to Children's Hospital, Downtown & many popular shops & restaurants. While you have access to the whole home I live on premises in the lower level basement apartment, which has a separate entrance in the back from the rest of the house and shares a small foyer. You have total privacy

The space
This has a queen size bed and desk in the larger room and a queen in the smaller room that will sleep two. The living room has an Ikea sofa bed that's between a full and Queen and can sleep 2. There is also a queen size air mattress available. Living room also has electric fireplace(this is not a real fireplace) and smart Wi-Fi TV and streaming services from YouTube live TV, and Amazon Video. There is Amazon Alexa to help you with directions or to listen to you
neighborhood_overview: This Is in the Historical Shumacher place and German Village area and is within walking distance from Children's Hospital, Downtown Columbus and many popular shops and restaurants. Just a 5 min. Walk to two popular Eateries the Sycamore and Plank's. The pizza at Plank's is very popular among the locals. This is a very safe area and I have not had any issues. There is a Giant Eagle grocery near by and as mentioned before some of the most popular Bars and Restaurant's near by.
host_about:
I was born In Missouri but grew up in Columbus Ohio since I was an infant. I'm a New Years baby and was actually the first of the year in the town I was born in. I served in the Military back in the late 80's and early 90's. I am easy going and like to stay active, exercise and eat healthy. My favorite activity is shooting pool. I'm fascinated by Science and Technology. I Like to listen to many different styles of music but my favorite is Classic rock. My favorite destination has to be anywhere there's palm trees and white sandy beaches but i do like the outdoors and love different types of climates. 
I hope to be a great host and will treat you like i would expect to be treated. I did spend a great deal of my life working in the service industry and know what it takes to provide exceptional service.

name: Family friendly, clean, restful stay
description:
Clean and peaceful stay on the south side of Columbus. Our place is a 10 minute drive to downtown, a 5 minute walk to the bus station on South Parsons Ave. (Bus line #8 will take you downtown in 15 minutes), a 5 minute drive to Scioto Downs raceway, and a 2 minute drive to the I-270 outerbelt. It takes about 15-20 minutes to get to or from Columbus John Glenn International Airport. We have free high-speed internet and a washer and a dryer for a small fee.

The space
Our place isn't in downtown, but it is close and easily-accessible to all the major attractions of Columbus. Further, our proximity to the highway allows you to travel around the central Ohio area rather easily. We live in a peaceful and safe neighborhood on the south side conveniently (2-5 minutes) to shopping and restaurants. Within walking distance is a nice recreation center and park which has a half mile track. Our three bedroom bi-level house is home to my wife, son, and I as well as one roommate
neighborhood_overview: Bunch restaurants close by.
host_about: I'm an easy-going guy who enjoys traveling and exploring this big world. My wife and I love hosting and sharing experiences with our guests. Together we have been to many countries around the world and hope to travel to many more. When you come to our home we can show you around town or leave you to your own. We just hope you have an enjoyable and peaceful stay!

name: Comfy home minutes from Downtown
description:
I'm honored you chose my property. During your stay, you'll enjoy a spacious 1,100 square feet apartment, close to restaurants, family-friendly activities, and a 5 minute drive downtown. You’ll love the proximity to downtown, comfy living, in an up and coming neighborhood that is being gentrified. As last minute cancellations are costly - My place is perfect for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers who are committed to their booking dates.

The space
I require a profile contain a face picture, a current government issued photo ID , a current phone number and email address. Before sending inquiries, make sure your profile is updated, otherwise, I will decline your inquiry.

The property is ideally located 5 minutes from COSI and Downtown Columbus - only a 8 minute drive to the Convention Center. Minutes from restaurants, entertainment and the business sectors. Simply take either Town or Broad Street East for a quick 5 minute ride to downtown
neighborhood_overview:
What I love about the neighborhood is that it has quiet mature neighbors and it's proximity to the downtown area. Franklinton is an old community. The local city and state government are spending millions gentrifying this neighborhood.
It is 5 minutes from Downtown/Arena District. (Nationwide Arena, Express Live, North Market), 9 minutes from the infamous Short North. The "art & soul" of Columbus, the Short North is a vibrant cultural and small business community. Park your car along Goodale Park on Buttles Ave for free and gallery hop, thrift or have dinner/drinks at just about any type of bar. 8 minutes away from the Greater Convention Center.

Make sure to check out my Guidebook for activities, entertainment and restaurants - it's a reference of all my favorite places in Columbus. I'm a member of a Pizzeria meetup - My favorite mom & pop pizzerias are listed.
host_about:
Howdy! I’m Jake. I’m originally from New York, and while I miss my friends and family back home (not to mention the beach!), I absolutely love my mid-west home here in Columbus, Ohio!
By day I’m a real estate investor and by night I’m a social butterfly with my friends. I'm also an Airbnb cohost where I mentor aspiring local hosts. I earned my Superhost status because I have high standards for value, cleanliness, and communication.
I enjoy travelling and creating new experiences. My favorite country is Guatemala. The people, the food and the historical sites are breathtaking. My favorite city is Chicago. Through these travels and coupled with my 14 years landlording, I’ve been fortunate to learn what makes a great host: a great home, with a friendly host, in an awesome neighborhood, and the ability to do the things you love! I try to ensure that each and every guest I host walks away with all of that and hopefully more.
My life motto is, well, really my grandmother’s advice, “Jakey, live with NO REGRETS” (I can hear her thick NYer accent now). Sometimes I guess we just need a little reminder of that… And so, I invite you to travel more and see the big, beautiful world we live in.

2) Best Sleep You Ever Had (at an Airbnb) – One hyphenated word, Temper-Pedic.
3) Updated Modern Design - updated finishings with old-world character.

The space
Relax and treat yo' self in this beautiful 2 bedroom house just steps from the best of the Short North Arts District! Our beautifully renovated, historic home delivers modern finishes with historic character.

Our home boasts an open concept floorplan, stainless steel appliances, and a fenced-in backyard for BBQ! You and your group will love being just a 5 min walk to High Street where you can explore the best that Columbus has to offer in the Short North, Victorian Village, and Downtown neighborhoods.

Who is this property a great fit for?

• Smaller groups of 5 adults or less.
• Guests looking to be centrally located to all that Columbus has to offer.

name: Charming Clintonville Cottage
description:
Cozy vintage cottage in South Clintonville, steps to the bike path in one direction, High St and shops, restaurants, and bars in the other.

The whole 1st floor, with 2 bedrooms, dining and living room, and kitchen and bath is available to spread out and make yourself at home. I’ll sometimes be home, mostly hanging out upstairs, and sometimes I’ll be out of town. The bathroom and kitchen are shared when I’m home.

Our home is 110 years old, with all the quirks and charms that come with it!

The space
Our eclectic bohemian home is in one of Columbus’ older neighborhoods, on a quaint brick lined street in Clintonville. Built in 1907, it’s unusual in its- mostly- original design, with a quirk of no hallways, and each room having a minimum of two doorways. There are even two front doors, confusing UPS drivers for a few generations now!

We have a front porch and back yard and garden to enjoy during the warmer months. Inside, there’s a co
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood, Clintonville, is one of C-bus’ jewels. Just north of the University area, the neighborhood is full of vintage homes, built between 1900 and the 1930s. Always in the top 3 of best places to live and hang out in Columbus, it’s progressive, walkable, and safe. Clintonville has lots of restaurants, breweries, coffee shops, and bars, along with shops of all kinds, many of which are within a few block walk of our home. Our home is exactly halfway between High St, with all the stops and places to eat and drink, and the Olentangy Bike Trail, which takes you from downtown to the south, to Worthington, a few miles to the north, and several parks along the way.

High St is Columbus’ main thoroughfare, and it can take you pretty much anywhere you need to go. Busses are frequent and inexpensive, and Uber or Lyft can take you downtown, OSU, or the Short North in just a few minutes.
host_about:
Introvert who loves people. Liker of books, food, sharing opinions, pretty things, and bad music.

When you’re staying with me, sometimes I’ll be home but staying out of your way, and sometimes I’ll be traveling for work. I’m a Certified Tourism Ambassador for Columbus, so I’m very happy to share recommendations for places to while you’re spending time in C-bus.

If I’m traveling, I’ll be looking for a place to relax after seeing your town, and while we will surely find you delightful we will largely be seeking alone time.

The front room is a great spot to have a cup of coffee, get some work done on the desk, or just watch a show on the smart TV. The dinning space is great for a group meal or workspace. The main level room is smaller and cozy, and the upstairs room is massive!

In our home you will find:
~ 2 Bedrooms with a total of 3 queen beds.
~ Large kitchen w/ bar-top a
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood Franklinton is situated just west of Downtown Columbus, and is full of historic homes. This neighborhood has experienced many phases through out it's existence, and is currently in a revitalization phase. There are lots of properties being renovated, and some that still remain boarded and empty. This area has experienced some crime in the past, but has improved in recent years.

Franklinton has experienced several great floods in the past, and has been somewhat neglected throughout the middle to late part of the 1900's. The Franklinton Floodwall, completed in 2004, is 7 miles long, cost $134 million. The wall's completion has released the area from being considered a floodplain, as well as releasing the previous building restrictions that often prevented development in the past. As a result, commercial and industrial activities are starting to grow in the Franklinton Area.

The City of Columbus is focusing on creating a new Short North style neigh
host_about: I continue to be excited about Airbnb and home-sharing every day! I enjoy hosting guests, I LOVE to travel, and I really love meeting new people. I am a real estate broker that owns my own business, and I feel that my calling in life is to making spaces for people to enjoy. 5 things I can't live without are live music, friends, exploring new places, bacon, my drum set!

Location is key and the Italian Village Carriage House is close to amazing restaurants, shopping, parks, coffee shops, great breweries and much more.

name: Short North One Bed w/Off-street Parking
description:
An 800 sq.ft. one bedroom apartment with 10 foot ceilings and hardwood floors steps from High Street in the Short North. This is a great apartment for access to events at Ohio State, Express Live, Nationwide Arena, the Convention Center, or Goodale Park. Inside work at a desk by the window, or sprawl on the couch or queen bed and watch TV.

The space
The whole unit has 10 foot ceilings, three ceiling fans, and hardwood floors giving this space a great feel.

The living room sofa converts to a double bed. Enjoy high speed internet, and a smart TV that you can watch from the sofa. The coffee table folds open to provide a surface perfect for eating at or working on a laptop while sitting on the sofa. Ikea nailed this one.

Newly upgraded kitchen includes a full sized refrigerator, gas range, microwave, dishwasher, coffee maker, and bar height four top table. The kitchen has the basics in terms of pots, pants, a wine opener, pizza cutter, ice
neighborhood_overview:
Enjoy Northstar Cafe just around the corner for breakfast, brunch, lunch, or dinner. If you're into tacos, Condado is a fun spot. Mouton is a lovely choice for craft cocktails, and if caffeine is your need One Line Coffee shop is a great choice.

The Short North has it all - from great events in Goodale Park and at the Convention Center, to restaurants, bars, coffee shops, galleries, and local shops. This apartment puts you in the heart of the neighborhood.

host_about:

My career in the non-profit sector has let me travel all over the country. I love the Bay Area, NYC, Washington state, and the Rockies.

name: The White Brick Studio @ OSU & Short North
description:
Freshly updated studio apartment with a private outside entrance, located just between the Short North and The Ohio State University! Walk to popular High St. dining and nightlife in under 10 minutes, to OSU Medical Center in under 15 minutes, to Columbus Convention Center in 25. Renovated in 2018 with new furniture and queen memory foam mattress! Off-street parking may be available for $3 per day - just ask. Studio is in a vintage building on a quiet residential street.

The space
This is a recently updated studio apartment (no door between the kitchen and bedroom) on the first floor of a vintage building on a quiet street, right between OSU and the popular Short North Arts District - walk to campus, shops, night life, and restaurants! The building was originally a single family house, like many buildings in the area - because of this, the interior walls are not soundproof and we request that noise is kept to a minimum after 9pm to respect our neighbors.
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is in the perfect location between Ohio State and the Short North. Our street and the nearby ones have some beautiful grand Victorian homes. This neighborhood draws a healthy blend of graduate students, young professionals, and families. Many of the grand Victorian homes have been split up into multiple units, like this one!
host_about:
Hi, we're Kate and Nat!  We live here in the "Short North" neighborhood of Columbus, near the properties that we manage.

We are both graduates of The Ohio State University - Go Bucks!  Kate is a physical therapist and Nat has a background in IT & management consulting.  We love being Airbnb hosts and hearing about all the exciting reasons that people travel to Columbus!

name: Your Home Away From Home Near the Airport
description:
No shortcuts were taken here and less than 5 minutes from the airport. If you are looking for a place that feels like home, this would be for you! It has a loft feel with all the bells and whistles. Filtered water, coffee, with an all-around comfortable environment. There is a 55" TV in the main room, and two bedrooms have 49" TV’s, all have smart-capabilities with access to Hulu & Netflix. You have Bluetooth capability to play music on JBL speakers in the living room.

The space
Very clean and laid-back with a modern touch. It has a gas range so you can make yourself a nice home-cooked meal. There are plenty of restaurants that are close if you decide you don't want to cook. Please read previous reviews. If you plan on leaving poor feedback concerning the location please do not book. For additional comfort I have setup security cameras for the entrance stairwell and outside perimeter. I respect all my guests privacy, there are no cameras inside the units. If you
neighborhood_overview: Please read the reviews before booking concerning the location. If you plan to leave negative feedback due to what has already been addressed, please do not book. The home next to me has been purchased from the city of Columbus. I have spoken to the new owner and progress is being made. It is currently being renovated and will look new once completed. For additional comfort I have setup security cameras for the entrance stairwell and outside perimeter. I respect all my guests privacy, there are no cameras inside the units.

name: Valleyview Suite
description:
We have a contemporary Guest Suite located just 2 miles from I-70 or I-270 and 10 minutes from Downtown Columbus, 6 miles (11 minutes) from the Nationwide Arena and about 2 blocks from the Ohio to Erie Trail (Camp Chase) bike trail. We are also 1.3 miles from the Hollywood Casino and about 14 minutes from the OSU Stadium.

The space
Our Space is a Private Guest Suite above our garage that has 1 bedroom with a queen bed, and kitchenette. We provide clean sheets, towels and amenities. One thing to note, you will need to be able to climb stairs to the second floor.

Guest access
It is located above the garage on the second floor. It has its own entrance with keypad.
There is a parking spot available in front and side of the suite.

2019-1110
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is a work in progress.  Many are like us and bought their homes to redo.
host_about:
My husband and I moved to Columbus from NJ to be with our grandchildren a few years ago.  We bought our house as a rehab and have been working on it since.  This is a new experience for us but we have enjoyed it.

We are both originally from the Midwest, my husband was born in Kansas and grew up in Illinois.  I was born and grew up in Michigan.  We lived in Colorado for 13 years before moving to NJ and have loved all the places we have lived.  

We have travelled to many parts of the world (Mexico, Israel, Philippines, Korea, Europe) and enjoyed the different cultures as well as made many new friends.  I think this is one of the reasons we love Columbus.  There are so many different cultures here as well as their cuisines which I love to try. We find Columbus offers many of the experiences of a larger city but love the smaller size.

name: Oasis in the City (Near Bexley)
description:
Nestled in Columbus' east side, our home sits on half an acre of land amidst a residential locale of long term residents. It is ideally located one minute from the I-70 highway on one of the main north/south arteries in the city. It sits back from the street allowing for ample parking and clear passage to and from the road. It is a 5 mile drive to downtown, 5 mile direct commute to the airport, and minutes away from convenient stores, restaurants, suburbs, and many of Columbus' popular venues.

The space
Our home is a 1000 sq ft ranch with an open layout in which the living room, dining room, and kitchen are closely shared spaces. The bathroom and bedrooms are separated from that space by a short hallway for privacy. The front yard and particularly the backyard offer ample areas for light recreation and relaxation. The backyard includes a patio with a table and chairs to unwind. The backyard grass is a unique, extra soft type that will encourage guests to take off
neighborhood_overview: In two different directions, our location is ideally located about 1 mile from I-70 highway. It is a straight shot to Columbus International Airport. It is 1 mile from the suburb of Bexley, a high-end community with cozy ambiance including many popular restaurants like Starbucks, Chipotle, Piada, Boston Market, Penn Station and Jersey Mike's subs, Panera Bread, as well as other local favorites such as Columbus' own Donatos Pizza, Cafe Instabul, C'est Si Bon Cafe featuring a diverse selection of crepes, Rubino's extra thin crust pizza, Rusty Bucket Restaurant and Tavern, Johnson's and Grater's ice cream shops, and more! One of our major grocery stores, Giant Eagle Marketplace, sits right across from the suburb's private college campus of Capital University- All of that atmosphere just one mile away! The neighborhoods in front and behind our home are quiet and residential. Two blocks behind the house is a small, private high school so guests may hear distant cheers and whistles, and see
host_about: OSU Buckeye alumni born and raised in Cbus, we are a husband and wife team who  enjoy people and cultures, traveling, and pursuing our dreams together. Columbus has so much to offer, and we desire to share our city and make our guests feel at home while in our abode.

description:

The house is very comfortable but its 9 ft ceilings make it feel grand! Three living spaces occupy the main floor including a cook's kitchen/dining area opening out onto the garden patio.

The walled garden is designed as a series of outdoor rooms & the attached carport serves as an 'al dente' covered dining room.

Enjoy!

The space
We are only the 3rd owners of this original German Village home. It is very comfortable and unique! In addition to the 9 ft ceilings, we have 3 working fireplaces, making it really comfortable and cozy! Just steps from Schiller Park, Jeni’s Ice Cream and the Brown Bag Deli...a great location!

Guest access
You’ll have full access to all parts of the house so we hope you'll make youself comfortable! We love to cook an
neighborhood_overview: German Village is an historic neighborhood developed in the mid-1800's by German immigrants who moved to Columbus to work in the breweries along the river, now known as the Brewery District.  Brick streets are lined with brick cottages and larger Italianate and Queen Anne houses, intermingled with great restaurants and shops.  Schiller Park is the heart and soul of German Village with a recreation center, public gardens, tennis courts, a ball field and an outdoor amphitheater for summer plays.
host_about: Brooke and I are design professionals and we travel for business and for fun.   We are life-long-learners and readers, nature lovers and art enthusiasts who love to connect with family, friends and locals in the cultural fabric of any community, close to theatre, parks, museums and restaurants - which is why we live where we do and travel whenever we can.  Life is good!

neighborhood_overview:
Stretching north from Ohio State to Worthington, Clintonville is a large neighborhood with many attractions, from the Park of Roses to the independently owned retail shops and restaurants that line High Street. Standout shops include modern decor purveyor Elm and Iron, fabric mecca Sew to Speak and all-locally made Wholly Craft.

During warmer months, people flock to the Clintonville Farmers Market to get fresh produce and to the Olentangy River recreational trail to hike and bike. Arts venues like Wild Goose Creative and Studio 35 provide cultural opportunities year-round.

Start your day with a cup of coffee at Cup O' Joe or Crimson Cup, both on the Columbus Coffee Trail. Dining choices veer toward farm-to-table, with Acre, Harvest Pizzeria, The Crest Gastropub and Angry Bear Kitchen as standouts. Get in line for world-class barbecue at the Ray Ray’s Hog Pit truck, at live music hotspot Ace of Cups.

Learn some new skills amid a gorgeous setting at Th

name: Historic Oak Street Apartment
description:
Lovely one bedroom apartment in great downtown location

The space
Historic 1850’s Italianate brick building, located in the downtown east sector of Columbus. This spacious first floor, one bedroom apartment ( 1400 square feet.) comes with one off-street parking space. It includes all new furnishings. The kitchen is well equipped as well as a coffee maker with coffee included. Wi-Fi is provided with a workspace as well separate kitchen, dining room, living room, and bedroom. You will have plenty of room to relax. It is close to the Columbus River Front where many of the festivals are located. The Columbus Museum of Art, The Topiary Park, and Columbus College of Art and Design are all within walking distance. The Bluestone is a seven minute walk from the apartment and It is a short Uber ride to The Franklin Park Conservatory, German Village, OSU stadium, Mapfre stadium, COSI and The Short North.

name: The Level Two Studio @ OSU & Short North
description:
Level Two Studio is a recently renovated second floor studio apartment with a private outside entrance, walking distance to both the Short North Arts District and The Ohio State University! Walk to popular High St. dining and nightlife in under 10 minutes - OSU Medical Center in under 15 minutes - Columbus Convention Center in 25. Off-street parking may be available for $3/day - just ask. Studio is in a vintage building on a quiet residential street.

The space
This is a recently updated studio apartment (open doorway between the kitchen and bedroom) on the second floor of a vintage building on a quiet street, right between OSU and the popular Short North Arts District - walk to campus, shops, nightlife, and restaurants! The building was originally a single family house, like many buildings in the area - because of this, the interior walls are not soundproof and we request that noise is kept to a minimum after 9pm to respect our neighbors.

*****
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is in the perfect location between Ohio State and the Short North. Our street and the nearby ones have some beautiful grand Victorian homes. This neighborhood draws a healthy blend of graduate students, young professionals, and families. Many of the grand Victorian homes have been split up into multiple units, like this one!
host_about:
Hi, we're Kate and Nat!  We live here in the "Short North" neighborhood of Columbus, near the properties that we manage.

We are both graduates of The Ohio State University - Go Bucks!  Kate is a physical therapist and Nat has a background in IT & management consulting.  We love being Airbnb hosts and hearing about all the exciting reasons that people travel to Columbus!

neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood is in a lovely pocket of Columbus. Lined with big beautiful trees, a great Park down the street & remarkably quiet day & night.
Filled with neighbors that care about their properties & each other.
host_about:
We are your Super Host's Christy & Emily. 
We take pride in making sure our home is SANITIZED & spotless for you.  Our Guest's health & comfort is very important to us.

We understand how expensive Hotels can be.  If you're traveling for work or pleasure, this is the perfect place to rest your head.

We even have a Caretaker (Brian), he will help you with anything you need around our home.  He is very friendly (but values your privacy), he really knows Columbus too!  If you have any questions or need anything, just call/text him. 
Brian lives in the apt. on the lower level & has a completely separate entrance.  He works most nights & is only available during the day (10am-8pm). 
Both of our phone #'s are in the Welcome letter on Kitchen counter. 
Call or text anytime. 

We are from a Military family & welcome Military families to stay with us!

Minutes away from Downtown Columbus, COSI, Nationwide Arena, The Schottenstein Center, Convention Center, the Short North and most importantly the 'Shoe, home of THE Ohio State Buckeye Football Team. All within walking distance, a bus ride or Uber away.

The space

The main bedroom has a comfortable Queen Sleep Number Bed! Trust me, once you find your number it will be the best sleep of your life. The second me from also has a queen bed. The 5th and 6th guests have space on the large and comfortable sectional couch.

The kitchen i

neighborhood_overview:
Olde Towne East is one of the oldest neighborhoods in Columbus and is currently undergoing rapid revitalization. The neighborhood has over 1,000 homes, some as old as the 1830s, and more than 50 architectural styles as a result of its history. Some homes have been restored and others remain untouched as reminders of eras that have gone before. Our street and surrounding streets are some of the safest blocks in Columbus! For more information about the neighborhood, check out crime heat maps online, g@@gle map view or search, and learn a little bit more about the history of the community!

Olde Towne East is host to interesting clusters of dining and nightlife along Parsons Avenue and Oak Street. On Parsons, grab a coffee at Upper Cup, enjoy farm-fresh produce at Black Creek Bistro and music and drinks at local favorite Carabar. On Oak Street, try breakfast at vegan-friendly The Angry Baker, lunch at the Olde Towne Tavern and dinner and a huge beer list at Yellow Brick Pizza. F

neighborhood_overview:
German Village is a historic neighborhood just south of downtown Columbus, OH. Initially platted in 1814 in Columbus' South End, German Village was generally developed between years 1840 and 1914. It was settled largely by German immigrants in the mid-1800s. German descendants at one time comprised as much as one-third of the population of Columbus. Restoration began in 1959 and the Historic District was established in 1963. German Village was the FIRST historic district in the U.S. and it remains a model for all that came after. In the year 1974, German Village joined the Historic Register. Today, more than 1,600 preservations have been completed.

Purdy Haus dates to at least the year 1910 when it was occupied by a woodworker/barber George C. McMillin. Nearby homes date between years 1884 and 1888, so it may be older.

Walk everywhere - sidewalks are wide - people are warm - parks and restaurants are plentiful! And German Village is central to everything

neighborhood_overview:
The Short North Arts District is one of the Midwest’s best kept secrets. There is a huge variety of unique shops, bars and restaurants, and art galleries along High Street and a number of annual events that take place year-round. We have a thorough list of recommendations in the house to local bakeries, cafes, and restaurants.
The Short North is made up of several historic neighborhoods; this home is located in Victorian Village Village.

IS THE NEIGHBORHOOD SAFE?
We live nearby and feel the neighborhood is relatively safe, but it can be a bit intimidating if you are not use to city living. Please note this is the city- we do have petty crime in the Short North and University area, and always advise to practice not leaving valuables in your car (we have not had any issues at our apartments, I state this because we are in the city) and walk with a buddy at night on well-lit, busy roads such as High Street, Summit, and 5th Ave.

We love being hosts- providing a comfortable home to travelers visiting our gem of a city- 'Cbus'! We know quite a lot about Short North entertainment & restaurants- there is so much to do here, feel free to ask!
- Ingrid, Mike, and Frances, Co-Host 

Our life motto- Live like someone left the gate open!

Located on a quiet tree-lined street, the apartment has plenty of free st
neighborhood_overview:
The Columbus version of New York’s Harlem, King-Lincoln Bronzeville, draws people whose appetite for poetry, music, and creativity abounds with enthusiasm for the diverse community. Whether referred to as King-Lincoln Bronzeville, North of Broad, KLD, or the ‘cool’ shorthand for North of Broad: NoBo, this neighborhood’s roots extend deep in African-American culture, heritage, jazz, and the civil rights movement. All of these are embraced by the community through landmarks, architecture, and the restoration of buildings. The Lincoln Theatre, for example, was recently restored to its original condition.

King-Lincoln Bronzeville also encourages the use of its parks, including Mayme Moore Park and Beatty Park. Other nearby parks include Saunders Park and Franklin Park Conservatory and Botanical Gardens located within the Near East Side's limits. The Near East Side is not separate from but rather encompasses the innovation of the district. Highways border this area on three sides

neighborhood_overview:
Olde Towne East is one of the oldest neighborhoods in Columbus and is currently undergoing rapid revitalization. The neighborhood has over 1,000 homes, some as old as the 1830s, and more than 50 architectural styles as a result of its history. Some homes have been restored and others remain untouched, as they are reminders of eras that have gone before. Our street and surrounding streets are some of the safest blocks in Columbus! For more information about the neighborhood, check out crime heat maps online, g@@gle map view or search, and learn a little bit more about the history of the community!

Olde Towne East is host to interesting clusters of dining and nightlife along Parsons Avenue and Oak Street. On Parsons, grab a coffee at Upper Cup, enjoy farm-fresh produce at Black Creek Bistro and music and drinks at local favorite Carabar. On Oak Street, try breakfast at vegan-friendly The Angry Baker, lunch at the Olde Towne Tavern and dinner and a huge beer list at Yellow Bric

description:
This is the best AirBnb in the best location! With upscale finishes and decorations, a free parking spot right off high street and great local recommendations, this home is your best bet for an amazing trip to Columbus, whether it be for work or play.

Local, Columbus residents with no prior reviews will be required to pay a security deposit before booking.

Permit # 20191370

The space
*** Displaced students - inquire about long term specials for remainder of school year***


The Short North Retreat has everything to make your stay comfortable and unique. Besides the basic amenities of a first class AirBnb, guests are treated to local art, a smart TV, & coffee.

This is a 1BD home with a queen bed as well as a queen pull out couch (very nice & comfortable).

There is only 1 private parkig space. Other vehicles can be accomodated 1 block away.

-PACK&PLAY AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST

Guest

name: The Clintonville Red House
description:
Cozy and clean Clintonville House in wonderful central location! Walking distance to High Street, shops, restaurants, and bus routes. Easy access to 71 and 315. A quick drive, uber or bus ride from campus, downtown and the airport. Are you a runner or biker? Hit the Olentangy River trail in under 10 minutes. Enjoy access to the entire house, which sleeps 6 adults comfortably + a sofa bed and a futon. We also have a pack and play available if needed.

The space
Traveling for work or with family can be tough. This house is fully equipped for comfort and functionality with a work space, and high speed internet, dining table that seats 6-7, large screen TV, and everything you need to travel for work, pleasure and with family including a fully stocked kitchen as well as toys, pack and play, infant swing, high chair, toys and a stroller available on request.

Guest access
You have access to the entire house, front porch and yard, includi
neighborhood_overview:
location- location- location!

This is a lovely, walkable neighborhood with sidewalks. There are several schools with playgrounds that are open to the public on weekends and after hours within .25 miles.

A non exhaustive list of walkable restaurants includes:
Panera, Chipotle, & Juice Co, 61-Pho, Juice & Co and Crimson Cup Coffee are literally 300 yards away. If you are willing to walk up to half a mile you can reach Fusian Asian Cuisine, Jeni's Ice cream, Jersey Mike's Subs, North Star, Little Eater and Hot Chicken Takeover.

Less than a mile North is Graceland Shopping Center with a Target, Krogers, Michael's Crafts, LA Fitness, and tons of restaurants.

There is an access point to the Olentangy River Trail .75 miles from your front door.
We are minutes from 71 and 315.

Additionally we are:
- 10 minutes from OSU and Riverside Hospitals
- 15 minutes from the airport
- 10 minutes from OSU
- 18
host_about: I'm a working mother, and an avid traveler.   I've been around the world alone and with my family and try and channel those experiences into making The Red House into the best possible air bnb for groups and families that are traveling for any reason!

name: Gray Room - Olde Towne/Franklin Park-Historic Home
description:
Enjoy a beautiful private room in this large house on historic Bryden Road. The Gray Room has a comfortable queen bed, corner desk, tv with Netflix, Amazon Prime, Disney+. There’s also a door leading out onto the balcony overlooking the back yard.

I live in the house along with my dog Juneau. She’s a young husky mix pup that loves everyone!

The space
Nicely updated home in a quiet location close to downtown Columbus.

The bedroom: Large private room with a comfortable queen bed with luxurious bedding, plenty of storage, TV with Netflix, Amazon Prime, Disney+. This bedroom has a corner desk allowing plenty of work space. Also enjoy your own private, 2nd floor balcony overlooking the back yard. Shared bathroom. I have another room available to book if you have a group or should this room be unavailable for your dates - check out the Map Room!

The house: All brick 2500 sq ft craftsman built in 1914 and had a major face-lift o
neighborhood_overview: Olde Towne East, is a charming residential neighborhood with history around every corner.  In the late 1800's and early 1900's some of Columbus' wealthiest and most influential citizens built beautiful homes on Bryden Road.  Technically we are located in the Franklin Park Neighborhood but everyone around Columbus usually refers to the entire area as Olde Towne.
host_about:
I’ve been an Airbnb host since 2014 and since I love to travel I have also been a guest with other hosts in the US and internationally. People always ask if it’s weird to have strangers come and stay in my home with me and the answer has always been “not once!” I really love having the opportunity to share my home and city of Columbus Ohio with travelers from all over the world. So far I have welcomed people from 6 out of 7 continents coming from more than 75 different countries.

When I bought my home in 2008 it had broken plumbing, boarded up windows, and had been the ugly house on the block for a long time. It’s taken a lot of time and patience but a house that was forgotten and uninhabitable became a warm and charming place I like to call home. 

I’m proud of the work I’ve done to bring a historic building back to life and update it in a way that kept much of the original character. Be careful asking questions about the process because I may not stop telling stories for a while.

In the fall of 2019 I adopted a husky/boxer puppy.  Her name is Juneau and she is super friendly and loves welcoming guests to our home.

Vaccinated for COVID - May 2021.

name: Updated suite in safe and quiet neighborhood
description:
Private suite with your own separate entrance! There is one bedroom, living room, bathroom, and eating/kitchen area. You have complete privacy, there is no shared area and your space is closed off with a door. There use to be an open set of steps connecting your space with the rest of the house but I have added a door and made it totally private. You will not see or hear from me unless you want to. The space is completely renovated and clean and modern throughout including wifi and basic TV

The space
This space is very modern, simple, and clean. There is plenty of room and has everything you should need for a short stay.

Other things to note
You are about 10 minutes away from OSU campus and the football stadium and 15 minutes away from downtown. There are plenty of restaurants close by and freeway access is only a few minutes away

License number
2019-1151
neighborhood_overview: Very safe, nice neighborhood in the north end of Columbus
host_about: I have a passion for traveling and meeting new people and hearing their stories. I did a study abroad program in college called Semester at Sea, and it completely changed me.  Ever since then I prefer to stay in peoples homes when I travel, as opposed to a hotel.  The more experiences and stories you have in life, the better!  5 things I couldn't live without?  The Bible, my family, pizza, The Office, and the gym I belong to.

name: Comfy place near downtown.
description:
I'm honored you chose my property. During your stay, you'll enjoy a spacious 1,100 square feet apartment, close to restaurants, family-friendly activities, and a 5 minute drive downtown. You’ll love the proximity to downtown, comfy living, in an up and coming neighborhood that is being gentrified. As last minute cancellations are costly - My place is perfect for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers who are committed to their booking dates.

The space
I require a profile contain a face picture, a current government issued photo ID , a current phone number and email address. Before sending inquiries, make sure your profile is updated, otherwise, I will decline your inquiry.

The property is ideally located 5 minutes from COSI and Downtown Columbus - only a 8 minute drive to the Convention Center. Minutes from restaurants, entertainment and the business sectors. Simply take either Town or Broad Street East for a quick 5 minute ride to downtown
neighborhood_overview:
What I love about the neighborhood is that it has quiet mature neighbors and it's proximity to the downtown area. Franklinton is an old community. The local city and state government are spending millions gentrifying this neighborhood.
It is 5 minutes from Downtown/Arena District. (Nationwide Arena, Express Live, North Market), 9 minutes from the infamous Short North. The "art & soul" of Columbus, the Short North is a vibrant cultural and small business community. Park your car along Goodale Park on Buttles Ave for free and gallery hop, thrift or have dinner/drinks at just about any type of bar. 8 minutes away from the Greater Convention Center.

Make sure to check out my Guidebook for activities, entertainment and restaurants - it's a reference of all my favorite places in Columbus. I'm a member of a Pizzeria meetup - My favorite mom & pop pizzerias are listed.
host_about:
Howdy! I’m Jake. I’m originally from New York, and while I miss my friends and family back home (not to mention the beach!), I absolutely love my mid-west home here in Columbus, Ohio!
By day I’m a real estate investor and by night I’m a social butterfly with my friends. I'm also an Airbnb cohost where I mentor aspiring local hosts. I earned my Superhost status because I have high standards for value, cleanliness, and communication.
I enjoy travelling and creating new experiences. My favorite country is Guatemala. The people, the food and the historical sites are breathtaking. My favorite city is Chicago. Through these travels and coupled with my 14 years landlording, I’ve been fortunate to learn what makes a great host: a great home, with a friendly host, in an awesome neighborhood, and the ability to do the things you love! I try to ensure that each and every guest I host walks away with all of that and hopefully more.
My life motto is, well, really my grandmother’s advice, “Jakey, live with NO REGRETS” (I can hear her thick NYer accent now). Sometimes I guess we just need a little reminder of that… And so, I invite you to travel more and see the big, beautiful world we live in.

name: Wincott Place - A Clintonville Gem
description:
Wincott Place is a single family home, in the heart of Clintonville with easy access to 315 and 71. On-street parking outside the front door.

Perfect for a fun weekend getaway, weekday business trip, or longer stay. One night stays available. A close drive to the Short North, Grandview, Ohio State University, Downtown, Easton (in and outdoor mall) and Polaris (IKEA and indoor mall) for shopping trips.

No pets allowed due to family allergies.

Entire house and contents are pet/smoke free.

The space
The kitchen is fully stocked and available to you for cooking, baking, or heating up leftovers. The table seats 2-4 people, with a larger table outside in the screened-in porch. We also have children's dishes, cups, and utensils for the younger crowd staying at the house.

We try to be mindful of the earth and conservation. Wincott Place has general recycling available for our guests. If you are not sure if something can be
neighborhood_overview:
This is a quiet single family home neighborhood. Several restaurants nearby along High Street, North and South.

Clintonville is a great place to live and is in the perfect location. Close enough to downtown Columbus to go whenever you want, yet you still feel like you are in your own neighborhood apart from the rest. There are many things to do and see. High street has many cool, quirky, unique shops and restaurants. The people are open-minded, welcoming, and kind; which gives Clintonville that community feeling. When the tight knit community becomes too much, you can take a quick trip into downtown Columbus, the Short North, or pretty much any other part of Columbus, because Clintonville is right in the center of it.
host_about:
We live in Clintonville and have four cats and a dog.  We live and work in the community. As the hosts of Wincott Place we want our guests to feel comfortable and at home when they stay with us.  

Having stayed on friend's couches, in numerous hotel rooms, BNB's, and Airbnb the conversation has always centered on what would we do differently as a host.  From having a throw blanket for lounging on the couch, that certain kitchen tool, green space outside,  to having games available to play as a group or family. 

We try to be mindful of the earth and conservation. Our rental has general recycling available for our guests. If you are not sure if something can be recycled, leave it for us and we will make the decision for you. We also compost food. Leave us your leftovers (and scrap remnants if you like) in the refrigerator. The local composting company we work with that will even take meat and bones. 

Each of our animals has their own distinct personalities that make us smile and want to give them a hug.  This does not mean that everyone else does though. We each have several family members with pet allergies so we want there to be somewhere that is pet free, has items in it that have not been in contact with animals, like Wincott Place, to keep allergies at bay.

neighborhood_overview: Located in historic Italian Village and part of the vibrant Short North Arts District, the neighborhood is rich with activity. Worth checking out are the new gym, brewery, and pool. The area is filled with galleries and dining destinations.
host_about:
We are Zach and Cathleen. We’ve grown up together, here in town. We’ve been married the better half of ten years and for most of them, we’ve owned this property here in Italian Village Eventually, we hope to end up out west but until then, Columbus is home!

We lived next door in this duplex property until only recently. We now have family friends renting in our place. We absolutely loved this neighborhood and together, our family loves to go for a walk on the weekends...  either to grab a coffee and enjoy the park nearby or catch up with friends and family over breakfast on the weekends. Tasi Cafe and The Market are our faves!

If you stay at our property, we want you to feel welcome! We are casual people but want to provide you with an excellent experience. If there is anything you need, don’t hesitate to ask.

name: Dempsey’s Jury Room Guest Suite  Downtown Columbus
description:
Located in the River South area in Downtown Columbus, we are within walking distance to German Village, Downtown theaters, restaurants and the Columbus Commons. The Arena District and the Short North is a quick Cbus ride away. Built in two phases, 1831 and 1885, our home has been everything from a stagecoach stop to a bordello in the 1850's. We are offering second floor private space with 2 bedrooms and a sitting room with a sofa sleeper.

The space
Private and secure, this suite once served as sleeping quarters for visiting judges in the late 1800's. In recent years it's been used as office space but we've lovingly restored it into a cozy and clean retreat. Interesting note: because the building is one of the oldest buildings in Columbus (the old gal has quite a past) it is said to be haunted. I've lived here for almost 3 years and haven't seen a thing but a quick search of The Jury Room Columbus may provide some interesting history.

Guest access
neighborhood_overview: Located in the River South area of Downtown, we are close to everything but enjoy the relative quiet from not being in the center of the city. There are several restaurant options within walking distance. Notably, Dempsey's Food & Spirits (shameless plug for our restaurant) at the corner of Mound & High that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner & days a week. :)
host_about: My husband Mark and I are small business owners in Columbus, Ohio. We have 5 children and 6 grandchildren.

name: Judge’s Mansion Entire Home: @judgesmansion
description:
Judge’s Mansion is located in Olde Towne East, one of the best and oldest neighborhoods in Columbus. Rent the entire Mansion for a getaway, a family reunion, or for your wedding party. We are located close to Franklin Park and Downtown. Tastefully designed and thoughtfully laid out to create a balance of comfort and thought provoking, Instagram-able, photo ready space for you to enjoy during your stay in Columbus. IG: @judgesmansion

The space
Judge’s Mansion was built for Judge Edmond Bothwell Dillon in the late 1800s in historic Olde Towne East. The building has since been converted into several private apartments. We welcome you into our home and hope you love the large windows, tall ceilings, grand staircase, and Victorian character as much as we do. Our home features several apartments of varying sizes and decor, and also includes a front porch and large yard.

Guest access
You have access to the entire Mansion, all 8 apartment units.

Connect with us @judgesmansion @thejudgesmansion

Stay for a night or three, shoot on location here, or meet up with friends. #belonghere #judgesmansion

name: Vintage Townhome w/Cozy Loft & Two Private Suites
description:
Vintage townhome (1/2 of a duplex) with two private suites, each with their own bathroom. Lots of charm, perfect for couples! Located right off High St in German Village, just a few minutes' walk to coffee shops, breweries, restaurants, cafes, parks, yoga & public transportation. Fast wi-fi!

The space
This listing is for one half of a two-unit duplex built over 100 years ago. The unit is about 1300 square feet across 3 floors. The first floor has a living room, dining room, kitchen and small powder room. A unique Y staircase leads up to the two newly remodeled private suites on the second floor.

The King suite features a memory foam King bed, both down & down alternative pillows, a reading nook, and a large bathroom with an oversized walk-in shower, 100+ year old clawfoot tub, and double vanity. *Please note that there is a curtain dividing the master bedroom from master bathroom. There is no door.*

The King bedroom has stair access t
neighborhood_overview:
German Village is a vibrant place to stay, shop, and play. Walking the brick sidewalks, you'll discover a neighborhood full of urban gardens, beautiful historic homes built over 100 years ago, and carefully dispersed small businesses. As said on the German Village visitor's website, “What we have can't be replicated. We live this way — and protect it with great passion — because we understand that what we have is a neighborhood like no other." We couldn't agree more.

Schiller Park is a pleasant 8 minute walk from the property through some of the most charming streets in German Village, making it easy to go for a walk/run, have a picnic, bring the kids to the playground, and enjoy free performances of Shakespeare in the Park in the summertime. The park also has basketball courts and tennis courts.

Another one of our favorite parks is Scioto Audubon Metro Park, which is located .8 miles from the house. The park has a large rock climbing wall, walking paths (both
host_about: We’re husband & wife hosts, parents to 2 little girls, and small business owners in Columbus, OH. After living in NYC for several years, we decided to move to Columbus in search of a better quality of life — and we found it! We have been hosting since 2014 and have enjoyed sharing our homes with thousands of travelers from near & far. We find it incredibly rewarding to be a small part of our guests’ experience when they’re visiting our city.

name: Short North Condo - Located on High St & PARKING!
description:
1 bedroom/bathroom studio, kitchen, washer/dryer, located in the heart of Columbus's Short North Arts District. Located directly on High Street (directly across the street from Union Cafe and TownHall) you will be within walking distance to the Greater Columbus Convention Center, Goodale Park, a variety of great restaurants, bars, and shops. Short drive to OSU's campus, Nationwide Arena, Otherworld, and downtown area.

Free, off-street parking space available for guests. (1 parking space).

The space
Located on the the 3rd floor, the space has an open and industrial design with high ceilings and polished cement floors. What makes the space great is its centralized location in Columbus with a variety of breweries, restaurants, art galleries, and shops within walking distance from the front entrance of the condominium complex.

Within a short walking distance you'll be minutes away from some of Columbus's most popular bars and restaurants such
neighborhood_overview: The Short North has been described as "colorful", "offbeat", and "trendy". The district is heavily populated with art galleries, specialty shops, pubs, nightclubs, and coffee houses. Most of its tightly packed brick buildings date from at least the early 20th century, with traditional storefronts along High Street (often with brightly painted murals on their side walls), and old apartment buildings and rowhouses and newer condominium developments in the surrounding blocks. The city installed 17 lighted metal archways extending across High Street throughout the Short North, reminiscent of such arches present in the area in the early 1900s.
host_about: Born and raised in Columbus, OH, USA, I truly am a central Ohio native. Graduate of The Ohio State University and pursuing my passion of worldly travels!
