This house is in the "Old North Columbus" neighborhood just north of Ohio State Campus. Conveniently located (10min walk) to High Street bustling with students, bars, restaurants etc. Located on a main street primarily surrounded by a mix of student rentals & single family homes, this home is a perfect location for an Ohio State game day with campus buzz at your fingertips while still being a comfy retreat after a long day of exploring Columbus. Please note, because we are very close to campus there is the potential for surrounding noise particularly on the weekends during the OSU school year.

- 1/2 mile (10min walk) to the iconic High/Lane intersection in the heart of Ohio State Campus ( and TAILGATE CENTRAL for Ohio Stadium).

host_about:

.

name: Judge’s Mansion: The Judge’s Study
description:
Located in the historic Judge’s Mansion in Olde Towne East, this spacious guest suite served as the original owner's study in 1890. The private apartment includes a bedroom (queen bed), living room (queen sofa bed), bath and small kitchen. There’s plenty of open space to spread out or share with a travel companion. Tastefully designed and thoughtfully laid out to create a balance of comfort and thought provoking, Instagram-able, photo ready space for you to enjoy. IG @judgesmansion

The space
Judge’s Mansion was built for Judge Edmond Bothwell Dillon in the late 1800s in historic Olde Towne East. The building has since been converted into several private apartments but still remains home to us. We welcome you into our home and hope you love the large windows, tall ceilings, sliding pocket door, and Victorian character as much as we do. Our home features several apartments of varying sizes and decor. The Judge’s Study featured in this listing is a 1-bedroom apartm
neighborhood_overview: Olde Towne East is host to interesting clusters of dining and nightlife along Parsons Avenue and Oak Street. On Parsons, grab a coffee at Upper Cup, enjoy farm-fresh produce at Black Creek Bistro and music and drinks at local favorite Carabar. On Oak Street, try breakfast at vegan-friendly The Angry Baker, lunch at the Olde Towne Tavern and dinner and a huge beer list at Yellow Brick Pizza. Franklin Park Conservatory and Botanical Gardens lies just east, with an awe-inspiring glass house, lit by night with colorful installation by James Turrell, inside gardens representing many of the world’s biomes, and an outstanding community garden campus that also hosts cooking and horticulture classes throughout the year. The brand new Scotts Miracle-Gro Foundation's Children's Garden focuses on introducing and connecting children to the natural world.
host_about:
Located in Olde Towne East, Columbus, Ohio, we are the premier Guest House of the Near East Side (Olde Towne East, Franklin Park, King Lincoln, Woodland Park) offering six apartments and two queen en suites.  In operation since 2015, we host over 100 guests per year. Will you consider being one?  

Connect with us @judgesmansion on IG 

Stay for a night or three, shoot on location here, or meet up with friends.  #judgesmansion #judgesmansiondreams

Olde Towne East is one of the best neighborhoods in Columbus, and is the oldest area in Columbus, currently undergoing rapid revitalization. The neighborhood has over 1,000 homes, some as old as the (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) s, and more than 50 architectural styles as a result of its history. Some homes have been restored and others remain untouched as reminders of eras that have gone before. Our street and surrounding streets are some of the safest blocks in Columbus! Just check out crime heat maps online, g@@gle map view or search, and learn a little bit more about the history of the community!

name: 1BR Condo w/ Best Location in City~Short North
description:
There is not a better location in all of Columbus...This 1 Bedroom, 1 Bath condo is located on High Street in the Short North. It has private parking options in the back on Pearl and is walking distance to all the best restaurants and bars the Short North has to offer. It is a 4 minute walk to the Convention Center, across the street from Goodale Park, and a 5 minute uber from OSU campus, German Village, and Nationwide Children's Hospital. Come live in the middle of it all!

The space
This apartment is perfect for business, families, and anyone looking to enjoy the city of Columbus in absolute style. It has private off street parking options in the back that are first come first serve. The unit is fully equipped with a washer/dryer, fridge, microwave, oven, and coffee brewer. The bedroom is very large and contains one Queen memory foam bed with a large closet with shelving for all your clothing needs. I live right next door and will be available right away if nee
neighborhood_overview: The Short North is where all the action is. It is the most centralized location in Columbus and sets the bar for all other neighborhoods. You are literally right above some of the best coffee shops, restaurants, and bars the city has to offer. It is a short walk from the Columbus Convention Center, Nationwide Arena, and Goodale Park. Less than 15 minutes from the airport and a 5 minute uber from Nationwide Children's, OSU campus, and German Village.
host_about: I am from Springfield, OH and went to college at OSU where I traveled abroad in Barcelona. I moved to Chicago for a couple years and got some corporate experience in a fun city. I then moved back to Columbus where I live currently in the Short North with my beautiful fiancée. I help run my family's coffee and vending business, called Sheehan Brothers. I love traveling, golfing, eating and most importantly The Buckeyes!!

name: Standard Room - Full Service B&B
description:
Located on the edge of downtown in the Short North Arts District, 50 Lincoln Short North Bed and Breakfast is nestled in a quiet residential neighborhood setting.
Each of our seven rooms feature in-room private full bath, free Wi-Fi, and cable TV. We also include free off-street parking and a delicious homemade breakfast every morning. Breakfast includes juice, hot coffee or tea, fresh fruit, yogurt, granola, and a specially prepared entrée each day (all food allergies can be accommodated).

The space
Room 6 is located on the third floor and is a mirror image of Room 5. It has a queen size bed, comfortable sitting chair, and small secretary desk. The west facing skylight fills the room with warm afternoon light. This room also features a full in-room bathroom complete with tub/shower combo and hairdryer.

Guest access
Guests are welcome to make themselves at home in any of the public areas including the main parlor and the back porch. W
neighborhood_overview: 50 Lincoln is a one minute walk from blocks of trendy shops, fabulous restaurants, unique art galleries, and exciting night life. We are just a half mile from the Greater Columbus Convention Center, a mile from Nationwide Arena, and less than two miles to The Ohio State University campus. Enjoy a quick walk through the neighborhood, grab a COGO Bike Share a block from our front door, or jump on the free CBUS on High Street to get around.

name: Charming Clintonville Cottage
description:
This cosy, ivy-covered, one bedroom carriage house is charming and welcoming, filled with original art and furnished with a sophisticated blend of modern, mid-Century and antique pieces. It's located in the heart of friendly, convenient South Clintonville, near great restaurants and all the amenities, and a mile and a half from OSU Campus.

The space
Curl up and read or watch TV in the comfy queen-sized four-poster bed. If you'd prefer to cook at home during your stay, you'll find a fully stocked kitchen with 5-burner gas stove and dining area. In nice weather, there's a lovely outdoor sitting area under a crabapple tree, just outside the front door, set far back from the street for privacy.

License number
2019-1924
neighborhood_overview: One of the oldest and most desirable neighborhoods in Columbus, Clintonville is perfectly situated no matter what your destination is, not more than a fifteen minute drive to the Short North, German Village, Downtown, Olde Towne East or OSU Stadium. Walk a block and a half down our tree-lined street of lovely Craftsman-style homes, and you're on N High St, the city's main artery, with convenient bus stops if you'll be seeking public transportation. There you'll find tons of popular eateries, craft breweries, boutiques, antique stores, and night spots. One of our local favorites for dinner is Harvest Bar & Kitchen and you won't find a better brunch or piece of pie than Dough Mama's Cafe & Bakery - don't miss out on their ham or avocado biscuit!  Lucky's Market is just a few minutes away, like a smaller, cooler Whole Foods, and Ace of Cups is a  bar to catch some Columbus's great local bands. On a nice day, ride your bike all along the Olentangy River on the nearby bike path or take a wa
host_about: I'm a painter based in Brooklyn, NY and worked in the theatre for thirty years as a director and teacher.  My husband, Lee, is an actor and we have one daughter who's a chef and baker in Columbus, Ohio. We purchased our guest house to have a home to stay in when we visit her, and host travelers when we aren’t in town. We travel as often as we can and have been to every continent except Antarctica. Our most recent big trip was India last fall. We love to eat and go to museums and just wander through new places, absorb the culture and discover things that surprise us. Our goal is always to experience a place from a local's POV, so we try to stay in real neighborhoods instead of tourist zones.

Experience a one-of-a-kind stay in this custom Short North home! Located on Summit St between High & N. 4th St, this 5 bedroom, 4.5 bath home with *basement that has 3 queen beds + 1 bathroom* is the perfect private setting for your group's stay in Columbus. ***Please note the rear carriage house apartment is a separate rental unit. Carriage house guests have access to shared back patio area. You may see them accessing their unit in the back area. The laundry closet for the carriage house guests is in the lower level of the garage as well so if you are parking in the garage you may see guests in passing.***

Additional
neighborhood_overview:
The Short North Arts District is one of the Midwest’s best kept secrets. There is a huge variety of unique shops, bars and restaurants, and art galleries along High Street and a number of annual events that take place year-round. We have a thorough list of recommendations in the house to local bakeries, cafes, and restaurants.

The Short North is made up of several historic neighborhoods; this home is located in Italian Village on Summit St., between First Ave and Warren St. Just two blocks away from High Street!

IS THE NEIGHBORHOOD SAFE?
We live nearby and feel the neighborhood is relatively safe, but it can be a bit intimidating if you are not use to city living. Please note this is the city- we do have petty crime in the Short North and University area, and always advise to practice not leaving valuables in your car (we have not had any issues at our apartments, I state this because we are in the city) and walk with a buddy at night on well-lit, busy roads
host_about:
A few years after meeting in Japan, we moved to Columbus in 2OO9 and have been loving it ever since! We love traveling (25+ countries between us) and are passionate about renovating historic homes and building new homes. Please check out our IGs at @RoweRentals and @RoweHouseCbus to see our house journey.

We love being hosts- providing a comfortable home to travelers visiting our gem of a city- 'Cbus'! We know quite a lot about Short North entertainment & restaurants- there is so much to do here, feel free to ask!
- Ingrid, Mike, and Frances, Co-Host 

Our life motto- Live like someone left the gate open!

The Short North Arts District is one of the Midwest’s best kept secrets. There is a huge variety of unique shops, bars and restaurants, and art galleries along High Street and a number of annual events that take place year-round. We have a thorough list of recommendations in the house to local bakeries, cafes, and restaurants.
The Short North is made up of several historic neighborhoods; this home is located in Victorian Village Village.

IS THE NEIGHBORHOOD SAFE?
We live nearby and feel the neighborhood is relatively safe, but it can be a bit intimidating if you are not use to city living. Please note this is the city- we do have petty crime in the Short North and University area, and always advise to practice not leaving valuables in your car (we have not had any issues at our apartments, I state this because we are in the city) and walk with a buddy at night on well-lit, busy roads such as High Street, Summit, and 5th Ave.

We love being hosts- providing a comfortable home to travelers visiting our gem of a city- 'Cbus'! We know quite a lot about Short North entertainment & restaurants- there is so much to do here, feel free to ask!
- Ingrid, Mike, and Frances, Co-Host 

Our life motto- Live like someone left the gate open!

name: Livingston Hideaway
description:
Welcome to our home! Our Airbnb is a 2 bedroom condo that is less than 1/2 mile or 2.5 blocks from Nationwide Children's hospital in Downtown Columbus. We hope to provide a comfortable home away from home for families who may be in the area for care at Nationwide Children's Hospital, attending one of Columbus's many large conventions or events, or visiting family or friends in the Columbus area!

The space
The home is a duplex, and we (the owners) live in the 2nd floor unit. The 1st floor Airbnb unit has private front and back entrances, and fully furnished bedrooms, bathroom, kitchen, and living spaces. Private off street parking is available behind the house, along with street parking in front of the house on Livingston Ave. The kitchen is stocked with all dishes, pots, pans, and utensils you may need. For convenience and security there is a smart keypad lock on the exterior door that guests can use to enter the home at any time. A personalized code will be prov
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood surrounding the hospital and our home is currently transitioning, with many of the homes in the area being renovated and restored. Our home is one of these homes that has recently been completely renovated. Nationwide Children's Hospital is investing heavily into the surrounding area, helping to make it one of Columbus's many "up and coming" neighborhoods. As a result you will see many beautifully renovated homes right next door to homes that are still boarded up. We ask that you please acknowledge that you understand and are comfortable with the neighborhood prior to booking your stay. We recommend utilizing an online map service to understand where exactly the home is, and to browse around the neighborhood.  We are more than happy to answer any and all questions you may have!
host_about:
Hello! My partner Kevin and I are experienced Airbnb hosts in Columbus, OH. I'm an Ohio native, born and raised in Northwest Ohio. I graduated undergrad from The Ohio State University, moved to Chicago where I lived and worked for a few years, and have now happily settled back down in Columbus for the past 6+ years. I work for L Brands, the parent company of Victoria's Secret and Bath & Body Works, one of the many retail companies headquartered here in Columbus. I'm a Supply Chain and Logistics professional, and recently completed my Masters of Business Administration at Purdue University.
I enjoy traveling whenever and wherever I can, though I definitely prefer someplace warmer when given the option :) Though I love traveling, I am a Columbus fanboy at heart and am always happy to talk about all of the great things to experience here. I'm a very easy going guy, so feel free to ask me any questions that may be on your mind! Happy traveling!

name: Steps from High St. WALK to everything —Clean&Cozy
description:
Stay in the heart of Short North. A beautiful Short North town home one block from high street and Goodale Park. You will be in the heart of bars, amazing restaurants, cafes, shops and tons of night life. Walking distance to all that Short North Arts District has to offer. A 5 min. walk to Goodale Park. A 10 min. walk to Nationwide area (Home of the Columbus Blue Jackets), and Greater Columbus Convention Center (.9mi). A 15 min walk to the OSU campus (1.4 mi) or a short lyft ride.

The space
The Short North town home is a two story home with 1224 sq ft of space for you to use. Large living, Dining Room, Kitchen, 2 bedrooms upstairs, 1.5 bathrooms. The fully-equipped kitchen has pots/pans, dishes, and utensils as well as a Keurig coffee machine. Washer/dryer. There is a 48" smart television with complimentary Netflix. Bottled water and free K-cup pod. Smart TVs and Wifi.

Guest access
You are able to access the entire place.
neighborhood_overview: Short North Arts District is a hip, culture-rich area centered on N. High Street. Contemporary galleries fill converted warehouses, and the Wexner Center for the Arts hosts boundary-pushing exhibitions. Shops selling records, streetwear, and vintage clothes are interspersed with student-packed coffeehouses, craft-beer bars, and casual eateries. Programming at Short North Stage spans musicals and cutting-edge drama.
host_about: I am crazy about real estate.  I love renovating broken down houses to make them look beautiful again.  I love helping people find a solution to their home headaches.  I have lots of long term rentals as well. I'm a people person so I really enjoy hosting because I get to meet so many wonderful people.   In addition to my passion for real estate, I love to be at the beach.  Sunshine, sand and a view of the ocean is my favorite place to be.  I am married to a wonderful man that puts up with all of my crazy adventures.  I also have two very active  kiddos that keep me on my toes.

description:

host_about:
We are childhood friends and business partners.
We are originally from Canton, Ohio and now reside in the Cleveland area. We both graduated from The Ohio State University and started hosting on Airbnb in 2013. We started Cleveland House Hotels, which is a short term vacation property company in 2015.  We have a full time cleaning staff and maintenance person on hand to take care of any issues.  We also have our reservations specialist, Deanna who will be the one responding to your requests.

Niko (Nick) has been in the hospitality business for many years, having worked in hotels and restaurants.  He owns a small diner in Old Brooklyn called Gus's Family Restaurant.  He is married and has two children.  In addition to cooking and owning a restaurant, Niko is the co-founder and COO of Cleveland House Hotels.  

Billy is a co-founder and CEO of Cleveland House Hotels.  Billy is a successful real estate investor and has been in the sales business for over 15 years.  He loves traveling and spending time with his son, William.

neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood Franklinton is situated just west of Downtown Columbus, and is full of historic homes. This neighborhood has experienced many phases through out it's existence, and is currently in a revitalization phase. There are lots of properties being renovated, and some that still remain boarded and empty. This area has experienced some crime in the past, but has improved in recent years.

Franklinton has experienced several great floods in the past, and has been somewhat neglected throughout the middle to late part of the 1900's. The Franklinton Floodwall, completed in 2004, is 7 miles long, cost $134 million. The wall's completion has released the area from being considered a floodplain, as well as releasing the previous building restrictions that often prevented development in the past. As a result, commercial and industrial activities are starting to grow in the Franklinton Area.

The City of Columbus is focusing on creating a new Short North style neigh

The finely refinished basement level private apartment offers all the comforts of home.

neighborhood_overview: The Eastmoor/Bexley area provides easy access to the best of Columbus within a short distance. There are several city parks within a mile of our home and excellent restaurants to meet every price and taste bud! Bexley’s Drexel theater provides a throw-back movie experience with a selection of independent and unique films. There is the fantastic Cherbourg bakery, Brassica Eatery, coffee shops and gourmet foods, and several fantastic ice cream and pizza shops.
host_about: We love seeing new places, experiencing the culture and meeting new people. Ohio has always been home-base but we’ve also enjoyed living and working in the rural Southwest - on the Navajo reservation, and in the East African country of Tanzania for a number of years. Travel around Europe has been a favorite and we look forward to returning to Scotland for another Highland adventure someday soon.

name: Housepitality ~ The Maynard Manor
description:
The Maynard Manor is a bright, spacious, and exquisite home for your next visit to Columbus. Tucked in the historic Old North Columbus neighborhood, this 5 BR, 2.5 BA is just steps from High St., yet only 5 minutes from the Highway. The perfect spot for families, groups, and business travelers. Our kitchen/dinning room is perfect for a family meal, and our living room is perfect for catching up with old friends. There are 4 BR and 1BA on 2nd floor, with a spacious master suite on the 3rd floor.

The space
The Maynard Manor is fully stocked with lots of great amenities for your trip to Columbus. The kitchen comes equipped with everything needed to prepare and serve a group meal. Our living room has 2 sleeper sofas, and plenty of seating. The Manor has a large fenced in back yard, the garage is not available for guests. 2 bedrooms have a desk and chair available for use.

2019-1409
neighborhood_overview: Old North Columbus is a neighborhood located just north of the Ohio State University in Columbus, Ohio. It was founded in 1847 where, at the time, it was a stand-alone city out of the confines of Columbus until it was incorporated into the City of Columbus in 1871. In its early years the city was a popular stagecoach stop with people traveling from Worthington to Columbus. Today Old North Columbus is popular for its local music and its unique "untouched architecture" which is reminiscent of its old roots.
host_about: I continue to be excited about Airbnb and home-sharing every day! I enjoy hosting guests, I LOVE to travel, and I really love meeting new people. A trendy neighborhood, Short North draws visitors from all over the world with its endless local food and entertainment. You'll find young travelers and locals alike while exploring one of the most celebrated spots to eat and drink in Columbus.

The kitchen is complete with pots, pans, di
neighborhood_overview: Victorian Village, which runs along Neil Avenue south of The Ohio State University and northwest of downtown Columbus, is one of central Ohio’s cores of fine residential architecture. The area is known for its Victorian houses, which were built when a streetcar line first ran along Neil Avenue around 1900.  It is an amazing neighborhood close to Downtown Columbus attractions, restaurants and events.  The Village is also home to Goodale Park, Columbus’s most popular downtown park and the annual site of the Comfest music festival plus many other events.

Your private space starts in the 1st floor tiled foyer leading to a spiral staircase up to second floor office, living room with kitchenette and bedroom. Keyless entry allows for flexible check in and easy access with room to store bicycles. Kitchenette includes refrigerator, microwave, dishes & flatware, and coffee & tea. PLEASE NOTE: Please make sure you are physically able to navigate a spiral staircase to the main living area.

neighborhood_overview: Our home is located in a half acre urban oasis, on a main city street with easy access to Bexley, Downtown Columbus, OSU Campus, Ohio Dominican College and Capital University.

description:
Due to the Coronavirus virus and all guests safety I take this virus very seriously. There will be extra cleaning between every guest. All surfaces will be disinfected with bleach. Linens washed in hot water. I want your friends and family to feel safe while staying here. Don’t miss this opportunity to stay in this old Victorian only 5 mins to downtown Columbus. It is a 10 min Uber ride to the convention center and 15 Min Uber ride to OSU.

The space
This bnb has all the historic details of an old Victorian with exposed brick and ornate fireplace but also has all the modern amenities with smart TVs, stainless appliances, central air conditioning and washer/dryer. As you approach this massive house you will be greeted with a sweeping front porch where you can sit and enjoy everything urban living has to offer. As you enter the house the open concept will connect you with the whole family. Lastly there is a landscapes back yard patio space where you can sit
neighborhood_overview: This old house is located on a beautiful historic street with many other magnificent Victorian homes.  It is a mile away from downtown town Columbus and the streets are lined with sidewalks easy to take a stroller through this beautiful neighborhood.  There are many parks close by to explore and enjoy.

description:
Welcome to LuxBox Lofts! We’re consistently voted best airbnb in Columbus, and guests love us so much they usually book with us again. Newly renovated beautiful home, with property manager on-site to take care of all guests needs immediately, and friendly outdoor cats to hangout with. Arrive whenever you like, park for free on the street, and simply tap your code at the door. It's our goal to be your second home in the city.

The space
LuxBox is a modern smart loft. You get a private bedroom with keypad door lock. This room has 1 full size bed. Shared spaces include kitchen, living room, full bath and half bath. Clean and modern bedroom includes premium memory foam mattress and pillows, AC/heat, hanging clothing storage, extra towels and blankets, and smart TV with an assortment of Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Video, Disney+, and HBO.

name: ★King’s Landing Duplex close to OSU/Short North ★
description:
This Game of Thrones themed 1,000 square foot duplex boasts brand new furnishings and outstanding amenities. 15% off stays of seven nights or more.

Enjoy your fenced in backyard, complete with grill and patio seating. Inside the house, you’ll find a fully equipped kitchen, combined washer/dryer, and an adjustable bed and Smart TV in each bedroom.

Located within easy walking distance of OSU’s campus. 5 minutes to the Short North and downtown Columbus, and 10 minutes to the Airport.

The space
•Fenced in backyard, great for pets. Contains patio seating, a grill, and a court for playing bocce ball
•Fully equipped kitchen with granite counters and stainless steel appliances.
•Off-street parking behind house on gravel drive. Free on-street parking available at all hours
•Smart TVs with access to any of your streaming subscriptions and complementary Sling TV service.
•Combined washer/dryer

Guest access
Gue
neighborhood_overview: Living in Weinland Park offers residents an urban feel and convenience with the benefit of private fenced yards and a small community vibe.  Residents tend to be young professionals.  There are ample bars, restaurants, coffee shops, and parks, as well as sidewalks with quick access to running trails.  Weinland Park is a development success story.  The area is designated as an opportunity zone, helping to spur the revitalization of the historic neighborhood.
host_about:
I’m a moderately geeky real estate investor who prefers to be outdoors and is an avid hiker, fisher, runner and explorer. 

I live in one of my favorite places, Columbus, Ohio.  I provide fun, affordable, high end, safe and memorable vacation homes and event venues in and around the city.  I take pride in my properties and always respond to guests' needs.

I love great food and cocktails and am full of suggestions for fulfilling local experiences.  

I love to travel.  A few of my favorite destinations include Barcelona, Jaipur, Paris, Santorini, Athens, London, and Manhattan Montana.

I love animals.  I own cats and grew up with dogs.   I design my homes to be pet friendly.  I would love to meet your pets.

name: Housepitality ~ The Traveler's Townhouse
description:
This urban townhome is clean, basic, and affordable! Less than 10 minutes from downtown, this townhome is in the South of Main neighborhood. Our neighborhood is one in transition, but still has many boarded houses and a bit rough around the edges (so it may not be for everyone). Our space has a brand new kitchen and bathroom. This small space is great for 1 - 4 people (though up to 6 can fit with the air mattress). We welcome all travelers to your home away from home, the Travelers Townhouse.

The space
Our space is just one block off of Main Street, and is a somewhat quiet street. There are neighbors in close proximity, and can sometimes be heard from inside our apartment. The space has a large living room, with TV. Dinning room, and kitchen. The kitchen is stocked with dishes and cooking basics. Upstairs are 2 bedrooms, and bathroom. One large bedroom has a queen bed, memory foam mattress, and desk. The smaller bedroom has a queen bed and memory foam mattress. O
neighborhood_overview: The South Of Main area is near Downtown, Children's Hospital, Olde Towne East, and German Village. We are a short drive to many great locations around the city, but there are not many within close walking distance. There is a Family Dollar store about a block from our house, and a great daytime sandwich shop, but our immediate area is one some people may not feel safe walking in at night. However you could get to most top destinations in Columbus with less than $10 in an Uber.
host_about: I continue to be excited about Airbnb and home-sharing every day! I enjoy hosting guests, I LOVE to travel, and I really love meeting new people. I am a real estate broker that owns my own business, and I feel that my calling in life is to making spaces for people to enjoy. 5 things I can't live without are live music, friends, exploring new places, bacon, my drum set!

This cozy apartment is the perfect location in the historic neighborhood, The Short North with a vintage vibe and loads of character. 3-minutes walking distance to many restaurants, cafe's, & shops -many of which are doing take out! Dogs permitted on case by case basis. Notify us before booking.

Dogs permitted on case by case basis. $35+/dog/night w/$200/month cap

**There construction throughout building through end of 2021**

Nationwide Arena & Express Live: 1.4mi

The space
We are doing everything we can to make sure your stay is as clean and safe as possible. If you have any questions about our cleaning methods or request anything special, do not hesitate to reach out!

Our 1-bedroom apartment is in one of the best locations Columbus has to offer, but please note, the bedroom is small and the ceilings ar
neighborhood_overview:
Art, food, drinks, shopping, spas, salons, live music, and festivals - the Short North has it all. The Short North Arts District is a vibrant, exciting urban neighborhood with plenty of local flavor and culture!

You’ll be staying in an amazing location. Bars, dance clubs, and restaurants are just down the street. You will hear noise outside during the day at at night.
host_about: I. Love. Houses and Hosting! I’ve been an Airbnb host since 2013 when I used to live in New York City. I moved to Columbus, Ohio to restore homes and Host travelers full time in 2018. Rest assured our listings are put together with thought and care. Cleanliness and your comfort are our top priority. You'll love our spaces!

name: Quaint gem in the heart of a vibrant hip community
description:
Decor is a warm toned shabby chic/--but leaning away from overtly 'pretty'. Leather chaise-longe couch, laminate/hardwood flooring. Round dining table in muted distressed brown/grey, with mismatched suede dining seats. Kitchen is brand new, in brown with reddish tones. Full size bed, in private room with locks.. New Bathroom. Lots of people walk to parks, restaurants, and community events in this charming village vibe, that supports local retailers.

Guest access
Living, dining, kitchen, bathroom and allocated bedroom.

License number
2019-2592
neighborhood_overview: Close walk to Schiller Park--a dog lovers dream. Very big community vibe. A plethora of truly great restaurants from $--$$$. A couple of favorites are Lindeys/Barcelona/German Village coffee shop (unbelievable character and super cheap!). Visit the book loft, St Marys newly renovated Church, and the wine shop on 3rd.
host_about: Enigmatic and intrepid traveller. Citizen of 3 Countries. Delights in learning about others journeys, interests, hobbies. Enjoying the explosion of great eateries and craft breweries in Columbus. I have travelled extensively world-wide, with two of my favorite experiences being a 7 day sailing holiday throughout the Greek Islands, and walking the el' Camino de Santiago. I have several beloved authors, two of which are Ken Follet, and Bryce Courtney. I have a wide assortment of friends of differing ages and backgrounds. I am a dog lover, but don't have one at this minute. I've run 5 marathons, and aspire to qualify for Boston. You will be welcomed with conversation, or space, as you desire.

The space
Our open loft style apartment with one queen bed, and a couch has everything you need to enjoy your stay in Columbus! The kitchen is stocked with cookware to cook simple meals, stainless steel appliances and granite countertops. Enjoy coffee made from the Keurig. Wood style flooring throughout and floor to ceiling windows allowing for lots of natural light. A washer and dryer is available inside the apartment for your convenience. neighborhood_overview: This is perfectly situated between Columbus Commons (across the street) and Scioto Mile. The Ohio Theatres is only a block away and Capitol Square is only 2 blocks away. Bicentennial Park and Scioto Mile is just a 5 minute walk. Grant Medical Center, the Brewery District, German Village, Columbus Museum of Art and Nationwide Arena are all within a mile away. The Ohio State University is only a 10 minute drive. Multiple dining options are just a few blocks away.

name: Huge 4 BR 1.5  BA house in Heart of Downtown
description:
Updated historic townhome in the heart of downtown Columbus. This is a very spacious, cozy, and clean property, great for large groups! 4 bedrooms, 1 parking space and free street parking, and 1.5 bathrooms. We can accommodate up to 12 guests. Just down the street from Downtown Columbus and the historic Old Town East and Topiary Park. Brand new flooring, amenities, and always freshly cleaned sheets and towels. Wifi, coffee, laundry supplies all included. Very spacious and comfortable townhome!

The space
This newly renovated townhouse is great for large groups of guests or the couples getaway! We are right down the street from the beautiful Topiary Garden, a short walk to Olde Towne East and Downtown Columbus, and we are a short ride to OSU and the Short North. The interior of the property will bring you back to a historical time period of Columbus with great history!

The first floor consists of a living room with comfortable couch and HD TV, full kitc
neighborhood_overview: The Old Towne East is the eastern district of downtown Columbus. Within Old Towne East are buildings of culture, art, design, and education. Columbus Metropolitan Library and the Columbus Museum of Art are both located within the district. Also, there are numerous educational options within this district. Located in the district are the Columbus College of Art and Design, which was founded in 1879 as the Columbus Art School and enrolls roughly 1,300 students, and the Capital University Law School. The area allows for easy accessibility to everything Columbus has to offer including the Arena District, German Village, Short North, Crew Stadium, and is 10 minutes from Port Columbus International Airport.
host_about: Husband and father.

name: Beautiful Historic Home in German Village Area
description:
Beautiful historic home in desirable German Village area, close to downtown and Nationwide Children's Hospital. Guest bedroom used for Airbnb, master bedroom is locked off. Walking distance to Schiller Park, and multiple restaurants/bars on picturesque brick streets. The large welcoming porch is a great place to sit and relax while people watching. A private back patio with grill, also offers a quiet space. Inside, while historic, offers modern updates such as upgraded appliances & fixtures.

The space
The bedroom has a newer Gel-Infused Green Tea Memory Foam Queen Mattress, dresser, & a TV. My home is non-smoking, clean and comfortable, feel free to use the kitchen and/or washer & dryer. Agadore (the cat) is friendly but not intrusive. Please be aware that while I will not be home during your stay, this is my primary residence and my bedroom is locked off. There are personal items in the home (refrigerator & bathroom) but I want my guest to feel at home while v
neighborhood_overview: German Village is a quiet historic neighborhood, close to downtown and easy access to many surrounding areas. Very close to Nationwide Children's Hospital & Columbus Convention Center. Great place to stay for local festivals, conferences and concerts. Very walkable neighborhood with friendly neighbors and something to do around every corner. The architecture is beautiful, most homes built in the late 1800 - early 1900.
host_about: Very easy going, love to entertain and garden. In addition to my flower garden I help grow tomatoes and peppers and can salsa. I am a member of the German Village Garten Club and volunteer regularly at Ronald McDonald House. Love a patio and live music!

Large 3 bedroom duplex that can sleep up to 10 or more guests. 2 king beds, 2 queen, 2 futons, one fold out cot, one fold out memory foam mattress. Crib and additional air mattresses available upon request. TVs/internet with access to Netflix, amazon video and more all provided by the host.

Key will either be in the mail box, door will be unlocked or I'll be home. THE LOCK BOX IS JAMMED.

No locals please.

My home is full of charm. A lot of people enjoy looking at the art. I have two separate listings, each has a twin bed.

My hom
neighborhood_overview:
My neighborhood was at one place the homes of James Thurber and the Robber Barons of old. It is gorgeous with a variety of old homes--Queen Anne, Victorian--and tree lined streets. It is experiencing a renaissance and offers a tavern (very good food!), a diner where you can enjoy a good breakfast, a pizza shop that's a cut above the chain pizza's, and a new vegan cafe.
These restaurants are a 5-10 minute minute walk from the house.
host_about: I am a friendly person who enjoys getting to know others.  I love to read, work in the yard, sing, sing, sing and snuggle with my dog--when he let's me. I love tea, love Italy and enjoyed Ireland and enjoy movies shown at art cinemas. I don't watch much television but when I do it's usually PBS. I don't smoke.  I really enjoy travelling and have been on package tours and well as trips where I hunt out hostels.  I appreciate having different people around!

name: Big Grey-Short North 4BR-3.5B 2800sqft RoweRentals
description:
This is a new custom home in historic Victorian Village, Short North. Experience the comforts of home and still be close to the Short North & OSU!

The space
This custom home is located just 1.6 miles from the Convention Center and 1.9 miles from OSU. No parties or events allowed.

Nearby:
Columbus Convention Center- 1.6 mi
OSU Stadium- 1.9 mi
Downtown- all areas within 2.2 mi
Ohio Expo/ Fairground/Mapfre Stadium- 1.7 mi
Schottenstein Center- 2.4 mi
Easton Mall- 6.6 mi

PLEASE NOTE:
• We do not host guests that reside in the Columbus area.

Additional Guest & Fees
There is an additional guest fee per person/night for the 3rd guest and up. When entering the correct guest count into the reservation or inquiry this will be automatically calculated. Registered, paying overnight guests are only permitted at the residence. We receive active recordings from exterior video cameras- and we strictly enf
neighborhood_overview:
The Short North Arts District is one of the Midwest’s best kept secrets. There is a huge variety of unique shops, bars and restaurants, and art galleries along High Street and a number of annual events that take place year-round. We have a thorough list of recommendations in the house to local bakeries, cafes, and restaurants.
The Short North is made up of several historic neighborhoods; this home is located in Victorian Village Village.

IS THE NEIGHBORHOOD SAFE?
We live nearby and feel the neighborhood is relatively safe, but it can be a bit intimidating if you are not use to city living. Please note this is the city- we do have petty crime in the Short North and University area, and always advise to practice not leaving valuables in your car (we have not had any issues at our apartments, I state this because we are in the city) and walk with a buddy at night on well-lit, busy roads such as High Street, Summit, and 5th Ave.

Near the following:
•
host_about:
A few years after meeting in Japan, we moved to Columbus in 2OO9 and have been loving it ever since! We love traveling (25+ countries between us) and are passionate about renovating historic homes and building new homes. Please check out our IGs at @RoweRentals and @RoweHouseCbus to see our house journey.

We love being hosts- providing a comfortable home to travelers visiting our gem of a city- 'Cbus'! We know quite a lot about Short North entertainment & restaurants- there is so much to do here, feel free to ask!
- Ingrid, Mike, and Frances, Co-Host 

Our life motto- Live like someone left the gate open!

While in the kitchen, you can help yourself to the purified
neighborhood_overview:
This walkable, bikeable neighborhood, a short 1.5 miles from downtown Columbus and it’s major highways, is one of Columbus’ most coveted areas. A hybrid of urban flair and neighborhood warmth, Grandview’s vibes are at the same time laid-back and buzzing with energy. Stroll the wide, tree-lined sidewalks of Grandview Ave amid the hum of cafe-table chatter.

Discover specialized independent shops, curated New-York style boutiques, a chocolatier’s gorgeous handmade truffles, independent breweries, top-rated coffee roasters, cutting-edge salons, and of course, world-class restaurants that use fresh, locally-sourced ingredients. The electric mix of restaurants here have consistently been recognized by critics and diners alike for their cuisine, ambience, and outstanding attention to detail. Grandview is also home to a collection of award-winning craft microbreweries and taprooms.

A hub of creative culture and out-of-the-ordinary experiences, Grandview offers an array
host_about:
Hello, my name is Joe - I was born and raised in Ohio and love Airbnb which means you’ll receive high service and quality, local recommendations to make the most of your trip. Feel free to instantly book or message me, I’m happy to answer any specific questions in advance.

By day, I’m a consultant. 
By night, I’m a friends/family man and an Ohio sports junkie. 

I’m a well traveled Airbnb guest and have pulled a lot of inspiration from other properties so I know what great hosts should do to create a comfortable guest experience. Be sure to ask me about a few of my favorite things on our welcome sheet.

Make yourself at home!

name: 410 W 4th · Short North Home 1 mile From OSU with 2 Garage
description:
No Local Guests, No One Night Stays


Newly renovated 2,000 SF home (4 BR/2.5 Bath) in Harrison West. Ideally located for everything Columbus has to offer - 1.8 miles to Ohio Stadium, 8 minute walk to the lively Short North, and 1.5 miles from concert venues, Clippers & Bluejackets games in the Arena District.

This is a prefect space for Ohio State football attendees, festival goers, dinner parties, bridal showers, bachelor/bachelorette parties, and other similar gatherings. Large outdoor patio area and 2- car garage Very open space ideal for entertaining for 16+ guests. Dynamic outdoor patio area complete with outdoor dining, covered lounge area, and stainless steel grill for outdoor meals and activities. Living room has plenty of seating with high-speed Wifi and Roku access, and the dining area that seats 6. The kitchen area has granite counter-tops, stainless steel appliance and an assortment of spices and basic cooking ingredients for large family-sized
neighborhood_overview: Coffee shop, local bar, and convenience store within 5 minute walking distance.

name: Modern Luxury Private Room ★ Mins to CMH airport
description:
Enjoy the beautifully designed house for your stay in Columbus OH! A stunning 5-star room, tailored to perfection, filled with some excellent design and decor. Enjoy a state-of-the-art Smart TV in the living room while you lounge in your new suburban home. It’s the ideal room retreat in a unique home, located to the east of the center of Columbus – 5 minute drive to Port Columbus Airport. Get ready to get inspired!

The space
This spacious, ideally located property offers a stay beyond your imagination. Facilitating several places to relax and your very own private room to seclude yourself. The quiet surroundings will easily make for a relaxing stay. Considering the location and facilities of the home we host lots of couples and solo travellers. This wonderful apartment has a spacious shared living room, a shared open kitchen and a bedroom fit for kings and queens. It also suits friends looking for a nice location. Comfortable and spacious, yet located convenientl
neighborhood_overview:
We are located to the east of Columbus. With lots of great eateries at a convenient distance such as:
• Scotty’s Cafe
• Cherbourg Bakery
• Rubino’s Pizza
• Jeni’s Splendid Ice Creams
• Stav’s Diner
• Brassica

Minutes to Columbus John Glenn Airport, 5 minutes to Easton Shopping Center, 10 minutes to Expo Center, 15 minutes to The Ohio State University/Downtown/Short North.

A little more inwards you will find Columbus’ Near East Side; an up-and-coming destination just east of downtown Columbus, beyond the Columbus Museum of Art. This collection of neighborhoods, which includes Olde Towne East, the King-Lincoln District, and Franklin Park, is an up-and-coming area full of stately Victorian homes and leafy streets. Olde Towne East is host to interesting clusters of dining and nightlife along Parsons Avenue and Oak Street. On Parsons, grab a coffee at Upper Cup, enjoy farm-fresh produce at Black Creek Bistro and music and drinks at
host_about:
Hello! 

We are Dane and Alicia (DNA), we both are world travelers with a passion for real estate and hospitality, based in Columbus OH! Considering a deep-rooted passion for anything to do with hospitality and facilitating great customer experiences, Airbnb is the perfect thing to do! 

Not only do we love being Airbnb hosts, but we also love being on the traveling spectrum too. Have traveled a lot and am now doing more overseas travel!

We really enjoy the ability to share the experience of living in this wonderful house. Definitely check with us for amazing must visit locations, where to go for superb walks and wonderful experiences in Columbus! We love meeting new people from different walks of life, but as a host, we give my guests all the space they want.

Looking forward to hosting you soon,

Dane & Alicia

name: Ruby in the Village | The gem of downtown CBUS 💎
description:
Ruby in the Village is a historic, two-story townhome located in Italian Village within minutes of Columbus' best restaurants, coffee shops and attractions.

Short North / High St: 0.3 miles
Ohio Stadium: 2.4 miles
Convention Center: 1 mile
Nationwide Arena: 1.6 miles

The red exterior makes it easy to spot, but the real treat is inside its walls. Exposed brick, tall ceilings and high end details will provide the perfect place to relax during your stay in this beautiful and thriving city.

The space
We've given this home so much love and have purposely furnished it with some of our favorite personal items--we hope they make you happy as well!

The living room is bright and cozy with exposed brick, a Roku TV (meaning no cable, but all the apps to sign in yourself!) and a CB2 sleeper sofa.

The kitchen is stocked with pots/pans, silverware, dishes--all the basics and then some. You'll find a Nespresso machine w
neighborhood_overview: We've lived within one mile of this area for over 10 years, and couldn't be more in love with its charm, history and growth. Columbus is home to incredible restaurants, coffee shops and bakeries.
host_about: I’m Jacqui and live with my husband and young daughter in Columbus, Ohio. We love new people and new adventures, and believe so strongly in treating all people with respect. See more about the space we care so much about on insta, @rubyinthevillage.

name: Glen Echo Hideaway-Studio Apartment
description:
Entire space has been renovated & everything is new! Comfortable & QUIET studio apartment on a QUIET family street which is conveniently located near a major highway (I-71), OSU/Ohio State University (1.1 m), Mapfre Stadium (1.4 m), Ohio Expo Center & State Fairgrounds (2.1 m) & downtown Columbus (4.8 m). Bus stop is within 300 feet of our home & minutes to OSU & downtown.

The space
Clean, completely private & separate from our living space. The unit is attached to our home so you may hear some noise. Safe & quiet family neighborhood, plenty of private parking. Enjoy our backyard, or sip your favorite beverage on the back porch.

We do have a small dog, he is friendly & loves people, however, he does use the backyard. Please be sure to keep the gate closed at all times.

Guest access
Guests have their own private kitchenette, bathroom with large shower, a comfortable queen bed & small sitting area. There is a Smart TV which has acc
neighborhood_overview: The beautiful Glen Echo Ravine is a short walk from our home. It is a great park for bird watching, leisurely, quiet strolls & picnicking, far away from the street noise of the busy city above.
host_about: I’m a stay at home mom who runs an Airbnb. Our kids keep me super busy but I love meeting new people & spending as much time as I can with my family.

name: Cozy SOHUD Second Floor Apartment With Parking Lot
description:
This is a one bedroom unit, with fresh paint and new carpet in the Bedroom. There is a queen size bed, nightstand, desk, and small closet. There is a spacious bathroom, new shower only, (no bathtub). Clean fresh linens, and some basic necessities, hair dryer, etc. The kitchen is basic with stove, refrigerator, and microwave. All kitchenware is supplied and some basic cooking items provided. Coffeemaker. The living room has couch, chair tables and TV with local antennae, amazon stick.

The space
Great location, some new fresh updates. Close to many venues like Mapfre Stadium, OSU, Hospitals, Short North, and Downtown. Awesome for weekend events like Blue Jackets and concerts. Also convenient for short-term stays. One thing to note is that the thermostat for this house is not located in this unit. We do provide window air conditioning units in the summer and room heaters in the winter. **Exterior security cameras are present for security**

name: Bold + Artistic | Downtown Views @ 1br w/ Balcony
description:
All Frontdesk stays are contactless self-check-in and include Scout, our exclusive digital companion to guide you through everything you'll need before and during your time with us. We're also available 24/7 via text or phone and have a local team should you need anything.
Guests are required to follow all regional and building-specific COVID-19 policies. We continue to employ a professional cleaning staff adhering to OSHA and CDC guidelines to make sure your stay is clean and comfortable.

The space
With its unique shape and large murals, this community is anything but ordinary. Our 1 bedroom apartment with one queen bed, couch & air mattress has everything you need to enjoy your stay in Columbus! The kitchen is stocked with cookware to cook simple meals, stainless steel appliances and quartz countertops. Enjoy coffee made from the Keurig while getting a breath of fresh air on the balcony. A washer and dryer is available inside the apartment for your conveni
neighborhood_overview: This quiet community of galleries, event spaces, art studios, nightlife, and old factory buildings shows the history of Columbus. The COSI museum, National Veterans Memorial and Museum, Genoa Park and Scioto River is only a 10 minute walk. If you crave the city life, downtown is only minutes away across the bridge. There is much to see and appreciate on the west side of river.
host_about: Frontdesk offers trusted travelers exactly the stay they want - their kind of place, in their kind of neighborhood.

name: CAT CONDO  // Must Show Proof of Vaccination //
description:
• Condo in Columbus right by freeways 270, 71, and 161.
• 10 minute drive to CMH airport
• Safe Neighborhood + parking
• Short drive to Otterbein, Easton/Polaris malls, & downtown Columbus.
• Husband and wife in our early 30s & our two tuxedo cats.

2 private bedrooms with flat screen TVs, mini fridges and doors that locks from the inside. 1 private guest bathroom with shower/tub combo, drawer space, hair dryer + toiletries.

No weapons of any kind allowed, even with license
420-Friendly :)

The space
We are located in a corner unit on the golf course. This is for aesthetic purposes only, as our home ownership does not automatically qualify us for use of the golf course for golfing. There is a walking path that residents are allowed to use. We are a 30 second walk from the pool, and our spacious backyard view is beautiful. We just renovated our house in 2018 with updated eco-friendly appliances, new windows and bl
neighborhood_overview: Small community of families of all ages tucked away in Westerville. Quaint and quiet, yet still social. Lots of dogs in the area. Private walking path on property through the woods, as well as a "take a book/leave a book" library stand. Free, well-lit parking directly out front.

name: Rare Downtown Apartment with Free Parking
description:
A unique apartment in Downtown Columbus with a spacious living room that boasts a brand new 4K flat screen television in a stadium-seated living room that seats up to 25 people. Deeply cleaned kitchen appliances for cooking, refinished bathroom tile, and new shower head. Get a great night’s sleep in the secluded bedroom that has a memory foam queen mattress, black out curtains, and iMac setup that empowers the weekend warrior.

(No Smoking. Please see house rules.)

The space
Located downtown on the corner of Mound and High Street (private parking behind the building, 333 S Pearl Street).

Perfect location for Red White and Boom, events happening at The Westin Hotel, The Southern Theatre, Ohio Theatre, Columbus Commons, and Nationwide Conference Center. Also a great way to attend College Football, Hockey, Soccer, and major music events while staying outside of the traffic and commotion.

When you walk into the apartment, you may noti
neighborhood_overview:
This apartment is situated in a quiet part of High Street in Downtown Columbus. Within a block, you'll find an Irish Pub, Wine, Coffee, and Chocolate Shop, Barbeque Restaurant, Tapas Restaurant, and Hotel Restaurant. There's a European suit store directly below the apartment. Two blocks walk in either direction leads you to more restaurants, bars, arcades, and downtown parks and patios surrounded by office buildings.

(No Smoking. Please see house rules.)
host_about:
During college, I spent two years on the road as a musician, performing shows with 21 Pilots, and all around the US and Europe. Throughout my travels, I started a few small businesses and non-profits, and made Columbus my home. I’m currently a Management Consultant. I travel internationally for technology projects, speak at conferences, and research culture in city transformation initiatives.

As an AirBnB host, I enjoy creating the kind of environment that I would want to have for myself as a traveler — a place that’s modern, comfortable, equipped with new and working amenities, and in the heart of downtown, near bars, restaurants, theaters, and conferences, yet still restful and peaceful.

Completely remodeled and fully furnished Southern Orchard duplex near downtown and the Children's Hospital. The building was just giving a modern remodel, inside and out, with all new granite countertops, new flooring and all new appliances.

This fully furnished Southern Orchard apartment has 2 bedrooms and 1 bathroom which allows you to sleep up to 6 people comfortably.

name: The Brick Townhouse | Walk to OSU & Arts District
description:
You’ll love the location and character of this updated vintage brick townhouse, just steps to the vibrant Short North Arts District! Walk everywhere for the weekend: less than 5 minutes on foot to great dining and nightlife (Condado, North High Brewing, The Table, Paulie Gee's Pizza, Kroger grocery store). Walk a little more to Ohio State (15 mins to the south end of campus), or down High St to the Convention Center (25 mins).

The space
You'll arrive and be able to park two cars end-to-end in the driveway alongside the building. From there, use the keypad lock to let yourself into the building. The first floor is the living space, with a living room with a large couch (sleeps 1, but you will need to bring your own sheets/pillows/blanket if someone will be sleeping on the couch). The eat-in kitchen features a large peninsula counter top with space to sit and socialize and is stocked with basic amenities (cookware, dishes, etc.) and a Keurig coffee maker. We p
neighborhood_overview: The "Dennison Place" neighborhood of Columbus is the best area for a traveler who wants to experience the vibrancy of the Short North Arts District (we're at the northern end of the district), the grandeur of Victorian Village architecture (to the southwest), and yet still be a quick walk (25-minutes or less) to The Ohio State University and Columbus Convention Center / downtown.
host_about:
Hi, we're Kate and Nat!  We live here in the "Short North" neighborhood of Columbus, near the properties that we manage.

We are both graduates of The Ohio State University - Go Bucks!  Kate is a physical therapist and Nat has a background in IT & management consulting.  We love being Airbnb hosts and hearing about all the exciting reasons that people travel to Columbus!

neighborhood_overview: Our home is on a safe and quiet loop with friendly neighbors. We have close, easy access to just about anyplace in Columbus and have excellent entertainment and restaurants close by.

Guests are required to follow all regional and building-specific COVID-19 policies. We continue to employ a professional cleaning staff adhering to OSHA and CDC guidelines to make sure your stay is clean and comfortable.

The space
Our one bedroom apartment with one queen bed, couch & air mattress has everything you need to enjoy your stay in Columbus! The controlled access building displays iconic architecture with high-end design and finishes. The kitchen is stocked with cookware to cook simple meals, stainless steel appliances and quartz countertops. Enjoy coffee made from the Keurig. Wood style flooring throughout and floor to ceiling windows allowing for lots of natural light. Enjoy a
neighborhood_overview: You can't stay in a more perfect location! Directly across the street from Columbus Commons and Scioto Mile and Bicentennial Park is only 3 blocks away! 3/4 mile to Grant Medical Center and a mile to North Market, Columbus Museum of Art, Nationwide Arena, Ohio Theatre or Capitol Square. The Ohio State University is only a 10 minute drive. Multiple dining options are just a few blocks away.

name: Live on High Street~Short North w/parking
description:
If you want to be within walking distance of anything and everything this is the bnb for you. This 1 Bedroom, 1 Bath condo has a great back deck and is located on High Street in the Short North. It has private parking options in the back on Pearl which is hard to come by in this area. It is a 8 minute walk to the Convention Center, a 15 minute walk to Nationwide Arena, 2 min walk to Goodale Park, and a 5 minute uber from OSU campus, German Village, and Nationwide Children's Hospital.

The space
This apartment is perfect for business, families, and anyone looking to enjoy the city of Columbus in absolute style. It has private off street parking options in the back that are first come first serve. The back deck area is really quite nice to have 6 months out of the year. The unit is fully equipped with a washer/dryer, fridge, microwave, oven, and coffee brewer. The bedroom is very large and contains one Queen memory foam bed with a large closet with shelving for all
neighborhood_overview: The Short North is the place to be if your coming to Columbus for literally anything. EVERYTHING is within walking distance of my home. The airport is also only an 8 minute uber.
host_about: I am from Springfield, OH and went to college at OSU where I traveled abroad in Barcelona. I moved to Chicago for a couple years and got some corporate experience in a fun city. I then moved back to Columbus where I live currently in the Short North with my beautiful fiancée. I help run my family's coffee and vending business, called Sheehan Brothers. I love traveling, golfing, eating and most importantly The Buckeyes!!

High end finishes and stainless steel appliances. There is private parking with 2 car garage access in the back, as well as on-street parking out front. neighborhood_overview:
Joel’s home is located in Columbus, Ohio, United States.
Located in the beautiful Harrison West neighborhood, this home is perfectly situated in the heart of the city. Just blocks away from High Street and the Short North attractions, Ohio State's main campus, OSU Wexner Medical Center, and Grandview. Several parks nearby and walking distance to local bars and restaurants.

On High Street you will find shopping, art galleries, bars, and some of the best restaurants in the city in the Short North Arts District. This area of Columbus is one of the city’s most popular destinations!

Notable nearby destinations: OSU Stadium, Nationwide Arena and the surrounding Arena District, Easton Towne Center, John Glenn International Airport, Columbus Convention Center, Nationwide Children’s Hospital, The Ohio Statehouse, and Franklin Park Conservatory.

name: Luxurious German Village home with rooftop deck!
description:
Historic German Village home within 2 miles of downtown Columbus, OSU campus, hospitals and stadium. Less than 1 mile from Short North Arts District, and Nationwide Children’s Hospital. Perfectly located within walking distance to popular restaurants such as Lindy’s and Barcelona, multiple bars, coffee shops and eclectic stops. Easy access to major interstate highways and public transportation.

The space
Newly renovated. Enter the property by opening the original doors from the 1870’s into a beautifully private courtyard. Newly designed kitchen with high end appliances is a cook’s dream. The living area features large windows and tons of natural light with the original wood carved fireplace. There is a half bath on the first floor. Up the steps to three bedrooms, two bathrooms and access to the rooftop patio and the sounds of the city.

Guest access
The home is yours to enjoy during your stay!

Guests will not be able to ac
neighborhood_overview: German Village is the home of Schmidt’s with German food at its finest.  Features are their very own sausages and sauerkraut.  Shops in the area make browsing fun!  Or there’s Katzinger’s, the local deli where you choose your own homemade pickle right from the barrell!  Lindy’s, a very popular dining destination is 2 blocks away and be sure to make reservations.  One of the largest, privately owned book stores in the country featuring 32 rooms is in the heart of German Village.  The Book Loft is a great place to spend an afternoon with a coffee shop right next door.  The beautifully redesigned Columbus Library is close and worth the stop.

name: Crestview
description:
Beautiful three bedroom home located in Clintonville, a beautiful, residential neighborhood in Columbus, Ohio. Just North of Ohio State Stadium. Near all main highways and very easy access downtown via the highway or the boulevard. Walking distance to many shops, bars and restaurants. Perfect for families, large groups, or business groups. Fully furnished with everything you may need. Free Wifi. Linens and towels are provided. Sofa couch pulls out into full size bed! Convenient street parking! Pets are welcome at all of our properties with a $20.00 fee per stay regardless of how many furbabies come.

Absolutely no parties, loud music, or being loud outdoors. The owner lives next door and has been known to ask guests to leave without giving warnings when these things have happened in the past. We want to make sure to keep all of our guests and neighbors happy so please be courteous. The house is equipped with sound monitors in order to prevent loud or large gatherings. We appr
host_about:
We are childhood friends and business partners.
We are originally from Canton, Ohio and now reside in the Cleveland area. We both graduated from The Ohio State University and started hosting on Airbnb in 2013. We started Cleveland House Hotels, which is a short term vacation property company in 2015.  We have a full time cleaning staff and maintenance person on hand to take care of any issues.  We also have our reservations specialist, Deanna who will be the one responding to your requests.

Niko (Nick) has been in the hospitality business for many years, having worked in hotels and restaurants.  He owns a small diner in Old Brooklyn called Gus's Family Restaurant.  He is married and has two children.  In addition to cooking and owning a restaurant, Niko is the co-founder and COO of Cleveland House Hotels.  

Billy is a co-founder and CEO of Cleveland House Hotels.  Billy is a successful real estate investor and has been in the sales business for over 15 years.  He loves traveling and spending time with his son, William.

description:
Our walk-out basement suite is part of a new home in the quaint Italian Village neighborhood of Columbus. As avid AirBnB users ourselves, we take pride in keeping the space clean, welcoming and stocked with the basic amenities. The suite features a separate entrance to come and go as you please, kitchenette with the essentials, living-room space, full bathroom, and bedroom with a queen bed and closet space. Our favorite restaurants are within walking distance.

The space
The Rooster's Den is less than 1 mile from the Short North Arts District, and less than 2 miles from The Ohio State University Campus, Downtown Columbus The Greater Columbus Convention Center, Nationwide Area, and MAPFRE Stadium. Flying in? Our place is a 12 minute drive from the John Glenn International Airport.

There's a table in the living room and a desk in the bedroom, along with wifi, to make working on your laptop convenient.

We know how important a great night's sle
neighborhood_overview: The space is located in a quiet section of the neighborhood, while being steps away from all of the action - from our favorite brewery to a New York Times featured pastry/coffee shop, it makes grabbing a beverage or bite to eat really convenient. Within a five minute walk, you're in the heart of the north end of the Short North, a popular destination with a plethora of shops and restaurant options to choose from. We include a list of our favorite spots in our AirBnB Guidebook. Insider Tip: If you are walking to the Short North Arts District, we recommend taking 4th Avenue, in lieu of 5th Avenue due to the construction on 5th Avenue.

host_about:
I’m a moderately geeky real estate investor who prefers to be outdoors and is an avid hiker, fisher, runner and explorer. 

I live in one of my favorite places, Columbus, Ohio.  I provide fun, affordable, high end, safe and memorable vacation homes and event venues in and around the city.  I take pride in my properties and always respond to guests' needs.

I love great food and cocktails and am full of suggestions for fulfilling local experiences.  

I love to travel.  A few of my favorite destinations include Barcelona, Jaipur, Paris, Santorini, Athens, London, and Manhattan Montana.

I love animals.  I own cats and grew up with dogs.   I design my homes to be pet friendly.  I would love to meet your pets.

name: The Downtown Spacious Home
description:
Large, spacious, modern downtown single family home with a private paved parking lot for three cars and free curb side street parking. It features a large front and back yard patio, second story outdoor balcony, recently renovated kitchen and bathrooms with updated appliances, living room and four private bedrooms. Smart TV is equipped with Netflix and related streaming services that you will need to log into in order to access. The living room is furnished with a sofa bed for additional guests and we will provide high end air mattresses upon request. The kitchen comes fully stocked with all of your cooking essentials, a Kuerig machine for coffee and large dining room table for gatherings. This listing used to be my home for over three years and I am still in love with the place. All of my neighbors are great and while I lived here I never had any safety issues despite the up and coming downtown location. Please treat it with kindness and respect!

●Free, easy street parking in front of the building.
●Located in the historic Berwick neighborhood, next door to Bexley & Capital University, close to shops, restaurants & coffee shops.
●10 minutes to Downtown Columbus & Nationwide Children's Hospital, 12 minutes to the Arena District.
●"The location was perfect and the space was remarkable. It was truly a dream home!"

Note: available ONLY for stays of 30 days or more

The space
Living Room
●Comfy Bassett sofa and lounge chairs + bright reading nook.
●50" flat Roku Smart TV with access to Netflix, Hulu, and other TV apps. There is no antenna or cable.

Kitchen + Dining
●Stocked with everything you need to make a meal, along with a Keurig coffee maker, regular coffee maker & coffee/tea bar (there is no complimentary breakfast). There is no dishwasher.

Bedrooms
●Both bedr
neighborhood_overview:
Berwick is a historic, low-key neighborhood, minutes from downtown. There's easy freeway access and lots of nearby restaurants, coffee shops and bars.

Bexley's Main Street, located five minutes from the apartment by car, is a good place to start, with a Starbucks, bookstore and several cafes and ice cream shops. See a list of our recommendations onsite or check out our guidebook.

OSU, the Blue Jackets arena, COSI, Easton Town Center and more are a quick Uber or drive away.
host_about: We're former expats and Peace Corps volunteers, who together have lived on six continents, including a ten-year stint in Bangkok, Thailand. After exploring the world together, we returned to our hometown of Columbus, amazed at how our city had blossomed in the time we were away. We're proud of everything the "heart of Ohio" offers and enjoy sharing it—and our welcoming space—with visitors.

We also offer a walk-in shower and work space for your convenience. Our one-story guesthouse has a private entrance, free street parking, and a private patio and yard. description:
Located in the heart of historic German Village, this charming home has off-street parking, a big private outdoor patio, eat-in kitchen, freestanding soaking tub, king bedroom, 2 living rooms w/pull out sofa beds, Smart TVs, W/D, and Wi-Fi. The space

STRICTLY ENFORCED: ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKING,
neighborhood_overview: German Village is memorable for a thousand reasons, all of which are intimately personal to the individuals fortunate to reside in or visit the neighborhood. The sense of community is palpable, the historic architecture is beautiful, and the history is visible. German Village is not easily forgotten. From walkability to a great sense of community, German Village is an incredible place to be. You feel it when you cross through the Third Street gateway or explore the parks. Millions of individual bricks were placed on top of one another to form this Village.
host_about:
I'm a professional photographer splitting my time between Columbus, Manhattan, and Barcelona. My wife and I travel all over the country and world, now with our two little boys. We're Superhosts ourselves, which make us very courteous guests and will always leave your place tidy upon our departure, just as we’d hope you’d treat our home.  

Check out our listings if you’re interested in staying at one of our properties in Columbus. From a stunning 3 bedroom Mid-century modern home in Bexley to turn of the century historic brick homes in the heart of German Village. You're covered on your next trip to Columbus whether looking for a weekend retreat, a relaxing place to call home during a business trip, attending a convention, a wedding, or in need of longer-term accommodations for your medical residency or stint as a professor at OSU!
We look forward to hosting you!

This location is just minutes to downtown Columbus, and steps from the Short North Arts District. Milo-Grogan is a historic neighborhood, in central Columbus.

description:
NO CLEANING OR EXTRA FEES!

Stay in the heart of Columbus in this cozy attic suite in a restored historic home! You will have full access to the upstairs portion of our home, which includes a bedroom and private living room. We love showing off our backyard garden and chickens, so feel free to ask for a tour!

Whether you come for work or leisure, we have the amenities to make your stay comfortable and productive. Feel free to browse our bookshelves, find a board game, or relax with Netflix.

The space
You will come in on the main floor where the kitchen, main living room, and shared bathroom are all free for you to use. Upstairs is your private suite with a workstation, mini-fridge, microwave, and TV.
Parking is readily available on the street in front of our home.

Guest access
The upstairs suite is exclusively your space. Make yourself at home!
The rest of the home (except our bedroom) is all shared space. You
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood is one of Columbus' older neighborhoods, and it is currently undergoing a revitalization. Less than two blocks away from our home is Linden Park which just reopened after a complete renovation and includes ball courts, a walking trail, and fishing pond.

We are in the city, though, so please take all normal precautions.

name: Glenmont Inn-Whole House! Outdoor oasis-Pool,Fire
description:
House is the original on the street, dated 1904. The house was completely refreshed and rebuilt adding an additional 2200 sq feet for a total of 3500 sq feet. 6 bedrooms and 4 1/2 bath. The house is a relaxing Oasis in the city. The backyard has a gas Fireplace, cedar pergola and pool house with changing room. There is a natural gas grill and heated shower. The pool and hotub with another large firepit feature with seating. You really must see to appreciate this 5 star private backyard.

The space
The entire house has 6 bedrooms and 4 1/2 baths. 3 rooms have their own private baths. 3 bedrooms share a large beautiful bath with deep tub and skylight. neighborhood_overview:
Clintonville is a very eclectic and popular neighborhood. Biking and scooter friendly with several parks and bike paths that lead down the river to OSU or to downtown. The property has several bikes available for guests. There are 8-10 really good restaurants within walking or bike distance and uber is inexpensive. The Ohio State University is only 3.2 miles down the main drag and Riverside hospital is only 1.5 miles away.
Clintonville has great access to either highway and pretty central to anything in columbus being only 7 miles from Downtown or the Short North food and Arts district.

name: La Rose Cottage: European retreat off of High St.
description:
Welcome to La Rose Cottage! French inspired retreat in the middle of the city. Located off of High St. in the north Clintonville area, this quaint cottage has everything you need for a relaxing stay! Recently renovated with attention and care, this cottage provides accommodation for up to 4 people (2 twin beds and 1 queen). Charming decor and comfortable seating areas provides a cozy feeling for socializing or relaxation. Close to Ohio State Campus and 15 minutes from downtown Columbus.

The space
Our cottage was designed with French influences to provide a rustic yet refined European vibe to your stay. The cottage is equipped with everything you need for your stay: a fully stocked kitchen, microwave, toaster, dishwasher, oven, washer, dryer, hot tea kettle, and a Nespresso machine. Driveway parking. Large, fenced in backyard to relax and recharge. Charming sun room with a farm table for dinners or work and a cozy seating area to look out on the garden during the
neighborhood_overview:
Sharon Heights township in north Clintonville is a safe and friendly neighborhood with many families and retirees. Direct access to the Olentangy bike trail that leads directly downtown. Charming and historic Worthington is minutes down the street. Easy freeway access.
~13 miles from John Glenn International Airport
~6 miles to Ohio State University & stadium
~10 miles to downtown Columbus, the Convention Center, and Shorth North
host_about:
Hello! My name is Mariana and I love to travel and discover new places. I am a classically trained violinist from Ohio, and I now work as the Director of Operations for an amazing chamber orchestra in Columbus. I have used airbnb for multiple trips and have loved it every time. I have stayed in Paris, Bretagne, NYC, London, and New Orleans (where I got married ). 
I adore getting to know people, ethnic cuisine, and am very respectful to my surroundings. I think that traveling is one of the greatest joys of life!
