neighborhood_overview: You've picked the perfect neighborhood to stay in. It has the best of both worlds - it's just minutes away from The Ohio State University, from downtown, from Short North, the stadiums and a ton of great restaurants and eateries. At the same time, it's on a quiet street, so you can get away from the hustle and bustle and just relax when you come home. You'll love staying here!
host_about:
Hello hello!

We are Igor, Boris and Susan - friends that are happy to open up our home to host you and your group in the wonderful city of Columbus. 

A few words about us:

Igor is a financial analyst that has been working in the industry for nearly a decade.

Boris and Susan are a young, professional couple originally from Lithuania and China. 

We all love to travel ourselves and try to stay at Airbnb wherever we go. 

Between all of us, we've been to probably over a 100 Airbnbs over the years and have seen a range from unbelievably beautiful ones to the not-so-good ones.

We wanted to share this house with Airbnb guests as a way to pay back the incredibly hospitality and experiences we've encountered ourselves during our travels. We know what it's like to come to a new place for the first time, especially if you have a group of people with you, and our goal is to provide you with a wonderful, cozy and unique place to stay and advice and feedback that you would expect from a friend.

If you need anything, we're always just a message away, so don't hesitate to reach out at any time!

name: Bright, cozy, central 1905 duplex, coffee/tea, W/D
description:
Welcome to your home-away-from-home! Centrally located and minutes from major highways and public transit, our duplex is the perfect launch pad to anything on your to-do list for your Cbus stay. Enjoy the newly renovated first floor with refinished original hardwoods and a bright, modern but cozy feel. Whether you are here for work, leisure, or necessity you will have a comfortable place to rest with some added amenities to enjoy at home as well.

The space
Self check in via key code at the front door. Street parking is usually available right in front of the house, but if not, is just steps away. The front porch has a bistro table for two and a cozy feel for outdoor drinks or dining.

On the first floor, you have a living room with Roku TV on which Netflix is available to you (please use the "Airbnb" profile) in addition to any of the Roku free channels. You may use your own login to any other paid apps but please remember to log off! The next room is
neighborhood_overview: This is a diverse and central area, walking distance or a brief drive away from historic neighborhoods Merion and German Village. We are conveniently right off of Parsons Ave, so you may experience some, though infrequent, noise filtering in off the main road. Since we are off of a major street, exercise basic precautions such as locking your car and bringing valuables inside with you. We have never had safety issues for our house, and our neighbors watch out for each other, but it does not hurt to be prudent in a semi-urban area!
host_about:
I’m a pediatric genetic counselor and love my work, as well as seeing new cities from a local’s perspective through Airbnb traveling. I’ve started hosting in 2019 and it’s been such fun putting our place together for guests and meeting folks from all over. It’s been especially fulfilling to host families traveling for their child’s care at the hospital where I work. 

I speak French and love learning about different languages and cultures. I enjoy reading, writing, jigsaw and crossword puzzles, and a nice cup of coffee (or 3) in the morning. 

My husband, Jacob, and my cat, Pearl, are my crew. 


*views expressed here are my own and not those of my institution*

name: Cozy, clean, and quiet; easy access to everything!
description:
Unassuming, cozy, and clean cottage in quiet neighborhood north of downtown in the Clintonville/Beechwold/Worthington area. It's a short drive to most area attractions: OSU campus, Short North, Columbus Zoo, Arena District, American Girl and Legoland, IKEA, Ohio State Fairgrounds, and more. Also convenient to the Olentangy Bike trail and COTA bus service.

It's a perfect home base within easy reach of the best of Columbus!

The space
The house and garage are fully available for your use. Be advised that it is small - just under 900 s.f.

Parking is on site or on street.

Access: Via keyless deadbolt on the front door.

Living room: Includes a pull-out full-size sofa and smart TV.

Kitchen: Electric oven, refrigerator, microwave, Keurig and drip coffee makers. All the essentials- table ware, cooking utensils, etc.

Bath: Full bath contains tub/shower.

Bedrooms: One bedroom with a queen
neighborhood_overview:
You'll be staying in the Sharon Heights neighborhood - which is in Sharon Township, a very clean and quiet community, full of friendly residents who will probably smile and wave if you pass them.

You will conveniently be just north of a shopping area that contains a large Target (with Starbucks) and Kroger (grocery) stores, and several fast food locations (Noodles & Co., BIBIBOP, Bob Evans, Raising Canes, and more!)

Within walking distance, just up on the main street (High Street, which runs north thru Worthington into Delaware and south thru the Ohio State Campus and into downtown), you can catch several bus lines. There are also great Greek, BBQ, and Vietnamese restaurants in that area of High Street.
host_about: My husband Earl and I find ourselves with more time to explore places we've never been now that our two kids are (mostly) on their own.  Our travels and experiences have lead us to try hosting, too.  We've had great AirBNB experiences and strive to be the kind of hosts (when hosting) and guests (when traveling) that you are hoping for!

description:
Make yourself at home at this beautiful 3-story, 10 bedroom / 4 bathroom duplex that can host 26 guests. Modernly updated, creatively designed, each 5-bed/2-bath side has its own private entrance, a living room and kitchen.

The house is tastefully designed with two large living rooms and two amazing kitchens that will seat nearly your entire group.

Every bedroom is unique and features high end furniture and a comfortable mattress that will make you feel like you're sleeping in a luxury hotel.

The space
Welcome to your home away from home!

This beautiful, tastefully updated home will be perfect for your group's time in Columbus. The house includes:

- Kitchen: Enjoy complementary snacks, drinks, as well as premium coffee and tea in the kitchen. It also features a stove, over, stainless steel refrigerator, microwave, toaster, Keurig K-Cup coffee machine and is fully stocked with pots, pans, utensils, and paper towels. The
neighborhood_overview: You've picked the perfect neighborhood to stay in. It has the best of both worlds - it's just minutes away from The Ohio State University, from downtown, from Short North, the stadiums and a ton of great restaurants and eateries. At the same time, it's on a quiet street, so you can get away from the hustle and bustle and just relax when you come home. You'll love staying here!
host_about:
Hello hello!

We are Igor, Boris and Susan - friends that are happy to open up our home to host you and your group in the wonderful city of Columbus. 

A few words about us:

Igor is a financial analyst that has been working in the industry for nearly a decade.

Boris and Susan are a young, professional couple originally from Lithuania and China. 

We all love to travel ourselves and try to stay at Airbnb wherever we go. 

Between all of us, we've been to probably over a 100 Airbnbs over the years and have seen a range from unbelievably beautiful ones to the not-so-good ones.

We wanted to share this house with Airbnb guests as a way to pay back the incredibly hospitality and experiences we've encountered ourselves during our travels. We know what it's like to come to a new place for the first time, especially if you have a group of people with you, and our goal is to provide you with a wonderful, cozy and unique place to stay and advice and feedback that you would expect from a friend.

If you need anything, we're always just a message away, so don't hesitate to reach out at any time!

name: Quaint gem 2 bed heart of a vibrant hip community
description:
Decor is a warm toned shabby chic/--but leaning away from overtly 'pretty'. Leather chaise-longe couch, laminate/hardwood flooring. Round dining table in muted distressed brown/grey, with mismatched suede dining seats. Kitchen is brand new, in brown with reddish tones. Two bedrooms available. One has Full bed, the other, Cali King. New Bathroom. Lots of people walk to parks, restaurants, and community events in this charming village vibe, that supports local retailers.

License number
2019-2592
neighborhood_overview: Close walk to Schiller Park--a dog lovers dream. Very big community vibe. A plethora of truly great restaurants from $--$$$. A couple of favorites are Lindeys/Barcelona/German Village coffee shop (unbelievable character and super cheap!). Visit the book loft, St Marys newly renovated Church, and the wine shop on 3rd.
host_about: Enigmatic and intrepid traveller. Citizen of 3 Countries. Delights in learning about others journeys, interests, hobbies. Enjoying the explosion of great eateries and craft breweries in Columbus. I have travelled extensively world-wide, with two of my favorite experiences being a 7 day sailing holiday throughout the Greek Islands, and walking the el' Camino de Santiago. I have several beloved authors, two of which are Ken Follet, and Bryce Courtney. I have a wide assortment of friends of differing ages and backgrounds. I am a dog lover, but don't have one at this minute. I've run 5 marathons, and aspire to qualify for Boston. You will be welcomed with conversation, or space, as you desire.

description:
Enjoy this beautifully decorated 1,300 Sq. Ft. Home in Clintonville. The space is perfect for couples, friends or family to spread out relax and enjoy their time together. We have thoughtfully curated the house with all the amenities you could need. *We allow dogs - for a flat fee of $75. Notify us at booking.*

EARLY CHECK-IN/LATE CHECK-OUT: If you do need an early check-in or check-out please let us know at booking or as soon as possible. There is a fee of $10 for every extra hour needed.

The space
Spend your morning sipping coffee on the back deck enjoying the fenced in back yard. Relax on the big comfy couch in the livingroom watching TV, DVDs, or playing boardgames.

Enjoy cooking in the fully stocked kitchen complete with pots, pans, dishes, silverware, mixer, immersion blender, dishwasher, electric range, a coffee pot, electric kettle, coffee, and tea. The dining room has a table the sits 6.

name: Spacious Carriage House - Historic Olde Towne East
description:
Our standalone Carriage House is located in Olde Towne East, one of Columbus' Oldest Historic Neighborhoods. We are walking distance to great restaurants/bars, local coffee shops, breweries, and a short ride/UBER to OSU, Convention Center, Short North, downtown and German Village. Free street parking. You will have 1100 sq/ft of living space between 2 floors, with 2 Bedrooms, Living room, full Kitchen, bathroom with tub and shower, dining area.

The space
We are so close to downtown but a bit of an oasis. Easy parking right on the street out front. We are close to Ohio State University for games and events or a short trip to the convention center, Franklin Park or Nationwide Arena. You will have space to relax in the living area or bust out the pots/pans to enjoy a meal in the full kitchen. Super fast WiFi/internet (500mb) for catching up on work if you need to. Also stream your favorite shows over the WiFi or Apple TV.

Guest access
Ac
neighborhood_overview: This part of Columbus is close to downtown, but not too close!  You can walk to Franklin Park and some other great eateries nearby.  The neighborhood is pretty quiet at night so It’s a great place to hang out.  If you have the time, ask your hosts about some wood to kick up the fire pit right outside.  Come in for a night or two and then stay the week!!
host_about: Retired mom of two adult children.  Love our city and am excited to host visitors in the Carriage House!

On the third floor are one (1) huge bedroom and one (1) full

The area was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1997. The name Glen Echo refers to Glen Echo Ravine, which runs along the northern edge of the neighborhood.

name: Housepitality ~ Franklinton Manor - Spacious!
description:
Your group will find plenty of space, and something for everyone at our spacious house The Franklinton Manor. In the heart of Franklinton, this house is in the perfect location to easily access Downtown Columbus (5 min drive), OSU (12 min drive), or any other part of Columbus area. After a long day of exploring Columbus, share a meal with your group in the kitchen dinning room, or enjoy a movie in the living room. The fenced yard makes this perfect to bring your furry friends along!

The space
First floor or our house is complete with spacious living room, game room, quiet room, and a dinning room/kitchen combo room. The kids (at heart) will love the foosball table, and game collection. The quiet room is great for reading/meditation! 3 spacious bedrooms upstairs with 1 king, and 2 queen beds (all memory foam mattresses!). Large back deck and fenced yard!

The Franklinton Manor is great for:
~ Larger groups or families traveling and exploring Columb
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood Franklinton is situated just west of Downtown Columbus, and is full of historic homes. This neighborhood has experienced many phases through out it's existence, and is currently in a revitalization phase. There are lots of properties being renovated, and some that still remain boarded and empty. This area has experienced some crime in the past, but has improved in recent years.

Franklinton has experienced several great floods in the past, and has been somewhat neglected throughout the middle to late part of the 1900's. The Franklinton Floodwall, completed in 2004, is 7 miles long, cost $134 million. The wall's completion has released the area from being considered a floodplain, as well as releasing the previous building restrictions that often prevented development in the past. As a result, commercial and industrial activities are starting to grow in the Franklinton Area.

The City of Columbus is focusing on creating a new Short North style neigh
host_about: I continue to be excited about Airbnb and home-sharing every day! I enjoy hosting guests, I LOVE to travel, and I really love meeting new people. wifi access is provided because we all stay connected - we expect you to not engage in any illegal activities. :-)

host_about:
Hi! My name is Kyle. My wife, Anna, and myself got married in the end of 2016. With all of our families living out of state/country, we have grown accustomed to having others staying with us over, and so finished our basement to allow others to use our space.

I grew up some in Florida and the remainder of my life here in Ohio, whole Anna spent almost her entire childhood overseas in Thailand and traveled quite a bit, so you will be able to see our love of travel when you stay here.

We have two cats, Zeke and Chloe, who are brother and sister that we rescued as kittens. They LOVE people, though sometimes play hard-to-get.

We are open books, so please do not hesitate to ask anything and everything!

neighborhood_overview: The Short North is a historic neighborhood centered on the main strip of High Street, just north of downtown Columbus. It can be described as colorful and trendy, with many art galleries, pubs, nightclubs, coffee houses, and specialty shops.
host_about:
Hello!

My name is Mitchell, and I have lived in Columbus my whole life.  I am a graduate of Ohio State's Fisher College of Business, and have worked for several local Columbus businesses.  In my free time, you might find me playing guitar or rooting on the Buckeyes and Blue Jackets.

name: Modern & Comfortable Home Near Downtown Columbus
description:
Welcome to Columbus! My home features a modern, stylish, and open concept style living space that was built a few years ago in the Franklinton neighborhood. Centrally located, the house is just a mile and a half from downtown. The thriving Franklinton Arts District is a little less than a mile away featuring breweries, galleries, and restaurants. There's also a small market within a few blocks and groceries/pharmacy in the area.

The space
The house was built three years ago and is a rare find for the area. The first house built by local architect, Jeremy A. Miller, 614 Magazine had this to say:

"(Miller's) new Franklinton home is just how he wants it: simple, open, spacious, and minimal, with high windows, higher ceilings, offering up tons of natural light. Standing atop the modish hardwood floors in the upstairs loft, you have ample view of the whole house—a kitchen dominated floor plan complete with stylized cement floors, all wrapped neatly inside
neighborhood_overview:
Franklinton is one of the hottest up and coming neighbourhoods in Columbus. The thriving East Franklinton neighbourhood, which has breweries, bars, several food options, art galleries, etc., is located about a mile away. There is a coffee shop and diner within a few blocks to help get your day started, and a small market for produce and essentials.

Overall, I have felt very safe in Franklinton. The neighbors on Cypress are great and look out for each other. However, please note this is a city neighborhood near downtown Columbus. Precaution should be taken at night and valuables should not be left in your vehicle. If you are not comfortable with this, I would not recommend staying here.
host_about: 30 something musician who travels around the country performing.

host_about: We love seeing new places, experiencing the culture and meeting new people. The space

neighborhood_overview: Our place is in one of the BEST area's of Columbus,Ohio. The German Village- Merion Village area is a historic Columbus community and is known for gorgeous brick streets and architecture. Historic restaurants and bars are prominent within the area and are easily accessibly from our place. There is so much to see and do and most of the area is pedestrian friendly.  Most of our favorite eateries are within a 10-15 walk or 5 minute drive including Barcelona, Brown Bag Deli, G. Michaels, Lindeys, Katzingers Deli, Pistachio Vera, The Skillet, Sycamore Cafe, Harvest Pizza and many more.      Schiller Park is the second oldest park in the City of Columbus and it is only a 5 minute walk from our place. The park is a well-kept central location of German Village life. The recreation center, picnic areas, softball diamonds, fishing pond and stage for the Actor's Summer Theater, not to mention the beautifully landscaped gardens, make Schiller Park the jewel of German Village. name: Housepitality ~ Lincoln Lodge II (Near Downtown!)
description:
The Lincoln Lodge II is a beautiful place for your group to stay in Columbus. Just less than 10 min from downtown, and located close to the best spots in Columbus. Our spacious condo has 4 bedrooms, 2 and 1/2 bathrooms, and is completely renovated in a beautiful modern style.

The Lincoln Lodge II is great for:
~ Larger groups or families traveling and exploring Columbus together
~ Business travelers
~ Conventions or events in Downtown Columbus
~ Sports events at OSU or in Columbus

The space
Our condo has 3 bedrooms with queen beds, and one bedroom with a single. Our kitchen is fully stocked with everything needed to cook a meal. Our back yard is fenced in. Your pets we are welcome!

Guest access
Guest will have access to the entire 4 BR townhouse.

Other things to note
This listing is for the right side of this duplex property.

License number
2019-2777
neighborhood_overview: The King-Lincoln, and Near East Side neighborhood is a thriving part of Columbus. It has many new restaurants and shops opening often and is just a few minutes drives to the best parts of Columbus. This area has a rich history of being a hub for arts and culture in Columbus. King- Lincoln is a historically African American neighborhood in Columbus, Ohio, and the site of considerable revitalization and renovation projects on behalf of the city. Originally known as Bronzeville by the residents of the community, it has been rebranded as the King-Lincoln District by Mayor Michael B. Coleman's administration in hopes of revitalizing and highlighting the historical significance of the district. The district aims to embrace its namesakes of the historic Lincoln Theatre and King Arts Complex.
host_about: I continue to be excited about Airbnb and home-sharing every day! I enjoy hosting guests, I LOVE to travel, and I really love meeting new people. I am a real estate broker that owns my own business, and I feel that my calling in life is to making spaces for people to enjoy. 5 things I can't live without are live music, friends, exploring new places, bacon, my drum set!

name: Close to OSU - Clintonville Homestay
description:
The room is on the 3rd floor of a three story house. There is a full kitchen and bath on the 2nd floor as well as a common area. There is a private entry in back but you can also you the front or side doors. Washer and dryer are in the basement. We are a 5 minute walk from a bus stop on High Street. This bus is regular (#2) and goes to Ohio State. The ride is 10-15 minutes. The house is very close to the Olentangy bike path. Ohio State University is about a 15 minute bike ride. 日本語 ok!

The space
We have a lot of experience with college students staying with us. Our students have come from Japan, China, Indonesia, Libya, Saudi Arabia, Brazil, Kuwait and the U.S. We speak Japanese and English in the house. Notes: we do have a cat that lives with us and no overnight house guests allowed.

Guest access
Access is available to all areas other than other person's bedrooms.

Other things to note
$300 deposit and first month re
neighborhood_overview: We are about 1 mile north of Ohio State University. We live in Clintonville area of Columbus. Grocery stores, restaurants, gym, yoga studios, coffee shops are all within a 15 minute walk from the house.
host_about: My wife and I are explorers (see the book Why Him, Why Her by Helen Fischer) and love to travel. We are not "stay in hotel, go to resorts" type of people. We love to meet others and get to know the countries we go to as much as possible. We hike, back pack, camp, try different foods, travel to different countries and so much more. We both speak Japanese and English. Akiko does speak some French. We have both been to over 35 different countries. What we like most is to take our children so they can gain new experiences and insights.

name: Housepitality ~ The Lilley Pad (Near Downtown!)
description:
Welcome to The Lilley Pad - Columbus. This bright, clean, oasis is a wonderful place to stay on your visit to Columbus. Located just 10 min east of downtown Columbus, this beautifully renovated house is the perfect spot for your family or group to stay. 3 Bedrooms, and 1.5 bathrooms are perfectly designed for your comfort. The open kitchen/dinning room and living space is the perfect space for a family meal, or gathering together.

The space
Our house The Lilley Pad is a 3 Bedroom 2 Bathroom home that has been completely renovated to be the perfect place to stay for your family or group while in Columbus. Our open kitchen and living space is the perfect spot for catching up while preparing a delicious group dinner. The living room is a good spot to relax to Netflix after a long day. The upstairs has 3 bedrooms, 2 large and one small. Enjoy a beautiful shower/tub and bathroom on the 2nd level. Our fenced in back yard is the perfect spot for Spot to run!
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is one that is in transition. Several properties around our house have been neglected for years, and many have been torn down. Many are now being re-built. We love being part of the improvement happening to a neglected property, and we enjoy our neighbors in the South of Main neighborhood. If you, or a guest member is one that does not feel comfortable in a neighborhood that has some run-down buildings, but is full of smiling faces, then consider booking a different house for your trip.

I am a real estate broker that owns my own business, and I feel that my calling in life is to making spaces for people to enjoy. 5 things I can't live without are live music, friends, exploring new places, bacon, my drum set!

Perfect location for someone coming to Columbus. Near airport (10 min drive) and less than 15 min from downtown. Limited street parking.

Two bedrooms and full bath up with one bedroom and full bath in the basement. Living area, kitchen and dining area on main level.

neighborhood_overview: Bexley is a really special place. Main Street has a number of interesting shops and a TON of eateries. Catch an independent film at the Drexel Theater and stop into Graeter's, Ohio's world-class ice cream shop, a stone's throw away (Bexley also has Johnson's :) ). There are always events at the Capital University front lawn - see if there is anything happening while you are in town!

name: Heart of Columbus | Open Concept | Close to OSU Football Games +Campus
description:
The perfect landing spot in the heart of Columbus' Short North. An upscale space with comfortable furniture, king bed, Wi-Fi, 65” smart TV, fully stocked kitchen & bath.
Within a half mile WALK you can find restaurants, breweries, shopping, coffee, and more. Entertainment, the Columbus Convention Center, The Ohio State University, the Blue Jackets' Hockey Arena, & major hospitals are less than 10 minutes away by car!
Come and enjoy the condo’s luxuries and all that Columbus has to offer!

The space
The entire condo is yours!! Beautiful hardwood floors throughout. The bedroom has a huge closet, natural light, a pillow top king mattress, fresh and clean linens, plenty of blankets, and a dresser. The kitchen is fully functional it just requires groceries. You'll find an oven/stove top, refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave, a stocked coffee station, basic spices/oils, and holdover snacks! The bathroom is clean and bright and provides towels/wash
neighborhood_overview: Its the Short North Baby!!!  Right in the middle of all Columbus has to offer and in walking distance of coffee, restaurants, entertainment, and shopping!  At this time everything in The Short North is open.  Our local businesses have put extra cleaning procedures in place and have revamped their spaces to allow for social distancing.  If you have decided that you are not going into stores and buildings unless absolutely necessary The Short North has outdoor art, parks, and patio seating for you to enjoy!  There are even sidewalk kiosks where you can get your picture taken!!!
host_about: I. Love. Houses and Hosting! I’ve been an Airbnb host since 2013 when I used to live in New York City. I moved to Columbus, Ohio to restore homes and Host travelers full time in 2018. Rest assured our listings are put together with thought and care. Cleanliness and your comfort are our top priority. You'll love our spaces!

name: Quaint Townhouse in Merion Village #2
description:
Comfortable living space in historic Merion Village, with 800 sqft it's the perfect get away for two. Within walking distance to several bars and Schiller Park. A 10-12 minute drive to Downtown, Brewery District, Arena District, Short North, and The Ohio State University. - 19 minute drive to the main airport - 13 minute drive to the Convention Center Located just around the corner from the bus stop. There is a Kroger and a CVS available for groceries.

The space
This is an older home dating back to the 1920s. Ceilings are tall, rooms are quaint, stairs are steep. Please respect the dated property, and enjoy it's character.

There is no garbage disposal in the kitchen sink, please dispose of food in trash.

New HVAC has been installed, temperature should be acceptable as set.

Plumbing is fragile given the age of the home. Please do not flush anything other than toilette paper.

Guest access
Guests can a
neighborhood_overview: Merion Village is just south of German Village, which is home to many bars and restaurants. Schiller Park is a nice visit, especially during the summer days when they show Shakespeare in the Park.
host_about:
I'm hosting on Airbnb because I no longer live in half of my duplex property, and I enjoy sharing it's charming space with visitors looking to be just outside of downtown Columbus.  I enjoy all kinds of art, music, dance and food.  Wine, shoes, and dessert are my weaknesses.  I love traveling of all kinds, short road trips or long vacations. I hope my guests enjoy the passion and warmth I've put into my century old property. Thanks for your inquiry!

Throughout my busy days, I enjoy taking a moment to breathe in the world, and no matter how stressful or challenging life can become, I always find time to admire how huge and beautiful life is around me, and my challenges don't seem as extreme anymore.

name: Housepitality ~ The Orange-Door- Clean!
description:
It's always sunny at The Sunshine House! Relax and unwind on your trip to Columbus, with a stay at the Orange Door apartment. This bright, 2 bedroom townhouse has 2 bedrooms (1 King, 1 Queen) with great memory foam mattresses, has lots of space to spread out. The entire house has recently been renovated, and is fresh from head to toe. The back contains parking for 2 cars, and a mostly fenced in yard. Located in the heard of Franklinton, it is a quick ride to Downtown Columbus.

The space
Step in to a clean updated space, with all the amenities of home. Living room with TV and seating. Dinning room for a meal, and a kitchen stocked and ready to cook.

Upstairs you will find 2 bedrooms one with a king, and one with a queen bed. Our brand new bathroom has a nice shower and tub combination. Your dog will love our fenced back yard. There are 2 parking spaces behind the fenced yard off of the alley.

License number
2019-2287
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood Franklinton is situated just west of Downtown Columbus, and is full of historic homes. This neighborhood has experienced many phases through out it's existence, and is currently in a revitalization phase. There are lots of properties being renovated, and some that still remain boarded and empty. This area has experienced some crime in the past, but has improved in recent years.

Franklinton has experienced several great floods in the past, and has been somewhat neglected throughout the middle to late part of the 1900's. The Franklinton Floodwall, completed in 2004, is 7 miles long, cost $134 million. The wall's completion has released the area from being considered a floodplain, as well as releasing the previous building restrictions that often prevented development in the past. As a result, commercial and industrial activities are starting to grow in the Franklinton Area.

The City of Columbus is focusing on creating a new Short North style neigh
host_about: I continue to be excited about Airbnb and home-sharing every day! I enjoy hosting guests, I LOVE to travel, and I really love meeting new people. I am a real estate broker that owns my own business, and I feel that my calling in life is to making spaces for people to enjoy. 5 things I can't live without are live music, friends, exploring new places, bacon, my drum set!

description:
Enjoy our two story, three bedroom home with close proximity to downtown Columbus! The home is located in the Southern Orchards Area, please note that although the home is nearby to all of the benefits in the German Village, it is located in a transitional neighborhood. The house is just a two minute drive from Nationwide Children's Hospital.

The space
A two-story home that is comfortable and spacious. Centralized, but tucked away, this place is ideal for any type of guest! Located just a few blocks away from Nationwide Children's Hospital. There are a variety of local restaurants such as Barcelona, The Crest, Skillet, Lindey's, The Sycamore, The Brown Bag Deli, Scambler Marie's, Panera, and Tim Horton's. Everything in the house is in like-new condition.

Other things to note
-We are a pet friendly home. Please count your animals as guests when booking. (Example: husband, wife and 2 golden retrievers would book for 4 adults)
-There is
neighborhood_overview: Please note that while we are a couple blocks from German Village and half a million dollar homes, this is an up-and-coming neighborhood. It is in the process of being revitalized, but that type of work takes years. Nationwide Children's Hospital has improved it tremendously in the time we have been here, but is still a little rough around the edges. There are neighbors that are holding out for higher property offers, leaving their buildings boarded in the meantime.

With great restaurants, bars, shopping, entertainment, and much more, it's a great destination for any guest visiting the city. The apartment has many features making it a comfortable stay, including: tall ceilings, hard surface flooring, open and spacious first floor, large bathroom with over-sized shower, etc.

The space

neighborhood_overview: Just a few blocks from High Street, there are too many good restaurants to name here!  You're welcome to message me for some good spots though! Sports teams around are the Buckeyes (hopefully you are aware - if it's fall, it won't take long to figure that one out), Blue Jackets (pro hockey), Columbus Crew (pro soccer), and Columbus Clippers (AAA Baseball).  Enjoy your trip!
host_about: I visit other places whenever possible!  If there's good food, genuine people, and some music, I'll have fun. You’ll love it because we are just steps away from Ohio State, the Horseshoe, Nationwide Arena, Express Live, the Short North, MAPFRE Stadium, and downtown, and our home has the historic charm of the late 1800s!

Enjoy our warm, charming home as you explore the best of Columbus. Read on to learn more…..

The space
Our 3 bedroom home is family/group friendly. Our house has the charm of a home built in 1870 but the modern touch of new renovations. The aesthetic is clean, cozy, and simple and you will find it the perfect place for you and your loved ones during your stay in Columbus!

+Schottenstein Arena
+Newport Concert Hall
+The James
+Wexner Medical Center

Additionally, there are countless unique and entertaining bars and restaurants steps away in the Short North. There is a market a few doors down as well as neighborhood bar (known for its open mic night!). There is a Kroger grocery store less than 1/2 mile away.

We are easily accessible from I-70, I-71, 315 and 670.
host_about:
Hi and welcome to Columbus! Through Airbnb, I’ve had the pleasure of hosting people from all over the world looking to stay in a comfortable, clean, private space in the heart of the city!  Because of our location, I have welcomed people on OSU football weekends, for Blue Jackets games and music festivals, some visiting relatives, many Ohio State Buckeyes, med students, business travelers, couples on weekend getaways, those attending conferences at the convention center and others looking to relocate to Columbus.  

I love hosting through Airbnb and hope thoroughly enjoy your stay!

name: Sparkling 3BR/Remodeled/Walk to Campus+Short North
description:
Visit kids. Catch a game. Reunite with friends. Welcome to our roomy 3 bedroom house on a quiet, tree-lined street — just two blocks from the hustle and bustle of the Short North and a 10 walk to campus.

Recently remodeled kitchen w/new appliances and exposed brick. 3 large bedrooms come with crisp bedding and plenty of storage for your stay.

The whole house is smart with Nest, Roku, Sonos and Alexas for your comfort + entertainment. And use our huge yard w/parking for pregame BBQ and hang.

The space
We have a lot of records. So feel free to play them. Also, the side yard is unique for Columbus, so please use it. And we are a music house so play music on our Sonos (at a reasonable volume as to not disturb the neighbors) and wake up with the an Alexa alarm and Sirius XM. And feel free to program the Nest to your exact comfort.

Guest access
We have a washer and dryer downstairs. When you are down there, you will
neighborhood_overview: We are two blocks away from all the restaurants and shops and bars of the Short North.  Just close enough to stumble home but far enough to not get caught up in it.

River really likes plants, so you are free to water them.

name: The Music Box - Comfy, Clean and Centrally Located
description:
Welcome to The Music Box! This adorable mid-century modern upstairs flat is centrally located to all the sweet spots in Columbus and is a comfortable spot for a short weekend or a long-term stay.

Due to COVID-19, we are taking extra care while cleaning The Music Box. We are following the insights and guidelines of the Centers for Disease and Prevention (CDC) listed here: https://www.airbnb.com/resources/hosting-homes/a/cleaning-guidelines-for-preventing-the-spread-of-covid-19-163.

The space
This 2 bedroom, 1 bath, 800 sq ft upstairs flat features local Columbus music (we provide a record player and local records!) and local art on the walls. There is a master suite with a dreamy king bed, a second bedroom with comfy queen bed, a large, fully-stocked kitchen and 2 balconies (one private balcony facing the front yard and one facing the large, fenced-in backyard with gas grill and cute patio furniture). This flat comfortably sleeps 3-4, but will sleep u
neighborhood_overview:
The Old North is centrally located between OSU campus and Clintonville. Old North is a special place with an eclectic, funky vibe. We moved to this neighborhood after playing many shows at Rambling House and getting to know many of the local residents. We are thrilled to call this neighborhood home and we can't wait for you to explore some of the recommendations you will find in our guidebook.

This is not a pretentious neighborhood by any means and is currently in a revitalization phase. We have been here for 1.5 years and have experienced no crime or safety issues. Our neighborhood is filled with families, children, grad students, musicians and artists and all of our guests have enjoyed the convenience of the location of The Music Box, but if you are looking for a posh neighborhood with upscale shops and boutiques, this is probably not the right listing for you and we would be happy to point you in the right direction. :)
host_about:
I love traveling and meeting new people, so I am excited to finally become an AirBnb host myself so that I can tell my guests all the great things that Columbus has to offer including live music, food, beautiful parks, sports, kid-friendly entertainment and nightlife.

I live in the Old North which is a unique, charming neighborhood in the heart of the city and I look forward to hosting your next trip!

The Short North has it all - from great events in Goodale Park and at the Convention Center, to restaurants, bars, coffee shops, galleries, and local shops. This apartment puts you in the heart of the neighborhood.

host_about:
I dig psychology, gardening, cycling, being a gym rat, and cooking. I have volunteered at a kids camp every summer since 1999 that teaches critical thinking and a love for nature. 

I have lived in Columbus most of my life and I love it here and I love sharing it with other people.  I'm a licensed Ohio real estate sales person.

My career in the non-profit sector has let me travel all over the country. I love the Bay Area, NYC, Washington state, and the Rockies.

name: House of M.U.S.I.C
description:
Welcome to the "House of M.U.S.I.C", our Themed BNB!

Upon entry, you walk directly into the House of BLUES, literally (Living Room). See what is NOW PLAYING at any time.

Through the corridor, our ROCK N ROLL Kitchen features Jimmy Hendrix, Beatles & many more artist!

BOB MARLEY brings you Reggae Vibes (Half Bathroom).

Up the stairs you will find CLASSICAL (King Bedroom - R) & POP (Queen/Twin Bedroom - L).

The Full bathroom, our tribute to PRINCE..."When Doves Cry".

The space
The uniqueness of this Themed-BNB is that it caters to all humans... Let's face it, who doesn't like Music?

We are within walking, skipping, scootering, riding, hovering, LYFTing distance from:
▪︎NATIONWIDE CHILDREN'S HOSPITAL (2 blocks)
▪︎PANERA (6 blocks)
▪︎CVS (6 blocks)
▪︎SCRAMBLERS - breakfast (8 blocks)
▪︎Downtown (right on the cusp)
▪︎COSI Science Museum (< 3 Miles)
▪︎Library
neighborhood_overview:
Being so close to Downtown but far enough from the City Traffic makes this Up & Coming area an ideal stay. The city is pouring into satellite areas like ours to re-bridge/reconnect Columbus as a whole.

Being within walking, skipping, scootering, riding, hovering, LYFTing distance from most places makes it easy to go vehicle-less.

Having #NationwideChildrensHospital ONLY 2 blocks away makes this AIRBNB ideal for traveling #Nurses , #Doctors , #Patients & Family Visitors.

name: Shellee's Place
description:
Stay in the absolute centre of the King Arts District when you book this freshly renovated, artsy&bright condominium. Enjoy a show at the charming LincolnTheatre, a 582-seat performing arts venue. Experience the local culture with a quick trip to the Long Street Bridge and Cultural Wall. Savor a morning coffee at the Lincoln Cafe or evening cocktail at the world renowned Canabar just minutes from your door. Visit the King Arts Complex, an urban delight and sight of many historic celebrations.

The space
You'll be in the centre of it all. Shellee’s Place was recently renovated with contemporary finishes and creative touches that you’ll find comfortable, tranquil and attractive. Since I appreciate the culinary, the kitchen is thoughtfully equipped. A king size comfy bed in the bedroom, an queen size sleeper with a luxury air mattress and 2 firm twin daybeds for ultimate nightly comfort.

Guest access
You will have access to the whole space,
neighborhood_overview: The Lincoln Theatre, The King Arts Complex, Canabar, The Lincoln Cafe, Barriste LaFleur Galleria, Creole Kitchen, Franklin Park Conservatory, Equitas Health King Lincoln Pharmacy, the Ole Towne East and all its restaurants, downtown, the Short North and the Greater Columbus Convention Center just minutes away! Short drive to Easton Shopping Center and 7 minutes from airport.
host_about: I am enjoying sharing my Airbnb with guests. I'm a hostess at heart and want to make sure my guest have everything. I'm a creative, working as a photographer and creating floral images that you'll see throughout my home. I look forward to you coming and visit soon!

description:
2-Story home in the Victorian Village. Cable TV, fully stocked kitchen, off-street parking, jacuzzi tub. Both 2nd floor bedrooms have 2 queen mattresses and their own full bath. Downstairs has and updated kitchen w/ granite counter-tops. Living room has a large sectional, and a dining table. Backyard has 1 off-street parking spot.

NO HOUSE PARTIES

The space
2 bedrooms with 4 beds in total. 2nd floor bedrooms each have 2 queen mattress and their own full bath. Downstairs has and updated kitchen w/ granite counter-tops. Table in kitchen. Living room large sectional, additional sofa, and a dining table with 6 chairs. Backyard has 1 off-street parking spots.

License number
2019-3122
neighborhood_overview: In the Victorian Village Community. Across the street from the best breakfast/brunch food in Columbus, Katalinas.

name: The Short North Retreat III - Free Private Parking
description:
Enjoy everything the Short North and Columbus has to offer in this unique & cozy flat.

The 'Short North Retreat III' is located in the heart of the Short North, however, it is located on the back of the building so you are able to enjoy all the great activities without worrying about the noise!!!

You are treated to local art, unique comfortable decor as well as a dedicated parking spot (huge benefit given the area).

Whether for work or play, there is no better AirBnb in the Short North.

The space
The space offers plenty of space for 4 guests with a stylish comfortable couch ( West Elm queen sleeper sofa) + two cozy accent chairs, with curated decor from local Columbus shops, exposed brick walls, modern appliances + all the comforts you expect from a first class Airbnb including:

free private parking (1 space) coffee machine (Kuerig) + coffee pods, washer/dryer, cookware, linens, fast WiFi, 50" smart T.V.
neighborhood_overview: The Short North is the most vibrant neighborhood in Columbus, and this home is located in the heart of all the action. You are located right on high street which allows you to be seconds away from the best nightlife, restaurants and shopping that Columbus has to offer.

description:
This stunning room is located on the FIRST floor of this duplex. Our beautifully remodeled duplex has a total of 4 bedrooms and 2 baths. Incredibly close to MAPFRE stadium, Schottenstein Center, OSU, Convention Center, Downton Columbus, and so much more. Just north of us is beautiful Clintonville and Whetstone Park of Roses. Just south is vibrant OSU and Short North. Make this place your home away from home!

The space
The LAURIE room is located on the FIRST floor of the unit. Our unit has a total of 4 bedrooms and 2 baths.

First Floor: LAURIE Room
Second Floor: LEAH, LILY Room + 1 bath
Third Floor: LUCY Room + 1 bath

Each bedroom has its own lock for convenience and privacy. The common areas, such as the living room, kitchen, and bathrooms are shared with other guests.

Our beautiful kitchen is well-equipped with cooking and dining utensils for a comfortable stay. The Laundry Room is downstairs, in the basement with lau

This room, in a shared space, situated in an immaculate, snug, cozy home that is clean, updated and bright. Best suited for working professionals, it is in a central location and easily accessible to 70, 71, as well as 670. name: Home Away from Home In Quiet Neighborhood
description:
New memory foam mattresses await you in this ranch duplex located in a quiet, safe neighborhood. This home away from home nestled between Worthington & Clintonville is perfectly located to get you to anywhere in the city in less than 15 minutes. Features keyless entry, smart TV's, new furniture, fenced in backyard & off street parking for 2 cars. Sleep up to 6 comfortably. Public transportation is very close as well as highway access.

The space
Recently updated, it contains everything you need while you stay.

Living Room & Dining Space
- Freshly painted
- 55" Smart TV
- New sleeper sofa (Jan 2020)
- Kitchen table & chairs for 4

Kitchen
- Freshly painted
- Electric stove
- Microwave
- Toaster
- Keurig w/ coffee
- Basic pots & pans
- Place settings for up to 6
- Knife set & cutting board
- Wine key & bottle opener
- Salt, pepper, oil
- Basic cleaning supplies
neighborhood_overview: Beechwold has a very close-knit neighborhood vibe plus all of the advantages of living in a sprawling metropolis. Enjoy amazing local bars & restaurants in Clintonville and Worthington. Target, Starbucks, grocery store, and gym very close. Beechwold shares the Whetstone Park of Roses with Clintonville and is worth making a stop.
host_about: Marketing consultant and real estate investor. I travel frequently for both work and leisure. Usually to a busy city for a conference to represent my business, or to a quiet beach to decompress.

name: Housepitality - The Southern Orchards Cottage
description:
The Southern Orchards Cottage is the perfect spot stay for your extended stay while in Columbus. This small cozy home is stocked, furnished, and all utilities are included. It is well stocked and suited so you just need to bring your suitcase, but you can also bring your own stuff.

We are just a few minutes from downtown, and close to many new spots in Southern Orchards and German Village and Olde Towne East. Our house includes a fenced in back yard for you and your pets to enjoy!

The space
Our house is very clean, and recently updated. This small home is well suited for short term housing. It is furnished will all needed items. It is modern, and basic, with plenty of room for you to bring your items, and make it your home away from home!

Guest access
Guests will not have access to the garage.

Other things to note
Guests will not have access to the garage. Parking is available on the street in front of the

name: Anderson Estate- Near Downtown- Fast Wi-Fi
description:
Stunning Victorian home built in 1906 in the heart of Columbus's Olde Towne East - this property is the perfect combination of updated features and all the character and charm sought after in this area. This fully furnished home offers a relaxing living room, warm dining space, adorable kitchen and 1.5 French country style bathrooms. Equipped with a washer/dryer and dishwasher, it's the perfect setup for all types of travelers.

The space
The moment you walk into this house, you’re going to feel all the charm and wonder of times past. Each room displays incredible detail to the designs and discovery of what life would have felt like back then. You’ll find that the bedrooms and bathrooms are influenced by French and Victorian design. You may even find a hidden door in the home, just watch your head :). One unique fact about the home is that in 1908 the President of Ohio State University, William Oxley Thompson, officiated a wedding in the backyard of this property.
neighborhood_overview: Olde Towne East, as it is called today, was annexed into the city of Columbus in 1870. It had previously been an area of family operated farms and countryside stretching along the National Road, Main Street from Washington D.C. In 1882, trolley tracks were laid on Oak Street to Kelton Ave where the streetcar barn still stands, providing convenient transportation to the former location of the Ohio State Fairgrounds, (now Franklin Park Conservatory), and to downtown Columbus. Olde Towne East saw many of Columbus’s finest homes built within the area and much of that architectural legacy still exists today. There are more than a thousand uniquely styled homes in the Olde Towne East area, some built as early as 1830, representing over 50 unique architectural styles. During the late 19th and early 20th centuries, Olde Towne East represented some of the most popular American building styles spanning 100 years, which included: Federal, Italianate, Victorian, Queen Anne, Gothic Revival, Tudor.

A hybrid of urban flair and neighborhood warmth, Grandview’s vibes are at the same time laid-back and buzzing with energy. Stroll the wide, tree-lined sidewalks of Grandview Ave amid the hum of cafe-table chatter.

Discover specialized independent shops, curated New-York style boutiques, a chocolatier’s gorgeous handmade truffles, independent breweries, top-rated coffee roasters, cutting-edge salons, and of course, world-class restaurants that use fresh, locally-sourced ingredients. The electric mix of restaurants here have consistently been recognized by critics and diners alike for their cuisine, ambience, and outstanding attention to detail. Designer townhome with earthly, modern vibes throughout. Two private suites, each with their own en-suite bathroom - perfect for couples or small families. Located in the heart of quaint German Village, and steps to everything from coffee shops (including Starbucks), breweries, restaurants, parks, yoga & public transportation. Less than 1 mile to Downtown!

The space
A modern escape in the heart of German Village! Professionally designed & remodeled townhome with a light, airy aesthetic and natural textures throughout.

This listing is for one half of a remodeled two-unit duplex. This unit is two stories and about 1100 square feet. The first floor has a living room, dining room, kitchen and small powder room. A unique Y staircase leads up to the two newly remodeled private suites on the second floor.

The spacious King suite features a Tuft & Needle King memory foam bed, both down & down alternative pillows, a large bathroom with an overs
neighborhood_overview:
German Village is a vibrant place to stay, shop, and play. Walking the brick sidewalks, you'll discover a neighborhood full of urban gardens, beautiful historic homes built over 100 years ago, and carefully dispersed small businesses. As said on the German Village visitor's website, “What we have can't be replicated. We live this way — and protect it with great passion — because we understand that what we have is a neighborhood like no other." We couldn't agree more.

Schiller Park is a pleasant 8 minute walk from the property through some of the most charming streets in German Village, making it easy to go for a walk/run, have a picnic, bring the kids to the playground, and enjoy free performances of Shakespeare in the Park in the summertime. The park also has basketball courts and tennis courts.

Another one of our favorite parks is Scioto Audubon Metro Park, which is located .8 miles from the house. The park has a large rock climbing wall, walking paths (both
host_about: We’re husband & wife hosts, parents to 2 little girls, and small business owners in Columbus, OH. After living in NYC for several years, we decided to move to Columbus in search of a better quality of life — and we found it! We have been hosting since 2014 and have enjoyed sharing our homes with thousands of travelers from near & far. We find it incredibly rewarding to be a small part of our guests’ experience when they’re visiting our city.

We are a 5 minute drive to downtown and the Columbus Convention Center, 10 minutes to THE Ohio Stadium and Franklin Park Conservatory, 2.5 miles to Children's Nationwide Hospital and Ohio Health Grant Medical Center, and only 10 minutes to Nationwide Arena.

The neighborhood could be considered transitional. It is located in Merion Village but is close to the southern border of German Village. The apartment is located on a major road through Columbus. It is close to restaurants, bars, and shops.

The space
Step out from our brand new apartment building and you're just a short walk from all the best things about downtown Columbus!

neighborhood_overview:
This apartment is located in a new luxury community called River & Rich in downtown Columbus.

It’s nestled along the river, perfectly located to be close enough to the action for easy access, yet far enough away to enjoy peace, quiet, and easy parking. You'll love all the art and hand-painted murals.

The apartment is walkable to breweries, coffee shops, restaurants, and other attractions...many just a few steps from our door.

It's super easy to get anywhere downtown from our place...by car, bicycle, scooter, Uber/Lyft, walking, etc.

When we give people tours of our place, many of them end up saying they'd love to live here. :)
host_about: Hi there! My wife and I are the founders of Epicurean Properties; a small business based in Columbus, OH. name: Cozy Private Room with On-Suite Private Bathroom
description:
Welcome to our home! Our goal is to provide a home away from home to all our guests! Whether you're visiting OSU, here for a convention, or simply looking to get away, our place is an excellent choice. We are centrally located, just west of downtown in the "up and coming" Franklinton area. We're just a few blocks away from Mount Carmel Hospital and about 1.5 miles away from COSI and the Scioto Mile downtown!
We have two cats, Felix and Oliver, who you may see in common areas during your stay!

The space
This is a private bedroom on the second floor of our 3 story house. It is fully furnished with a queen bed, closet, plenty of shelving, and a private on-suite bathroom. This room has its own wall mounted heating and cooling unit that can be adjusted as needed during your stay.

Guest access
Guests have access to the first floor living and dining area. We highly encourage guests to utilize this space for eating, as food and beverages (besi
neighborhood_overview: Franklinton is an up and coming neighborhood that still has some rough spots (abandoned/boarded up houses) amongst newly renovated and very nice homes. Souder Ave. is a quiet walkable street that I have never felt unsafe on. However, knowing that everyone's comfort level is different, please take a look at google maps and the street views to make sure you are comfortable with the area before booking.
host_about:
I was born and raised in Oregon. I went to school at the University of Georgia where I graduated with an Engineering Degree and swam and competed for the university at the NCAA level all four years. 

I've lived and worked in Columbus since 2013. I currently work for AEP as a civil engineer and am also a real estate investor and Realtor part time. 

Columbus is a great City and I'm excited to be on Airbnb as a host. I look forward to welcoming you into this city as well as my home!

description:
The City Cottage is a bright and fresh space that provides the perfect space to stay while exploring Columbus! This house has been renovated and designed to be a great use of space, and provide everything needed for a short stay. Our historic guest house has a bedroom and full en-suite bathroom upstairs, and downstairs is and open kitchen/dinning/living space. Just a 5 minute drive to downtown Columbus, the City Cottage is tucked away in the exciting Franklinton arts district.

The City Cottage is a historic carriage house, that has been lovingly restored into a beautiful short term rental house. From the moment you enter, this bright space invites you in to stay a while.

The first floor has the perfect sized kitchen, complete with everything needed to prepare a delicious meal. is open to the living room, and also a dinning nook. There is a 1/2 bath on the first floor. Our living room has a sleeper couch.

Upstairs is a lovely bedroom and full bathroom.T
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood Franklinton is situated just west of Downtown Columbus, and is full of historic homes. This neighborhood has experienced many phases through out it's existence, and is currently in a revitalization phase. There are lots of properties being renovated, and some that still remain boarded and empty. This area has experienced some crime in the past, but has improved in recent years.

Franklinton has experienced several great floods in the past, and has been somewhat neglected throughout the middle to late part of the 1900's. The Franklinton Floodwall, completed in 2004, is 7 miles long, cost $134 million. The wall's completion has released the area from being considered a floodplain, as well as releasing the previous building restrictions that often prevented development in the past. As a result, commercial and industrial activities are starting to grow in the Franklinton Area.

name: Outdoor Space | Chef's Kitchen | Walkable to Restaurants and Shops
description:
Truly feel at home in this impeccably restored historic home nestled in the heart of Columbus' most exciting neighborhood: The Short North.

We have spared no expense offering blazing fast Wifi, the most comfortable beds, sofas, and linens. The master bath is an experience in itself!

Cook at home in our fully stocked kitchen or be steps away from Columbus' best restaurants!

Convention Center - 0.7mi
Nationwide Arena - 1.2mi
Ohio Stadium - 2.2mi
COSI - 3.3mi

The space
***We have a strict no pet policy. We have external cameras outside the home. Please do not bring your pet with you to our property.***

Our COVID-19 Sanitation cleaning procedure includes:

1. Washing our hands and wearing disposable sanitary gloves or rubber cleaning gloves
2. Our cleaning solutions are at least 70% alcohol
3. Cleaning only with disposable wipes. Using cotton or microfibre otherwise.
neighborhood_overview: Victorian Village is a historic neighborhood in Columbus. This property is walking distance from all the action happening on High Street, but far enough away to enjoy a quiet night in. This is the perfect home for all types of travelers and is the top neighborhood we recommend to friends, families, or anyone else visiting our amazing city.
host_about: I. Love. Houses and Hosting! I’ve been an Airbnb host since 2013 when I used to live in New York City. I moved to Columbus, Ohio to restore homes and Host travelers full time in 2018. Rest assured our listings are put together with thought and care. Cleanliness and your comfort are our top priority. You'll love our spaces!

name: 💎2BR/1BA w Tempur Pedic bed⭐️Backyard✔New Kitchen
description:
Don't miss this opportunity to experience a Tempur Pedic bed! This first floor unit of our duplex features two bedrooms and one bath. The first bedroom has a memory foam Tempur Pedic bed, vanity and tons of closet space. The second bedroom has lots of natural light and built in storage. Please note, the back door of the apartment opens into this room. Pets are welcome with a $10/night fee.

The convenient location is within walking distance to OSU's campus, COTA bus lines & Mapfre Stadium.

The space
Built in 1902, this downstairs unit of our duplex offers both character and modernity. Original built ins are in both bedrooms, but the kitchen is newly renovated with modern functionality and all essentials. You can utilize the patio and grill and relax around the fire pit in the shared fenced-in backyard. The Smart TV makes streaming easy, but we also provide an HDMI cord if you would prefer to stream directly from a laptop to the TV. Pets are welc
neighborhood_overview: The Old North neighborhood is one mile from Mapfre Stadium, two miles from Ohio State's campus, three miles from the short north and four miles from Downtown.  Bars within a 5 minute walk include the Rambling House and Rumba Cafe. Alternatively you can take a walk to the Glen Echo park, one of Columbus's most beautiful parks.  Clintonville restaurants and shops are just a half mile away as well.
host_about:
Hi! My name is Michael. I’m here to go above and beyond to ensure all our guests enjoy their stay and to provide the best quality customer service possible.

I’m blessed to call Columbus my home. I like to spend my free time with my wife and pets and enjoying what our beautiful city has to offer. We look forward to hosting you and providing you the best Airbnb experience.

name: Short North Kennels - ELVIS SUITE
description:
The BrewDog Kennels are our new, city center mini-hotels located above our BrewDog bars. Building on our award winning Doghouse hotel concept they give more people the chance to combine memorable hotel experience with amazing craft beers on their exploration.

The space
Check-in via our Short North bar and you'll find that all of our rooms are decked out in bespoke furnishings and a bevy of unexpected touches for all of our guests. Our rooms also feature all the necessary amenities for craft beer lovers including shower beer fridges, draft beer delivery and a record player. As always we are totally dog friendly and you can even request a dog bed so your furry friend can stay with you too! Please be advised that this property will require patrons to climb stairs to access the suites.

Other things to note
As part of state regulations, we are required to charge for the in-room beer and alcohol amenities up front. This fee has been integrated in
neighborhood_overview: Located on High Street, in the heart of Columbus, the BrewDog Kennels are ideally situated for travelers to explore the city and beyond. With BrewDog Short North just below, the city hotbed for nightlife and entertainment within minutes’ walk, the Kennels are the perfect launching point and end to a craft beer crawl. We have tons of amazing BrewDog experiences at your fingertips in a short drive as well, so don't miss out on booking in for a Beer School or in for a Brewery Tour at our state-of-the-art brewery just up the road in Canal Winchester or enjoy our rooftop patio at BrewDog Franklinton!

name: Standard Room - Full Service B&B
description:
Located on the edge of downtown in the Short North Arts District, 50 Lincoln Short North Bed and Breakfast is nestled in a quiet residential neighborhood setting.
Each of our seven rooms feature in-room private full bath, free Wi-Fi, and cable TV. We also include free off-street parking and a delicious homemade breakfast every morning. Breakfast includes juice, hot coffee or tea, fresh fruit, yogurt, granola, and a specially prepared entrée each day (all food allergies can be accommodated).

The space
Room 1 is located on the second floor and features a queen size bed, writing desk, and rocking chair. Two windows looking to the north and east provide plenty of natural light. This room also has a full in-room private bathroom complete with tub/shower combo and hairdryer.

Guest access
Guests are welcome to make themselves at home in any of the public areas including the main parlor and the back porch. We have a microwave and guest fridge
neighborhood_overview: 50 Lincoln is a one minute walk from blocks of trendy shops, fabulous restaurants, unique art galleries, and exciting night life. We are just a half mile from the Greater Columbus Convention Center, a mile from Nationwide Arena, and less than two miles to The Ohio State University campus. Enjoy a quick walk through the neighborhood, grab a COGO Bike Share a block from our front door, or jump on the free CBUS on High Street to get around.
host_about: We are a full service Bed and Breakfast located in the Short North area of Columbus, Ohio.

name: Modern Downtown Luxury Apartment
description:
This beautiful, 600 sq ft modern and open-floorplan studio apartment is conveniently located at Highpoint in downtown Columbus. This apartment is perfect for the people who are traveling and want to experience Columbus because the apartment is close to all the excitement that the city has to offer. This apartment is ideal for a couple or small groups to eat together, hang out, relax, explore the surrounding areas, chat and have fun.
⭐️FREE Parking (1 vehicle) & FREE wifi⭐️

The space
Our apartment will surely help you make your mark in this ever-developing city. We want you to live in optimal comfort as this apartment offers plenty of space and natural lighting.
You can explore the neighborhood that has countless favorite spots for dining and entertainment. The surrounding area is also known for community events and concerts. Just above the hustle and bustle of downtown Columbus, you will enjoy the modern high-rise lifestyle in this luxurious two-bed

name: Clintonville Community Home
description:
This charming yet eclectic home in an affluent, urban neighborhood supplies guests with easy access to entertainment all from within the confines of a quaint, family-friendly, neighborhood.

Two separate living areas allows families and groups alike to spread out and do their own thing when desired while the large rooms, formal dining room, and a private, fenced in back yard presents an opportunity for even large gatherings to be shared.

The space
This beautiful craftsman home offers your family or group a great place to spend time together! Downstairs offers 2 living rooms, formal dinning room, kitchen and half bathroom. Upstairs guest will find a large updated full bathroom with shower and tub., and 3 spacious bedrooms. 2 rooms each have a double bed, and the 3rd room is set up a an office/sitting area.

Our backyard is a fenced in beautiful play space for little ones, or furry friends!

Charming hardwood floors highlight the wa
neighborhood_overview:
This charming yet eclectic home in an affluent, urban neighborhood supplies guests with easy access to entertainment all from within the confines of a quaint, family-friendly, neighborhood. We love the Clintonville area in Columbus, and would be happy to assist you with any recommendations you should need during your visit.

Where to go? : One thing I love about this house is how close you are to the freeway and yet accessible by walking to some amazing spots in Clintonville such as:

Flowers and Bread - a unique local bakery/cafe that also does flower arranging classes!

Coffee: Flowers and Bread, or Starbucks just a few more blocks!

Restaurants: To many to list them all but we love Northstar Cafe, Hot Chicken Takeover, Rusty Bucket, and Local Cantina!

Other Activities: The Columbus Park of Roses - One of Columbus's largest metro parks, and a beautiful rose garden that is an icon of the area.

Don't miss the bike/walking
host_about: I continue to be excited about Airbnb and home-sharing every day! I enjoy hosting guests, I LOVE to travel, and I really love meeting new people. I am a real estate broker that owns my own business, and I feel that my calling in life is to making spaces for people to enjoy. 5 things I can't live without are live music, friends, exploring new places, bacon, my drum set!

description:
Short North dining & shopping, Convention Center, Nationwide Arena District, Goodale Park & North Market are all at your doorstep! Historic character meets modern style with whimsical decor, original wood floors & sunny private patio. High ceilings & tall west windows provide great light. Full kitchen, home office, HDTV, Wi-Fi, in-unit W/D. Queen bedroom + pull-out full-size sofa bed.

STRICTLY ENFORCED: NO SMOKING, NO PARTIES / EVENTS, AND NO PETS. See HOUSE RULES.

The space
Bright, open layout feels bigger than it is thanks to 10ft ceilings, huge windows and efficient design. Foyer entry has coat & laundry closets, full galley kitchen. Living room has sofa bed & lounge chair, HDTV, and home office desk. Bedroom has luxurious modern queen bed, attached full bath & closet. A motorized roller blind between the bedroom and living room provides privacy. Large sunny private patio off main living room gets great west sunlight.

Guest access
neighborhood_overview: This property is located in the base of the Short North Arts District, next to "The Cap", which connects the Arena District to the Short North. All manner of dining and entertainment venues are literally at your doorstep, as well as Goodale Park, which is great for a jog or relaxing next to the Lily Pond. The Convention Center is 1 block away; so is The North Market, a great place for lunch!

name: Comfy guest bedroom near Dublin, Worthington, OSU
description:
License number
2019-1483
host_about:
Howdy! I’m Jake. I’m originally from New York, and while I miss my friends and family back home (not to mention the beach!), I absolutely love my mid-west home here in Columbus, Ohio!
By day I’m a real estate investor and by night I’m a social butterfly with my friends. I'm also an Airbnb cohost where I mentor aspiring local hosts. I earned my Superhost status because I have high standards for value, cleanliness, and communication.
I enjoy travelling and creating new experiences. My favorite country is Guatemala. The people, the food and the historical sites are breathtaking. My favorite city is Chicago. Through these travels and coupled with my 14 years landlording, I’ve been fortunate to learn what makes a great host: a great home, with a friendly host, in an awesome neighborhood, and the ability to do the things you love! I try to ensure that each and every guest I host walks away with all of that and hopefully more.
My life motto is, well, really my grandmother’s advice, “Jakey, live with NO REGRETS” (I can hear her thick NYer accent now). Sometimes I guess we just need a little reminder of that… And so, I invite you to travel more and see the big, beautiful world we live in.

name: Private Southern Orchards Carriage House
description:
Our 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom carriage house offers a stylish and relaxing place to come back to after a fun day of exploring Columbus.

If you're looking for a unique piece of Columbus to take home with you, we partner with local artists to decorate the carriage house with Columbus themed art and prints and they are all available for purchase. Half of the proceeds are donated to Nationwide Children's Hospital while the other half goes back to the artists and photographers.

The space
This newly renovated carriage house offers a full kitchen, full bath, living room and dining/workspace on the first floor and the entire upstairs is a beautifully spacious bedroom with a queen memory foam bed and a couch that can lay down if you have an extra guest!

Enjoy the private, fenced in back yard as well as a gated, off-street and covered parking space so you know your vehicle is safe and secure! If grilling is your style, we have a charcoal grill available f
neighborhood_overview: Located right next to the historic German Village, staying at our Airbnb provides easy access to fantastic dining options like Barcelona, Lindey's, G. Michael's and many more. If coffee is what you're looking for, Community Grounds, Stauf's and Winans are right around the corner! There are some great cocktail bars, night life options and casual diners as well.
host_about: Hi there, we’re Aaron and Rachel Linder! We both are from northeastern Ohio, but have lived in Columbus for 10 years and absolutely love this city.

name: German Village Pied à Terre
description:
Hello and Welcome to the German Village Pied-à-Terre! The GV Pied-à-Terre is a quaint city cottage steps away from all German Village has to offer including Schiller Park!

The space
This unit offers eat in kitchen, comfy living room, first floor bathroom and two cottage style bedrooms on the 2nd floor.

* One designated parking spot located right outside the kitchen door on the South Side of the home. All other locations are subject to towing.
**Exterior cameras at each door entrance.

Guest access
Guests have access to entire home.

Other things to note
House is true German Village Cottage living. Steep staircase to 2nd floor, sloped ceilings, located on tight corner lot on narrow German Village streets. It’s all part of the charm of German Village!

* One designated parking spot located right outside the kitchen door on the South Side of the home. All other locations are subject to towing.
neighborhood_overview: Phenomenal location in the best and most historic neighborhood in Columbus! This home is steps from Schiller Park and all the cute shops and upscale restaurants German Village has to offer!
host_about:

neighborhood_overview: At the beginning of this century, people chose to live in Olde Towne East for social status. Today, the residents choose to live here for the unique styling of the houses and their appreciation of the diverse community. The varied cultural and racial backgrounds and economic levels that are present create a unique environment not found in any other Columbus neighborhood. Olde Towne East is a pedestrian-friendly neighborhood in a grid layout. The Columbus Metropolitan Library, The Columbus Museum of Art, Franklin University, Capital University Law School, and Columbus College of Art and Design are all within a 15 minute walk. The entire downtown of Columbus is easily accessible by bicycle or public transportation. City, county, state and federal government agencies (including the Capitol Building of the State of Ohio), several regional and national banks, insurance companies, and major corporate headquarters are all accessible without need for an automobile. neighborhood_overview:
Joel’s home is located in Columbus, Ohio, United States.
Located in the beautiful Italian Village neighborhood, this home is perfectly situated in the heart of the city. Just blocks away from High Street and the Short North attractions, Ohio State's main campus, OSU Wexner Medical Center, and Grandview. Several parks nearby and walking distance to local bars and restaurants.

On High Street you will find shopping, art galleries, bars, and some of the best restaurants in the city in the Short North Arts District. This area of Columbus is one of the city’s most popular destinations!

Notable nearby destinations: OSU Stadium, Nationwide Arena and the surrounding Arena District, Easton Towne Center, John Glenn International Airport, Columbus Convention Center, Nationwide Children’s Hospital, The Ohio Statehouse, and Franklin Park Conservatory.

description:
All Frontdesk stays are contactless self-check-in and include Scout, our exclusive digital companion to guide you through everything you'll need before and during your time with us. We're also available 24/7 via text or phone and have a local team should you need anything.
Guests are required to follow all regional and building-specific COVID-19 policies. We continue to employ a professional cleaning staff adhering to OSHA and CDC guidelines to make sure your stay is clean and comfortable.

The space
Our one-bedroom apartment is furnished with a queen bed, and a couch. It has everything you & your guests need to enjoy your stay in Columbus! The kitchen is adorned with stainless steel appliances, a Keurig coffee maker, and basic cookware to cook simple meals for a cozy night in! A washer and dryer are also available inside the apartment for your convenience.

A parking garage is located off-site, however it is paid at your own expense. Free street pa
neighborhood_overview: Our suite is nestled right in the heart of Downtown Columbus’ River South District. This recently-transformed neighborhood has quickly gone from a long-forgotten area to a vibrant urban destination with a burgeoning nightlife and arts scene. River South is home to some of the best bars, restaurants, and coffee shops that Columbus has to offer. Take in some fresh air in this river-side neighborhood and go for a walk along the Scioto Greenway and through Bicentennial Park.
host_about: Frontdesk offers trusted travelers exactly the stay they want - their kind of place, in their kind of neighborhood.

name: Rest and Recharge 3
description:
Hi and thanks for checking out our space! Katie and I (William) have a beautiful home built in 1900 that is located directly across from the historic Ohio Dominican University. Conveniently located minutes from the AIRPORT and within very easy access to i670/i270. Also a short drive/ride to downtown Columbus and the Short North. We have a minimum stay of 30 days.

The space
By booking with us you will have a private room (15x18) with a King sized bed and access to our WiFi. You will share a common bath located on the same floor and will also have access to the kitchen for filtered water, coffee and to store leftovers from dining out. We will also allow you to share the common dining room as well as have access to the laundry room.
host_about: I am a working professional currently at Abbott Nutrition. Columbus Ohio is home and I am a huge Ohio State fan! I love to travel and go on outdoor adventures around the world. As much as I enjoy to be active, being comfortable at home or while away is a top priority for me. I am also always excited to meet new friends!
